story:
Calling on all horror freaks around the world!

We here at the Evil For Dinner family want your help to make a badass horror film. We have a dedicated crew, hungry for the opportunity and a killer cast. Now we just need the final push to make it everything we dream it can be!

Three years ago, we made a short film, Evil For Dinner. It won an award at a German film festival because those Germans are madmen, and now it's streaming on Troma Now! And we're ready to unleash the feature version. It's going to be a wild, sexy, ultraviolent, Troma-inspired horror ride!

Evil For Dinner follows a family of cannibals who eat the evil to extend their lives. The wily patriarch, Howdy, faces a series of crises one fateful day, forcing him to examine his legacy.

His older daughter, December, has grown bitter and vengeful and increasingly doesn't care for the morals he tries to instill in his consumption of human flesh. His younger daughter, April, is itching to fly the coop with a nice boy - way too nice for this family. And his long-lost brother is riding into town to settle a grudge centuries old. The result is a bloodbath like nothing you've seen!

Our crew includes makeup artist Taylor Haggard, who works on the effects in Austin's infamous House of Torment! And we're thrilled with the cast who are going to be here, with two very special names. Howdy will be played by Kerry O'Quinn, known as one of the founders of Fangoria and Starlog magazines. And, in a cameo as the Mayor of Austin, we have the one and only Lloyd Kaufman, director of The Toxic Avenger and Tromeo and Juliet, founder of Troma Entertainment!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We have just wrapped filming, so the movie is in the can! And on Indiegogo, we can keep everything pledged to us, even if we don't make our goal. 

However, while the film is finished, there's still a long way to go! We have months of editing, sound mixing, color grading, and more, to finish the movie. Everything you send us will help us pay for the movie to get across the finish line, so our editor doesn't have to eat passerby to survive. If we raise enough, we'll also have time to shoot pickup shots and possibly even an additional day of shooting to get a few short scenes we didn't have time or money for during production.

For you, besides our eternal gratefulness, we have some amazing perks:

  • Every contribution at $10 or over gets your name, in the credits, on the screen!
  • We have perks at several levels for DVDs, Blu-Rays, Signed Posters, a Signed Script, all manner of goodies.
  • But then we really have the good stuff: you can not only appear in the film, you can get a big death scene, in the film! This is your chance for the immortality of a bloody on-screen death! (Just so long as you can make your own way to Austin, Texas for filming)
  • And, if you're generous beyond any normal measure, you can get an Executive Producer Credit, Not only do you get everything else, but if you can get down to Austin, we'll set up a special dinner and screening of insane, obscure horror movies, with the filmmakers!

 

The Impact

Every contribution is heartening! And by heartening, we mean we want to literally rip someone's heart out. Our incredible makeup artist can create some of the most spectacular effects ever put on the screen, but that costs money. And we can make the movie, but we can make a much better movie that includes all the scenes in the story, not just most of them.

Risks & Challenges

We already have some of our funding in place! We have investors and are investing in the film ourselves. The film has been shot and the footage is in the can. The risks, however, without this, are that the film's post-production process will take far, far longer, and we won't be able to get it looking or sounding as amazing as we want it to. We'll pour our hearts and souls into it, but scenes will have to be dropped, and we can't do a few of the most spectacular moments. We'll still make the picture, no matter who we have to kill to do it, but we want to do it right. 

Thank you so much for anything you can do!

story:
Hi Everyone, 

My name is Farzam Reza, producer and director of The Lives of Millions. I was born and raised in Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates. In Fall of 2016, I moved to the United States to pursue an education in Producing for Cinema-TV at Columbia College Hollywood. Throughout my three years here, I have met many students and faculty who have assisted me in honing in my skills to be prepared to bring my thesis film, The Lives of Millions, to life. 

What’s It About? 

Set in 2017, Salman has moved to the United States to begin this new journey in his life. Perceiving America as being the land of opportunity and dreams, he is placed in a dorm room with Adam, his racially ignorant roommate who consistently tries to provoke him. As Salman is sent down a spiral, he must find the courage to stand up against his tormentor to secure a space for himself that he can call his home and find safety. 

The Lives of Millions revolves around the idea of immigration, political and human division, and understanding. It is a story of compassion, empathy, and change. 

What We Need? 

The goal for this crowdfunding campaign is $8,700. That is a lot but before we ask you to donate to our project, we need to be transparent for what we’ll be using that money for. 

Art Department: We are artists after all, we want what is seen on the screen to look good. 

Crafty and Catering: Arguably one of the best spots on set is by the crafty table and we don’t want that table to be empty. Crafty is where all the food stays that is available for the cast and crew while filming. 

Equipment Rentals: All magicians need their tools, we need to give our filmmakers theirs. 

Locations: Let’s face it, we need to create the world and we can’t do that without locations. 

Permits: Please permit us to shoot at these different locations. 

Transportation: To pay for gas and the cars to transport our cast, crew, and equipment to set. 

Costumes: To create costumes that are appropriate to their own style and personality. 

Incentives

$5 — Thank You!

$15 — Digital Poster

$25 — Bi-Weekly Newsletter

$50 — Signed Script and Poster (Digitally) 

$100 — Special Thanks!

$250 —  Shooting Script + Prop + Extra in the film

$500 — Associate Producer  

$1000 — Executive Producer

Impact

The Lives of Millions is a story about an immigrant, a group of people who in recent years have been perceived as the enemy in many societies. With this film, I want to shine a light not only on the perspective of an Iranian immigrant but to restate what America was founded upon. America is a land of opportunities and dreams, where anyone, regardless of race, religion, gender, and ethnicity can come and create a better world for themselves. Salman is one of those millions of people around the world who either are forced out of their homelands or choose to search for a better home. 

This story is about embracing our differences and choosing to overlook them in hopes that through unity and acceptance we may build a better world for our future. Empathy is the foundation for which many of our worlds problems can be solved and with this film I want to change the way that we perceive people who are different. Film is an art form that has no borders where people of all backgrounds can watch this and appreciate the differences that we see in people all around us. 

Risk and Challenges 

As with everything in life, there is a risk to doing anything. We may not be able to find appropriate locations, not be able to raise the ideal amount of money, have to change our plans at any given moment. However, there is one thing that won’t change, our love and dedication to this project. No one has ever made a film that they were not passionate about and this project is no exception. The team who supports me and this concept are the reason why this film will succeed no matter the circumstances. I choose to believe that our talents and our motivation will make this a film that will reach audiences and will make everyone who has invested their resources (both time and money) proud. 

Other Ways To Help 

If you are unable to donate to the campaign, that is okay. By sharing it onto your own social media and tagging our own pages, you can help just as much to the success of this production. Your advice and recommendations are our greatest assets. 

Facebook: The Lives of Millions (https://www.facebook.com/thelivesofmillionsfilm) 

Instagram: @thelivesofmillionsfilm (https://www.instagram.com/thelivesofmillionsfilm) 

Exposure and awareness is one of the greatest resources that we have during this process. 

Please follow us on our social media accounts and reach out. 

Thank you, 

Farzam Reza

story:
Overview

We need your support in financing this exciting short suspense film. It will blend old school cinema of the 1930's German expressionism all the way to modern films inspired by famous auteurs. The story centers around a strong female character, unexpectedly and unwillingly, drawn into a threatening circumstance. One that would question the essence of morality, the right and wrong.

DON'T SHOOT THE MESSENGER

We are a team of ambitious and passionate creative people. Although each of us come from a different background we have the same goal, to make engaging original films.

The idea came to Oscar years back and only in 2018 that he decided to develop it. The one line idea, became a 15 page screenplay and with countless revisions it's now in its (almost) final state. With your generous help, it's finally ready to be produced!

The story centers around a strong female character, unexpectedly and unwillingly, drawn into a threatening circumstance. One that would question the essence of morality, the right and wrong.

As Charlie rests at a diner on her way to the cottage late at night, a stranger leaves her a  disturbing message: "Don't leave the diner, you'll die".

Inspired by legends of cinema from the likes of Fritz Lang, François truffaut and Wong Kar Wai, Don't Shoot the Messenger aims to blend different styles in its narrative and cinematography.

CHECK OUT THE COMPLETE MOOD BOARD AND THE DIRECTOR'S TREATMENT.

 

Yeimy Daza | Producer     


Natalia Aranguren | Producer     

 


Artem Mykhailetskyi | Director of Photography

     

Martin-André Young | Consultant Producer    

Marc Fourreau | Film Editor

 

  

Oscar Karam | Writer and Director

I'm a great believer that you can produce quality movies with little budget. What you need the most is a solid story, talented people and tons of commitment.

One of my previous projects 'PEARSON' was self financed with a micro budget.

As filmmakers we want to translate an idea into the best film we can produce. We'll aim to make the festival circuit, from local to international festivals. We're also committed in further developing this idea and pitching it to studios for adaptation as a feature film or a TV series!

Our immediate focus is to produce an awesome original movie that stands apart from the rest and at the same time entertain the s*** out of you!

Here's how the budget will be distributed.

A | ACTORS - 10%
(Four speaking roles - no extras)

B | CREW - 29%
(15-20 team members)

C | EQUIPMENT - 17%

D | ACCESSORIES - 13%
(Set, costumes, props, vehicles)

E | LOCATION - 14%
(Diner, permits, insurance)

F | CATERING - 7%

G | CONTINGENCY - 10%

We can't do this project without your generous support. We know that not everyone can contribute financially so we tremendously appreciate if you'll share this page on social media.

If you can help us fund the movie, browse for any perk that you might like. You might end up with an amazing original t-shirt or spend a day on the movie set or attend a VIP party or all the above!

We're immensely grateful for any help you can offer!

POSTER

 

T-SHIRTS

 

ARTWORKS

 

POSTCARDS

  

*We couldn't have made our teasers for this campaign without the generous help of Jim's Lunch at 28 Oxford 2, Princeton, ON N0J 1V0

*Kudos to Qing Yang for the amazing black and white artwork!

story:
Overview

A Bike Ride Home is a slow cinema short film about cycling. It centers on Carrie- a woman who has lost faith in many of the structures she has come to know. She no longer trusts in her government, or believes she will find success within capitalism, and she is conscious that her time here may be lessened by climate change- the warming of the planet making it uninhabitable, someday. Simultaneously, she is grieving the loss of her mother, and reconfiguring how to engage with what is around her when it feels unrecognizable. All of these concerns come to fruition on one of her final days at a Temp job, and we spend the rest of the film with Carrie on her bicycle as she rides home experiencing and interacting with the city.

 

Slow cinema is a deeply important form of cinema to me. Our time is itemized through our participation in capitalism- it is something to spend, or waste- and through slow cinema, I have found manners to gain back my time, and feel its passing, in a worthwhile manner. It is a genre that gives one space to lose themselves in images, it does not take hold and demand your every thought. I hope that when watching this film, viewers are able to feel the weight of their time, and don't feel that it flew by as they watched. It creates the same sensation I feel sometimes when riding my bicycle. There are no technological distractions, or matters of my life to take away from images of life and city filtering by me as I ride, and I hope that this experience can be translated through the film we make. —Emma

 

 

 

Who We Are:
 

Emma Jane: Writer, Director, Scorer, Editor

(Second Photo by Omari Spears)

 

Leena Kardacz: Producer

 

 

Chassidy David: Director of Photography

 

 

Kate Gondwe: First Assistant Director

 

This is our core- but we have built a team of dedicated filmmakers and slow cinema lovers who are eager to make this film come to life!

 

Budget

Total: $4000

Because we are creating this project as part of the BFA Film program at Emerson College, our project is guaranteed a $500 grant from the institution. We are hoping to crowd fund the remaining $3500, and use any extra funds to cover the percentage taken by the IndieGoGo platform, and any other unforeseen costs. 

We have a flexible goal for this project, however it is crucial for us to meet our goal to not dip too heavily into our own savings to fund this film. This breakdown displays what the money raised will contribute to- if our goal is not met the funds will go to the most crucial components of our production: van rentals, equipment, and feeding our Cast and Crew. 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people may not be able to contribute financially- but there are other ways you can help! Sharing this campaign on social media, or with your friends and family, can amplify our project and our message, and is still helpful towards our goal!

story:
Overview

Broken Magnet Productions has a collective goal similar to the film itself. In mainstream comic book culture, many voices are refused. Historically, the only voices that reach the mainstream are those of the dominant class, white cisgender males. At Broken Magnet Productions, we believe that all voices are important and should be heard. Our goal is to bring a new wave of comic book culture to the mainstream for all to enjoy. Bringing new and upcoming content creators of varying gender identities and races to the forefront of the industry.

 

The Story

The Hero’s Artist, which follows Nathan Collins, a queer teen of colour who struggles with sharing his voice with the world, and his journey fighting with his brainchild of a hero to show that even someone like him can be a hero.

The Artist:

Obsessed with comic books, Jacob’s main goal is to have a superhero story featuring a hero that’s like him told to the world. Jacob, a black, gay, introverted 25 year old is currently a barista who is always making doodles in the form of latte art and drawing quick little comics and cartoon characters on the sides of coffee cups. After being an out gay male for over 5 years, he feels that his father is still not comfortable with his sexuality and feels he hasn’t truly been connected to his father since. Tired of producing comics featuring the same heroes and stories over and over again, a passionate young lesbian publisher takes a chance on Jacobs story, his whole life changes.

The Hero:

Nathan is a 25-year-old black gay man. He is stocky and built like an athlete since his father/trainer was a professional boxer. Constantly over thinking what others might see of him, his paranoia has developed into a mind reading ability. Nathan dislikes the hero’s he sees in his city and is unable to relate to any of them. He doesn’t care if the whole city knows about the heroic acts he does, he just cares that they’re being done. He does not want to be a token for the black community, mainly because he feels he isn’t enough.

 

The Team

Broken Magnet Productions is a group of students who are determined to bring to light voices who have been silenced. Some of us come to this project with that experience. One would think an industry so vast would include a diverse cast, unfortunately it’s not the case. We are trying to create something that could be admired by everyone for years to come.

Director: Malachi Ellis

Why ‘The Hero’s Artist’: Malachi has always looked up to superheroes as role models but never saw himself in them. Being queer and black made it hard for him to find ones he related to. That is why he is determined to create stories and characters that young people can someday look up to and see themselves represented.

 

Writer: Joey Hodgson

Why ‘The Hero’s Artist’: From the moment Malachi mentioned his idea for this film, he immediately wanted to be a part of it. He has such a love for comic book movies and want nothing more than for all kids to be able to look up to a hero that they can relate to, something he wasn’t able to do growing up as a member of the queer community.

 

Co-Technical Lead and Location Manager: Manny Bissell-Barahona

Why ‘The Hero’s Artist’: A lifelong DC fan, Manny is always looking for new and innovative ways to bring representation of marginalized communities to comics. As a person of mixed race, he knows that there is so much more comics can do to promote diversity and acceptance in writing and see ‘The Hero’s Artist’ as fresh take on a classic genre.

 

Co-Technical Lead and Creative Lead: Heather Ngo

Why ‘The Hero’s Artist’: As someone who absolutely adores cartoons and animation, superhero movies often crossed paths with them. Heather is excited to design and create epic soundscapes and effects for this movie. As a woman of colour, she’s excited to be working on what would not only be an amazing film, but also one that promotes diversity in the superhero world.

 

1st AC & Gaffer: Mark Flanjak

Why ‘The Hero’s Artist’: Superhero movies are an extremely popular genre in film right now, and almost impossible to ignore. Mark is excited to be working on a superhero film that encompasses alternative themes and characters, to tell a unique and modern story that daringly strays from the norm.

 

Marketing Lead: Harrison Lester

Why ‘The Hero’s Artist’: He decided to join the production team because he wanted to be part of something that was going to start a much-needed conversation. In this case, spurring the conversation surrounding the lack of representation of coloured and queer superheroes in comics and film.

 

The Objective

When people begin to think of their favourite superhero, an assortment of them come to mind. Although the heroes come in different shapes, sizes, and powers, several key similarities between the heroes arise. Whether mainstream or independent, these superheroes seem to follow a cookie cutter formula: from their inception into life on earth, white, muscular, and cisgender male figures use their out-worldly powers to fight evil with the end goal of proving themselves to everyone around them. This formula has limited the voices of anyone ‘different’ from being heard. Showcasing the likes of a queer comic book artist of colour, our film aims to prove that anyone, regardless of skin colour or gender identity, could be a hero. 

We believe that our film could do great things which is why we want to feature our film throughout Black History Month which falls in February of 2020. In order to achieve this goal, we need your help! Whether you are a friend, family, or just a passerby, every donation helps! Your donations will give a lot of people a voice in a world that has limited it. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that you may not be able to donate to our project, but here are some other ways you can support us and our objectives.

Firstly, give us a follow and like our social media accounts:

  • Facebook - @theherosartist
  • Instagram - @theherosartist

It’s these mediums where you will be able to keep updates on out film, see behind the scenes content as well as help us spread awareness. Don’t forget to share, like, and comment our posts! You do not understand how much that little act will assist us in achieving our goal!
story_txt:
OverviewBroken Magnet Productions has a collective goal similar to the film itself. In mainstream comic book culture, many voices are refused. Historically, the only voices that reach the mainstream are those of the dominant class, white cisgender males. At Broken Magnet Productions, we believe that all voices are important and should be heard. Our goal is to bring a new wave of comic book culture to the mainstream for all to enjoy. Bringing new and upcoming content creators of varying gender identities and races to the forefront of the industry. The StoryThe Hero’s Artist, which follows Nathan Collins, a queer teen of colour who struggles with sharing his voice with the world, and his journey fighting with his brainchild of a hero to show that even someone like him can be a hero.The Artist:Obsessed with comic books, Jacob’s main goal is to have a superhero story featuring a hero that’s like him told to the world. Jacob, a black, gay, introverted 25 year old is currently a barista who is always making doodles in the form of latte art and drawing quick little comics and cartoon characters on the sides of coffee cups. After being an out gay male for over 5 years, he feels that his father is still not comfortable with his sexuality and feels he hasn’t truly been connected to his father since. Tired of producing comics featuring the same heroes and stories over and over again, a passionate young lesbian publisher takes a chance on Jacobs story, his whole life changes.The Hero:Nathan is a 25-year-old black gay man. He is stocky and built like an athlete since his father/trainer was a professional boxer. Constantly over thinking what others might see of him, his paranoia has developed into a mind reading ability. Nathan dislikes the hero’s he sees in his city and is unable to relate to any of them. He doesn’t care if the whole city knows about the heroic acts he does, he just cares that they’re being done. He does not want to be a token for the black community, mainly because he feels he isn’t enough. The TeamBroken Magnet Productions is a group of students who are determined to bring to light voices who have been silenced. Some of us come to this project with that experience. One would think an industry so vast would include a diverse cast, unfortunately it’s not the case. We are trying to create something that could be admired by everyone for years to come.Director: Malachi EllisWhy ‘The Hero’s Artist’: Malachi has always looked up to superheroes as role models but never saw himself in them. Being queer and black made it hard for him to find ones he related to. That is why he is determined to create stories and characters that young people can someday look up to and see themselves represented. Writer: Joey HodgsonWhy ‘The Hero’s Artist’: From the moment Malachi mentioned his idea for this film, he immediately wanted to be a part of it. As a person of mixed race, he knows that there is so much more comics can do to promote diversity and acceptance in writing and see ‘The Hero’s Artist’ as fresh take on a classic genre. Co-Technical Lead and Creative Lead: Heather NgoWhy ‘The Hero’s Artist’: As someone who absolutely adores cartoons and animation, superhero movies often crossed paths with them. Heather is excited to design and create epic soundscapes and effects for this movie. As a woman of colour, she’s excited to be working on what would not only be an amazing film, but also one that promotes diversity in the superhero world. 1st AC & Gaffer: Mark FlanjakWhy ‘The Hero’s Artist’: Superhero movies are an extremely popular genre in film right now, and almost impossible to ignore. Mark is excited to be working on a superhero film that encompasses alternative themes and characters, to tell a unique and modern story that daringly strays from the norm. Marketing Lead: Harrison LesterWhy ‘The Hero’s Artist’: He decided to join the production team because he wanted to be part of something that was going to start a much-needed conversation. In this case, spurring the conversation surrounding the lack of representation of coloured and queer superheroes in comics and film. The ObjectiveWhen people begin to think of their favourite superhero, an assortment of them come to mind. Although the heroes come in different shapes, sizes, and powers, several key similarities between the heroes arise. Whether mainstream or independent, these superheroes seem to follow a cookie cutter formula: from their inception into life on earth, white, muscular, and cisgender male figures use their out-worldly powers to fight evil with the end goal of proving themselves to everyone around them. This formula has limited the voices of anyone ‘different’ from being heard. Showcasing the likes of a queer comic book artist of colour, our film aims to prove that anyone, regardless of skin colour or gender identity, could be a hero. We believe that our film could do great things which is why we want to feature our film throughout Black History Month which falls in February of 2020. In order to achieve this goal, we need your help! Whether you are a friend, family, or just a passerby, every donation helps! story:
MEN-Strual is a short film based on men waking up with a period. This film is being produced, directed, and edited all by a team of young female filmmakers at Missouri State University. The ladies of MEN-Strual only ask for a simple donation to help fund the film's small budget. Your donation will go towards the catering to the cast and crew as well as production materials and more importantly...tampons! Or should we say....manpons! 

Here is our sponsorship levels!

  • Donation of $10: A mention in the credits
  • Donation of $20: A mention in the credits and a signed poster from the cast and crew
  • Donation of $30: A mention in the credits, a signed poster from the cast and crew, and behind the scenes footage and bloopers!

We want to start a conversation about the period. It's time to end the stigma. We need to be comfortable talking about something that is so normal!

story:
About It's a Life.

  • It's a Life is a dramedy about Michelle, who is a struggling actress in LA who suffers from anxiety and a severe case of scopaesthesia. Her father  is also her therapist, this dichotomy creates an amusing, heart warming dynamic between father and daughter.  Michelle ends up refusing to take her meds after a life of being prescribed a fist full of pills. This causes her scopaesthesia and anxiety amp up, thus revealing to her that the feeling of being constantly watched is due to her being in a TV show, or is it she maybe creating this illusion in her head?  With her being the only person who now knows she is in a TV show, she now can be herself, with no restraints. In the end being true to yourself and who you are is all that matters. Is she "crazy" ? Or is this the role she was always meant to play?

  • Rosario Columbia and Cash Evans are a writing team dedicated to bringing inspirational, thought provoking, and funny content to audiences worldwide. They have both worked on a multitude of indie projects that required true passion and love toward the art of cinema.  We have chosen the web-series route in order to keep full creative control of the project, as to not stray away from its originality. 
  • With your help we can take this tiny skeleton crew of ours, and make something truly beautiful. Mental illness isn't new, but what is new is the medication that is thrown at us vs actually getting help and overall acceptance that not every person is "black or white", there is always some grey in the middle that makes us  all unique and wonderful. Hopefully this web series can shed some light on anyone going through a rough time, and who seeks acceptance. 

 

The Main Team!

Co-Creator/Writer/Michelle : Cash Evans : IMBD LINK 

Co-Creator/Writer/Producer: Rosario Columbia : IMDB LINK

Director : Christopher Sheffield :  IMDB LINK

Role of John(Michelles Father): Dejean Brown : IMDB LINK

What Your Awesomeness Will Do For us.

  • To make episodes 1 - 8 , we will need the full goal of $20,000. All of the funds will go to properly move the project forward, from Pre-Production, to Post-Production!
  • With the full goal, we will be able to hire the neccessary crew needed to film such a production.
  • If we do not meet the goal, we will utilize the flex goal and still make the proper amount of episodes the flex goal allows. 

Risks & Challenges

  • With a smaller crew, we face a harder, stricter work schedule. However, the end result remains no different than a full sized crew. 
  • The full goal of $20,000 will make it so we can expand the crew beyond our main team, to help us properly space out each shoot day, as to not drain the whole crew on a longer, more compact work day. 
  • Some of our actors are SAG, this is one of the reasons why it is important to gather all of the funds needed, specifically due to the high cost of the New-Media insurance coverage, as well as set cost, cost for background actors, and crew cost. Even down to the cost of festival submission, it all adds up. very quickly. 

Other Ways You Can Be Amazing!

  • By simply sharing the project on social media! We would love you to the moon and back!

About It's a Life.

It's a Life is a dramedy about Michelle, who is a struggling actress in LA who suffers from anxiety and a severe case of scopaesthesia. Her father  is also her therapist, this dichotomy creates an amusing, heart warming dynamic between father and daughter.  Michelle ends up refusing to take her meds after a life of being prescribed a fist full of pills. This causes her scopaesthesia and anxiety amp up, thus revealing to her that the feeling of being constantly watched is due to her being in a TV show, or is it she maybe creating this illusion in her head?  With her being the only person who now knows she is in a TV show, she now can be herself, with no restraints. In the end being true to yourself and who you are is all that matters. Is she "crazy" ? Or is this the role she was always meant to play?



Rosario Columbia and Cash Evans are a writing team dedicated to bringing inspirational, thought provoking, and funny content to audiences worldwide. They have both worked on a multitude of indie projects that required true passion and love toward the art of cinema.  We have chosen the web-series route in order to keep full creative control of the project, as to not stray away from its originality. 
With your help we can take this tiny skeleton crew of ours, and make something truly beautiful. Mental illness isn't new, but what is new is the medication that is thrown at us vs actually getting help and overall acceptance that not every person is "black or white", there is always some grey in the middle that makes us  all unique and wonderful. Hopefully this web series can shed some light on anyone going through a rough time, and who seeks acceptance. 

 
The Main Team!
Co-Creator/Writer/Michelle : Cash Evans : IMBD LINK 
Co-Creator/Writer/Producer: Rosario Columbia : IMDB LINK
Director : Christopher Sheffield :  IMDB LINK
Role of John(Michelles Father): Dejean Brown : IMDB LINK
What Your Awesomeness Will Do For us.

To make episodes 1 - 8 , we will need the full goal of $20,000. All of the funds will go to properly move the project forward, from Pre-Production, to Post-Production!
With the full goal, we will be able to hire the neccessary crew needed to film such a production.
If we do not meet the goal, we will utilize the flex goal and still make the proper amount of episodes the flex goal allows. 



Risks & Challenges

With a smaller crew, we face a harder, stricter work schedule. However, the end result remains no different than a full sized crew. 
The full goal of $20,000 will make it so we can expand the crew beyond our main team, to help us properly space out each shoot day, as to not drain the whole crew on a longer, more compact work day. 
Some of our actors are SAG, this is one of the reasons why it is important to gather all of the funds needed, specifically due to the high cost of the New-Media insurance coverage, as well as set cost, cost for background actors, and crew cost. Even down to the cost of festival submission, it all adds up. very quickly. 


Other Ways You Can Be Amazing!
By simply sharing the project on social media! We would love you to the moon and back!

story:
We are two brothers (Harry and George), who run a production company called K&K Productions. We are producer/directors with a passion for viral videos, short films and promo work, both online and for Television. We have developed a niche in high action, VFX driven content and have got to work on some amazing projects over the last few years. We also run a successful YouTube channel under the same name and have over 40 million views on our videos. Want proof?! Check out a short montage of our work below.

 

More importantly we are huge comic book geeks! We both grew up on comics of all types and we are still avid readers today.

Having previously made short films about Batman, The Flash and other heroes, we are now turning our attention to one of our favorite Marvel characters...CABLE! This amazing character has yet to be showcased in live action and we think it's about damn time! With still well over a year until we see him appear in Deadpool 2, we thought we would wet your appetite with a ten minute short film based on our favorite cable story line 'The Second Coming'. This will mean some of your favorite characters will appear, including Hope Summers and X-mens Nightcrawler in a hugely action packed short.

Second Coming" was the final part of a trilogy of stories that began with "Messiah Complex" and continued in "Messiah War". In this story almost the entire Mutant population has been wiped out, with no new mutants being born. Until 'Hope' is born. She is the mutant Messiah and the mutant put in charge of keeping her alive is Cable!


We want to make sure that the character of Cable is treated with the respect he deserves, so we will make the short film as high end as possible. The Second Coming is such a great story, that we feel needs to be told in live action. As this is a passion project, we have already invested our own funds to get things started, but we will need a little help from you guys to complete the project.

To do this we will need $3000 to help pay for some essentials. This will include;

  • Higher costs for a high end 4k camera to make sure the film is captured in the best possible quality.

  • Location costs – We plan to shoot at a large derelict mansion, which will pose as Xaviers school for the gifted. This kind of location will really give the film an authentic feel.

  • Props – We are working with some excellent props makers to create awesome stuff like cables huge guns and his cybernetic arm. These need to look completely accurate and real, to draw you as the audience into Cables world.

  • VFX – We will be taking on a large amount of the VFX ourselves, but there are some things that are out of our remit. (Nightcrawlers tail for example) So we have some very cool VFX houses, including the hugely talented Mega Stud.io willing to help us out and deliver Hollywood level visuals.


As well as co-directing over twenty short films, including the hugely popular live action 'DagonBall Z: Saiyan Saga', George is also a very successful Stunt Man. He has worked on some of the biggest productions in the world including 'Star Wars: Force Awakens', 'Rogue one', 'Game of thrones' and recently doubled Benedict Cumberbatch in Marvels 'Doctor Strange'. So he knows superhero action and stunts better than anyone.

Along with George, Harry has directed over twenty films, including 'DBZ Saiyan Saga', 'Batman: The Bloody Valentine' and 'League of Legends: Blind Ambition'. His content has garnered over 40 million views online and that number is rising all of the time. Harry is a huge comic book geek and can't wait to bring Cable into live action.

We think Solvi has the perfect look for the character of Cable and luckily for us he is a great actor and a massive fan of Marvel comics. He is possibly the perfect casting.

Often called Renaissance Man by mass media, Sölvi Fannar is an actor, model, multi-sport athlete, poet and performance artist. He is also an agent for actor and strongman Thor / Hafþór Júlíus Björnson (The Mountain, from Game of Thrones).

Christine is an excellent actress with a wide range of experience, from short films to features like 'Maria'. Plus she is a black belt in Taekwondo , so can kick some serious ass! We feel she really embodies the character of Hope.

Grant is an extremely talented martial artist and frankly one of the most insane kickers/trickers you will ever have the pleasure of watching in action. We plan to put these skills to good use and take NightCrawlers abilities to a whole new level.

Phillip Ray Tommy is an Independent Film maker, actor and trainee stuntman. A self confessed film addict, his love for film started at an early age when he saw Hooper for the first time.

Standing at over 6ft 2, Phillip is a real tree trunk of a man and he will make a great Bishop.


We’ve designed the perks to be as cool, fun, and worthwhile as possible to the invested fans. Above all else, we want to make something we know people will be proud to be a part of. We know the story we want to tell, we know how we want to do it. We also know how important characters like Cable are to the fans, so we want to involve you guys! 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are aware that not everyone can contribute to projects like this, but there are still lots of away you can help make this live action Cable film happen.

  • Spread the word - You would be massively helping us just by sharing this page. That way, it might find it's way in front of someone that can contribute, which will bring us closer to our goal.
  • Interact on our social media - We will be sharing updates, images and video across our social media. Check out our pages and share those posts. That will also help to spread the word.
Check out our YouTube, Facebook, Twitter and Instagram for regular updates.

If you help this project in anyway, you have our eternal gratitude. You are literally making our dreams come true by allowing us to bring this film to life! So thank you.


  • 1) When will the rewards become available / be shipped? Each Perk has an Estimated Delivery month listed in description. You will be notified of any delays. Digital deliveries will be sent out as an email after the end of the campaign as downloadable links.
  • 2) What name will be used for the credits? We hope to use your real name, and we will ask you for your real name as part of the post­-campaign survey. We may ask for a copy of proof of your identity and name. We may consider the option of using your Indiegogo username or an alternate name. If you want to put someone else’s name in the credits (a friend or family member), you will be able to submit their name in the survey
  • 3) How do I give you my details and preferences (like shirt size)? Once the project has ended, we will email you a survey to ask for all the info we need to make sure you get your perk. That’s when you can give us details like shipping address, and your preferences. We expect to get the survey out to you immediately following the end of the campaign.
  • 4) What if my address changes? If you move before the perks are shipped out, get in touch with us via your Indiegogo account as soon as you can and we'll do our best to accommodate the change.
  • 5) What if the perk I want it sold out? If a perk is sold out, it's sold out. Sorry! If you miss out, we’ll be adding a few more awesome perks throughout the month, so make sure to follow the campaign and keep checking back often!
  • 6) Can I change my perk? If you decide you’d like to change or upgrade your perk to another one, get in touch with us via the campaign and we’ll see if we can help you out. Or follow this link for instructions: https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles...
  • 7) Can I claim more than one perk? Each contribution made is recorded as a separate contribution with a separate perk. So, if one awesome perk is not enough for you, all you have to do is make separate transactions for as many separate perks as you want!
  • 8) What if I want to pledge/make a contribution for a friend or family member? You make your pledge or contribution out to anyone you want! At the end of the campaign we will send out a survey to collect the information we need to fulfill your perks. In that survey you will be able to specify a name and address for the perks to be made out to.
  • 9) How do I know if my contribution has been successful? If your contribution is successful, an automatic confirmation email will be sent to the email address you provided during the contribution process.
  • 10) I tried to make a contribution but it was unsuccessful. There are a few reasons why your contribution may not have gone through. Check out a list of common contribution errors for a possible solution. If you don’t see your problem there, let us know and we’ll see if we can figure it out.
  • 11) I posted a question to the campaign. Will I get a response? We get many questions every day and have some wonderful people monitoring them! You can be sure someone will read your question, and will try to answer as soon as possible. Even if you don’t get a response, please know someone is manning the pumps, and your concern or question is being considered by our team.
  • 12) What is the campaign currency? We are raising all of our funds in USD.
  • 13) How will you use my contact information? We will only use your personal information to contact you for the survey, provide your perk and any of the items or services you've requested, respond to any inquiries from you, and to keep you updated on the progress of our Indiegogo campaign.
  • 14) Do you get my email address? We do not get any of your contact information until the campaign is completed. During the campaign, we can only contact you through the Indiegogo page itself, and Indiegogo does not give us your address. W​hen the campaign is completed, we are able to get from Indiegogo the email addresses our Backers have provided to Indiegogo.​We value your privacy, and we will not share any of our Backer’s email addresses with any other party except as needed to fulfill your perk. We will only use the personal information you provide to contact you for the survey, provide your perk and any of the items or services you have requested (including providing subscription access to and updates from the page), respond to any inquiries from you, and to keep you updated on the progress of our Indiegogo campaign. 
  • 15) What if I forgot to include the additional shipping cost in my contribution/pledge?
    All shipping is done automatically at the checkout. Just simply follow steps once you've selected a perk!
  • 16)I want an AddOn Perk and another Perk. That's easy! You just have to make a separate purchase because indiegogo won't allow you to buy more than one perk per purchase.
  • 17) Who is running the IndieGoGo campaign? The campaign is being run by Harry & George Kirby with help from the team and IndieGoGo.

kickers/trickers you will ever have the pleasure of watching in
action. We plan to put these skills to good use and take 
NightCrawlers abilities to a whole new level.






Phillip
Ray Tommy is an Independent Film maker, actor and trainee stuntman. A
self confessed film addict, his love for film started at an early age
when he saw Hooper for the first time.

Standing
at over 6ft 2, Phillip is a real tree trunk of a man and he will make
a great Bishop.



We’ve designed the perks to be as cool, fun, and worthwhile as possible to the invested fans. Above all else, we want to make something we know people will be proud to be a part of. We know the story we want to tell, we know how we want to do it. We also know how important characters like Cable are to the fans, so we want to involve you guys! 






Other Ways You Can Help


We are aware that not everyone can contribute to projects like this, but there are still lots of away you can help make this live action Cable film happen.


Spread the word - You would be massively helping us just by sharing this page. That way, it might find it's way in front of someone that can contribute, which will bring us closer to our goal.
Interact on our social media - We will be sharing updates, images and video across our social media. Check out our pages and share those posts. That will also help to spread the word.

Check out our YouTube, Facebook, Twitter and Instagram for regular updates.
If you help this project in anyway, you have our eternal gratitude. You are literally making our dreams come true by allowing us to bring this film to life! So thank you.



1) When will the rewards become available / be shipped? Each Perk has an Estimated Delivery month listed in description. You will be notified of any delays. Digital deliveries will be sent out as an email after the end of the campaign as downloadable links.
2) What name will be used for the credits? We hope to use your real name, and we will ask you for your real name as part of the post­-campaign survey. We may ask for a copy of proof of your identity and name. We may consider the option of using your Indiegogo username or an alternate name. If you want to put someone else’s name in the credits (a friend or family member), you will be able to submit their name in the survey
3) How do I give you my details and preferences (like shirt size)? Once the project has ended, we will email you a survey to ask for all the info we need to make sure you get your perk. That’s when you can give us details like shipping address, and your preferences. We expect to get the survey out to you immediately following the end of the campaign.
4) What if my address changes? If you move before the perks are shipped out, get in touch with us via your Indiegogo account as soon as you can and we'll do our best to accommodate the change.
5) What if the perk I want it sold out? If a perk is sold out, it's sold out. Sorry! If you miss out, we’ll be adding a few more awesome perks throughout the month, so make sure to follow the campaign and keep checking back often!
6) Can I change my perk? If you decide you’d like to change or upgrade your perk to another one, get in touch with us via the campaign and we’ll see if we can help you out. Or follow this link for instructions: https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles...

7) Can I claim more than one perk? Each contribution made is recorded as a separate contribution with a separate perk. So, if one awesome perk is not enough for you, all you have to do is make separate transactions for as many separate perks as you want!
8) What if I want to pledge/make a contribution for a friend or family member? You make your pledge or contribution out to anyone you want! At the end of the campaign we will send out a survey to collect the information we need to fulfill your perks. In that survey you will be able to specify a name and address for the perks to be made out to.
9) How do I know if my contribution has been successful? If your contribution is successful, an automatic confirmation email will be sent to the email address you provided during the contribution process.
10) I tried to make a contribution but it was unsuccessful. There are a few reasons why your contribution may not have gone through. Check out a list of common contribution errors for a possible solution. If you don’t see your problem there, let us know and we’ll see if we can figure it out.
11) I posted a question to the campaign. Will I get a response? We get many questions every day and have some wonderful people monitoring them! You can be sure someone will read your question, and will try to answer as soon as possible. Even if you don’t get a response, please know someone is manning the pumps, and your concern or question is being considered by our team.
12) What is the campaign currency? We are raising all of our funds in USD.
13) How will you use my contact information? We will only use your personal information to contact you for the survey, provide your perk and any of the items or services you've requested, respond to any inquiries from you, and to keep you updated on the progress of our Indiegogo campaign.
14) Do you get my email address? We do not get any of your contact information until the campaign is completed. During the campaign, we can only contact you through the Indiegogo page itself, and Indiegogo does not give us your address. W​hen the campaign is completed, we are able to get from Indiegogo the email addresses our Backers have provided to Indiegogo.​We value your privacy, and we will not share any of our Backer’s email addresses with any other party except as needed to fulfill your perk. We will only use the personal information you provide to contact you for the survey, provide your perk and any of the items or services you have requested (including providing subscription access to and updates from the page), respond to any inquiries from you, and to keep you updated on the progress of our Indiegogo campaign. 
15) What if I forgot to include the additional shipping cost in my contribution/pledge?All shipping is done automatically at the checkout. Just simply follow steps once you've selected a perk!
16)I want an AddOn Perk and another Perk. That's easy! You just have to make a separate purchase because indiegogo won't allow you to buy more than one perk per purchase.
17) Who is running the IndieGoGo campaign? The campaign is being run by Harry & George Kirby with help from the team and IndieGoGo.

story:
WHAT WE ARE DOING AND WHY WE ARE DOING IT!

As we head excitedly into our third year we are growing again by adding India to our partnership countries!! In January 2017 we will welcome 2 girls from the favelas of Rio de Janeiro, Brasil, 2 girls from Port-au-Prince, Haiti AND 2 girls from the slums of Mumbai, India!! 

In Brazil we continue to partner with the NGO Soccer Girls Inc., and in Haiti we are also in our second year of collaboration with Foundation TOYA.  Our third collaborative partner is Kranti, an NGO located in Mumbai that works to empower and educate young women who are the daughters of sex workers and have grown up in Mumbai's red-light district.  All three partner organizations have a shared mission to educate, motivate, and empower young women from poor and disadvantaged situations.  Collectively, we know that confident, educated, and empowered young women have the ability to become agents of change within their own communities and can work to create meaningful social and community projects within their own communities. While living with host families in the United States the girls will:

1.  Attend Star Prep Academy, a local private high school, and take grade level as well as ESL classes.

2. Attend twice-weekly community development and social skill workshops offered by Los Angeles-based business women and college students.

3.  Work with local professionals in the community development field to develop their own community projects that will be implemented within their own communities back in their home countries of Brazil, Haiti, and India.

4.  Participate in cross-cultural groups and activities with American teenagers at Star Prep Academy and within the Greater Los Angeles area.

5.  Participate in a Wilderness Adventure Camp to help them to challenge themselves, physically, mentally, and emotionally. 

HOW YOU CAN HELP

Your donations will go towards so many different parts of the program and you can check out the list at the bottom under "Where Your Money Will Go", for more details.

Here are some more specific donations you can give:

$20 will pay for one week of Allowance for one girl while she is in the U.S.
$63 will pay for one Brazilian Passport

$93 will pay for one Haitian Passport

$100 will pay for one week of the monthly stipend for a host family in the U.S.

$150 will pay for travel insurance for one girl for a two-month period

$160 will pay for one U.S. Visa for our participants

$200 will pay for clothing for one girl while she is in the U.S.

$250 will pay for one Education Stipend, which each girl receives upon implementation of her project

$250 will pay for entrance fees for outings for one girl for the two-months.

$500 will pay for one round-trip ticket from Haiti to the U.S.

$500 will pay for one year of secondary school education for one of our Haitian girls.

$1000 will pay for one round-trip ticket from Brazil and India to the U.S.

THE CHANGE YOU WILL HELP SUPPORT

The girls that will participate in these exchanges are bright, motivated, and excited to become agents of change in their own communities.  These girls have been hand selected by their home organizations and Global Girl Project because they have demonstrated leadership skills and a desire to help others that are in need.  Each girl is already thinking about the community project that she wants to implement after the exchange, once she returns home.  Each girl will start a project that will then educate, empower, and motivate other young people in their communities.  And so the cycle will continue as each young person affected will pay it forward.  As well, the students of the local high school in Los Angeles will be greatly affected.  Each student will be exposed to a different culture, a different language and through that exposure, will become more open to and understanding of the differences and similarities throughout the world.

We at the Global Girl Project know that real and long lasting change for a community is most successful when it comes from within that community. 

WHERE YOUR MONEY WILL GO

In order to provide an exchange opportunity such as this to young women from disadvantaged backgrounds we must fund all aspects of this project.  The money you donate will go towards:

 1.  Purchase of round trip plane tickets

      Rio to LA - $1000 per ticket (2 tickets) = $2000

      Port au Prince to LA - $500 per ticket (2 tickets) = $1000

 2.  Purchase of Student visas

      U.S. Visas - $160 per visa (6 visas) = $960

 3.  Purchase of passports for the girls

       Brazilian Passports - $63 (2 passports) = $126

       Haitian Passports - $93 (2 passports) = $186

4.  Help pay for the fee of the Wilderness Adventure camp.  

5.  Education Stipend for Project Completion- $250 (6 girls)=$1500

6.  Clothing for girls while in LA - $200 (6 girls) = $1200

7.  Travel Insurance - $150 (6 girls) = $900

8.  Monthly Stipend for Host Families/two months - $800 (6 families) = $4800

9.  Weekly Allowance for Participants/Eight weeks - $160 (6 girls) = $960

10. Entrance Fees to Outings (Museums, etc.) - $250 (6 girls) = $1500

10. Entrance Fees to Outings (Museums, etc.) - $250 (6 girls) = $1500

story:
When an ex outlaw is approached by a mysterious woman, he and three other friends begin down a path they soon regret.

When Danny Morreti (Dechlan Donnell) is approached by a woman, Eve (Holly Thomas) he is tempted back into a life of crime. He, along with three friends Daryl (Ben Foreman) Natalie (Annabel Logan) and Tommy (Calum Verrecchia) soon find themselves hatching a plan to rob a Desperate and Dangerous Gangster by the name of Oliver Cain (John McEwen).

Oliver has in his employ a master Torturer, Trevor (Dougal Affleck) and Danny's own Brother, James Morreti (Calum Barbour) who is working against the clock to help Oliver pay off past debts.

When the group realises that everything that can go wrong, will go wrong, they are forced to face their past as well as the Organised syndicate on their tail.

"The Lack Of Money Is The Root Of All Evil"


Something YOU can be passionate about :

  • An incredible script, A Wonderfully Talented Cast and Cinematography to rival the Industries big budget films.
  • This campaign is to help us create something truly unique, Both a feature film and a series. A film that we believe can change perception of Scottish cinema. And we want to do exactly that!
  • We would love for you to get involved and help us create this game changing piece of cinema.


What We Need & What You Get

How we can do this together:

  • We need £15,000 to film, though this does not cover the costs that follow once we wrap. To make the best possible film and web series we are looking at £30,000 which is not a lot for a feature film. This covers Equipment, Actors, Crew, Locations, Props, Licencing, Marketing and much more.
  • We are looking to award contributions with unique perks. From special thanks, to cast signed scripts and posters, merchandise and even Credits as Producers.
  • All funds, even if we have not met the target WILL go towards making this project happen.


The Impact

Your contribution is Valuable:

"Of all the small nations of this earth, perhaps only the ancient Greeks surpass the scots in their contribution to mankind" - Winston Churchill

  • In recent years Scotland has been made out to be unable to produce intelligent scripts and has even been called "Too Working Class". We Want to shatter this image by creating something Unique and Powerful, full of a talented Scottish cast.
  • This project  is also giving a lot of talent the chance to play unique characters in a large ensemble cast.


Risks & Challenges

  • As with any project we are aware of the Hurdles that are sure to show up from time to time, though we are confident with a lot of patience and care we will overcome any and all obstacles. 
  • We can promise, you will be hard pressed to find a more dedicated and passionate team. And that will overcome anything that stands before us as we want to make this project for everyone in the industry.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • By making some noise and sharing this game-changing project, you can help us a great deal. the more people know of our independent film, the better support we have.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools and visit our facebook page!

story:
Why do you need me?

Coven is a film which came from an experience I myself had once on roads very similar to where we are shooting. And so the film you see before you was born. We are looking for £3000 to take this film from script to screen and further beyond in order to make as many people see it as we possibly can. None of the money is going towards our own paychecks as every incredibly talented individual is here purely out of passion (or favours) and with the end goal to make a short film they can all be proud of.

We understand that money is tight these days and as such we are putting money from our pockets into this aswell but we still need that final £3000 to make us all breathe easier knowing we can literally get everything we need.

Where is my money going?

When we say every penny we mean every penny of your generous handouts will be going towards production with nothing left over. To break it down into words aswell the expenses are

Production Gear: £1,200

On set (Makeup, costume, a heater) £254

Props: £165

Expenses (fuel,food,drink) £600

Rewards £500

Festival Fees £270

Other Expenses £200

 

Who is the team?

Ben Sheridan  Director/Writer

Ben Sheridan is a Kent born and raised director with several short films already under his belt. While this is the biggest project Ben has undertaken he is no stranger to the film making process and the visual language of the screen. His last short film 'The View'. A story about a young man trying to lead his girlfriend away from a zombie apocalypse was met with high praise from peers and industry professionals. His next short film 'To The Stars' is also about to be entered into numerous festivals and competitions. About to start his degree at the prestigious Ravensbourne Creative Academy Ben wants one last film under his belt as an independent director before going back into education. With no love of finances nor fame Ben simply wants to give an audience something they will enjoy and with Coven he hopes to scare them aswell.

Joseph Young:Visual Effects

Joseph Young is a London based animator with skills in compositing, rigging, look dev and other aspects of the VFX pipeline. Besides working on Coven, Joseph is currently working on a pilot for his fantasy animated series aimed at an adult audience called "Broken Quest" which follows the adventures of Sir Knight and Squire as they encounter crazy characters and get involved in hilarious situations. Also he is working on an animated adaptation for Carl Medland's award winning short film "Blinded" which follows the character of Edward who is afraid of the dark and is suddenly forced to face his worst fear when he becomes blind, the 2008 film stars Golden Globe nominee Jane Merrow, the adaptation is currently being reworked and story boarded to create a much darker version of the story.

Having also previously worked on projects for a range of clients including Anthony Nolan, Sony and Slenky, and also originally starting with practical effects and puppetry, Joseph has the required skills and knowledge of Visual Effects and Practical Effects in order to be able to bring Coven to life integrating any elements and blending them seamlessly with live action footage.

Amy Hall:Director of Photography

A recent media production graduate from Bournemouth university, Amy has worked on a variety of projects. She created her first short horror film in her final year, working as director, cinematographer and editor. She has strong industry knowledge and has gained first hand experience. Amy's passion lies in video production and post production.

Jim little:Set Manager/ Behind The Scenes Director

Founder of Independent film Studio Little Films. Jim Little is a young ambitious filmmaker currently based in Nottingham. His last short film was shown at the prestigious Broadway cinema in the Nottingham creative quarter and his films have also had attention in a local magazine called Left Lion. Jim takes the reins as a Director and Producer for his films however is incredibly versatile on set and can fill many production roles.

Matt Cheney:Sound operator

A freelance Audio Engineer & Dubbing Mixer with 9 years experience in Post Production facilities in London. Matt has a proven ability to apply himself and work in any kind of Environment. With considerable experience in TV, advertising & film and a broad knowledge of production audio and foley to fit any kind of film he may be working on.Having built and managed several audio studios Matt is close to an expert giving the director and cinematographer one less thing to worry about.

Francesca Rose Whiting: Hair & Makeup

A trusted addition to the team on many projects, Francesca's skills let her create anything from zombies,aliens, monsters and everything in between. There hasn't been anything yet she has been asked to do which she couldn't given the right time and budget. Francesca joined Coven to tackle an entity she hasn't done before but is more than willing to take on the challenge.

Meet the cast

Siana Smith:Katherine​

I became interested in acting when I joined my first acting group at age 7 and immediately fell in love with the craft. It was not that I wanted to become an actor, rather I needed to. I can think of nothing else I wish to do with my life. It consumes me and my being. Where ever I travel I remember films set in those locations, I think “this would make a great setting for a horror” or “you could stage a great love scene here”.
In my spare time I am always on the lookout for how I can progress further, I also enjoy singing and previously got through to the 3rd round of auditions when I applied to X-Factor, as well as performing and touring in a band when attending East Kent College.

Ntiarna Xavier Knight:The Leader

My name is Ntiarna Xavier Knight. I am one of a triplet and live in Kent.

I've previously worked on sets for short films and worked as an assistant MUA to my sister for a film called Hourglass. I also do script writing in my spare time as well as filming for my Vlog with my sister called The Witch Club.I am very energetic and charismatic and love working with others and being around people.I applied for the role in Coven on Starnow and I loved the sound of it as I watch an array of series such as; American horror story, Outcast, Preacher etc.

What do I get?

Now this wouldn't be a lovingly crowdfunded campaign without some juicy rewards. We have everything from a simple thank you on Facebook or twitter to Associate/Executive producer credits and finally props and costumes from the film that are yours and yours alone. Check the donation perks out on the right to see which one you like the allure of. It's not just about physical or digital rewards but also the knowledge that you, yes you helped to make a film which you can turn on one day and think 'I helped with this'.

Can I help out anymore?

I'm glad you asked, we know that not everyone can put their hand into their pockets and pull out huge wads of cash (believe me I've tried) but if you can share this around on social media (Facebook, twitter, instagram somehow) then we would really appreciate it. Or if you can help us out in anyway in order to keep our costs down then send us an email at officialseraphinproductions@gmail.com.

 

From the whole team here. Thank you for your time.

A recent media production graduate from Bournemouth university, Amy has worked on a variety of projects. She created her first short horror film in her final year, working as director, cinematographer and editor. She has strong industry knowledge and has gained first hand experience. Amy's passion lies in video production and post production.

Jim little:Set Manager/ Behind The Scenes Director
Founder of Independent film Studio Little Films. Jim Little is a young ambitious filmmaker currently based in Nottingham. His last short film was shown at the prestigious Broadway cinema in the Nottingham creative quarter and his films have also had attention in a local magazine called Left Lion. Jim takes the reins as a Director and Producer for his films however is incredibly versatile on set and can fill many production roles.

Matt Cheney:Sound operator
A freelance Audio Engineer & Dubbing Mixer with 9 years experience in Post Production facilities in London. Matt has a proven ability to apply himself and work in any kind of Environment. With considerable experience in TV, advertising & film and a broad knowledge of production audio and foley to fit any kind of film he may be working on.Having built and managed several audio studios Matt is close to an expert giving the director and cinematographer one less thing to worry about.

Francesca Rose Whiting: Hair & Makeup
A trusted addition to the team on many projects, Francesca's skills let her create anything from zombies,aliens, monsters and everything in between. There hasn't been anything yet she has been asked to do which she couldn't given the right time and budget. Francesca joined Coven to tackle an entity she hasn't done before but is more than willing to take on the challenge.

Meet the cast
Siana Smith:Katherine​
I became interested in acting when I joined my first acting group at age 7 and immediately fell in love with the craft. It was not that I wanted to become an actor, rather I needed to. I can think of nothing else I wish to do with my life. It consumes me and my being. Where ever I travel I remember films set in those locations, I think “this would make a great setting for a horror” or “you could stage a great love scene here”.In my spare time I am always on the lookout for how I can progress further, I also enjoy singing and previously got through to the 3rd round of auditions when I applied to X-Factor, as well as performing and touring in a band when attending East Kent College.

Ntiarna Xavier Knight:The Leader
My name is Ntiarna Xavier Knight. I am one of a triplet and live in Kent.
I've previously worked on sets for short films and worked as an assistant MUA to my sister for a film called Hourglass. I also do script writing in my spare time as well as filming for my Vlog with my sister called The Witch Club.I am very energetic and charismatic and love working with others and being around people.I applied for the role in Coven on Starnow and I loved the sound of it as I watch an array of series such as; American horror story, Outcast, Preacher etc.

What do I get?
Now this wouldn't be a lovingly crowdfunded campaign without some juicy rewards. We have everything from a simple thank you on Facebook or twitter to Associate/Executive producer credits and finally props and costumes from the film that are yours and yours alone. Check the donation perks out on the right to see which one you like the allure of. It's not just about physical or digital rewards but also the knowledge that you, yes you helped to make a film which you can turn on one day and think 'I helped with this'.

Can I help out anymore?
I'm glad you asked, we know that not everyone can put their hand into their pockets and pull out huge wads of cash (believe me I've tried) but if you can share this around on social media (Facebook, twitter, instagram somehow) then we would really appreciate it. Or if you can help us out in anyway in order to keep our costs down then send us an email at officialseraphinproductions@gmail.com.
 
From the whole team here. Thank you for your time.

story: Our campaign has now ended - details to follow on the social media pages!

story:
Who we are:

Seeking Sasquatch was conceived of by the creative team at Emprise Entertainment: Ryan Lis and Thomas Thomas.

Ryan Lis - Writer/Associate Producer

Ever since I can remember, I've been a guy who loved good stories. Movies, TV, novels, comics, you name it. Then I joined the Air Force as a Broadcast Journalist to tell other people's stories. I did that for a while and got pretty good at it, winning a few awards in the field along the way. Now I'm back in the civilian world and ready to start telling some stories of my own. The first story I want to tell is Seeking Sasquatch!

Thomas Thomas - Director/Producer

 

I am an alumnus of Cal State Northridge, where I studied film. I also have about four years of experience in the film and television business. These years have been spent freelancing my way across films and TV like “Ted 2,” “Marry Me,” “Hail, Caesar!,” and most recently, “Transformers: The Last Knight.” I've worked on set as a grip, electrician, production assistant, cinematographer, camera assistant, operator and in the office as well! Using my experience for Universal Studios, Warner Brothers, Paramount Pictures, New Deal Studios, USC, New York Film Academy and many others, even the independent market.

All of these years of preparation have prepared us for a project of our own.

What we’re doing:

At this stage, we are looking for support which will go toward filming the very first episode of Seeking Sasquatch. 

The Seeking Sasquatch pilot is the first part of a long-running series about the misadventures of the Bigfoot Investigation Bureau and their increasingly outlandish methods of squatch detection. The BIB consists of Jack Patterson, the team leader, and squatch expert; Christina Meldrum, the data analyst and BIB record keeper; Abner [no last name given], a master tracker with unclear motives; and Stephen Keplar, a Ph.D. candidate in biology forced into the team against his will.

The show is tonally a cross between Finding Bigfoot and The Office.  It focuses mainly on the BIB and their various dysfunctions, set against the backdrop of their increasingly ridiculous squatching exploits.

How we’re doing it:

Seeking Sasquatch, though filmed in the less expensive documentary/sitcom style, is no small undertaking. To help us bring creative aspects to life, we are employing the help of some of the best people we've met along the way to Seeking Sasquatch. 

Team: 

These are a few of the key members of the professional team bringing Seeking Sasquatch to life. 

Stefan Anderson - Producer

I am a producer. I've been working in film since 2005, producing since 2007. I have produced and/or directed over 100 music videos and several commercials. Some of my clients include Sony Music Entertainment, Universal Music Group, Warner Music Group, and EMI. With these clients, I've made music videos for Akon, Eve, Ballyhoo!, Five Finger Death Punch, Ian Carey, Snoop Dogg, and many, many more. What else can I say, I'm a Nor-Cal native, music addict, drummer, skateboarder, I love books, am a huge Christopher Guest fan and I love Mockumentaries. I can't wait to work on this one.

http://www.stefan-anderson.com

Christopher Pritzlaff - Cinematographer

I  am a cinematographer and lighting technician. I have a wide variety of experience in the entertainment industry.  Starting out in the production team with Disney for live events, I got to learn on the job at arguably the largest entertainment company in the world.  With a focus on lighting and camera, I now have worked on franchises such as Star Wars, Jason Bourne, and the latest Insidious film.  In the television world, my work has ranged from serving as the Lighting Director on shows such as MTV's Fantasy Factory and TOP GEAR, the programmer on house reality shows Twinning and Are You the One, and gaffer on the long-running Storage Hunters series.  As a cinematographer, I have shot numerous short films, music videos, and commercials. 

http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1826690/?ref_=fn_al_...

Matt Thompson - Sound Mixer

I'm a production sound mixer with experience doing feature length films, short films, documentaries, and reality.  I've worked for the White House, recorded sound for digital and TV content for Bellator on Spike TV, Comedy Central, McDonalds, Coca- Cola, Dancing with the Stars, and Lifetime. Some of my work can be heard through the voices of Jerry Seinfeld, Seth Green, Ice Cube, Nick Swardson, Danny Trejo, and even the Muppets.  

http://mathompson333.wixsite.com/matt-thompson-...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r6sGARbnnfM

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=c2-34SNP-Ok

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GmuYtnM1WgU

If you're interested, more can be read about our team and their backgrounds through the links provided beneath their individual bios. These will take you to their personal websites, IMDb pages, videos they've worked on and so forth.

Budget breakdown:

However, just having the right team isn't quite enough to bring Seeking Sasquatch to life. Here, along with the cost of bringing on a team of experts, you can see how many other factors come into play and are critical for the success of this vision. 

As you'll notice, the figure we are aiming for in our goal is not the figure you see here. This is where our Stretch Goals, which we go into detail about a little later in our story, come in. What we are aiming for is the bare minimum to do this project. We feel it's more important to make our goal than take a bigger hit with fees for not making our goal on Indiegogo. 

You may also notice the goal amount is roughly where we want to be for pre-production and production. Post production, exhibition, marketing and so on will, if we don't meet our stretch goals, have to come from additional fundraising and some otherwise unnecessary additional work. 

How you can help:

As you can see, making a TV pilot is a monetary commitment. Yes, we have a team to make it, but you're the team that can enable us to. 

For you kindhearted investors contributing, we’ve got a great range of fun and exciting perks for you to check out. And if you can’t make a donation, you can still contribute by helping raise awareness of Seeking Sasquatch using Indiegogo share tools! These, you can find next to the "BACK IT" button at the top right portion of our Indiegogo page.

And be sure to check out our other social media links, where we’ll be posting fun Squatch facts and project updates throughout the campaign.
https://www.facebook.com/EmpriseLLC
https://twitter.com/EmpriseFilms?lang=en
https://www.instagram.com/emprisefilms/?hl=en 

Our Stretch Goals:

$75,000

With $75,000 we can rest easy knowing we have the funding to shop this to the right people. This will enable us to take the show you helped create, to the best festivals and network audiences we can find. 

$100,000

It's important to know that this falls between one-third to half the budget of one episode of Finding Bigfoot. That's right, we're doing it for a fraction of what an episode of similar material costs. The cost of episodes of The Office, Parks and Recreation, and Arrested Development, would be even greater!

With this stretch goal, Emprise Entertainment will have sufficient funding to give us a real shot at making this upcoming year, 2017, the best year yet for growing the company. With this money, we will be tooled to make the most of your investment in Seeking Sasquatch - this would allow us to go farther than we ever could on our own.

Your donations would enable us to hire the best people to market Seeking Sasquatch. Taking our chances of getting this title to air to the next level. And, that's the point, isn't it. To put this show on as many TV's and computers possible and bring a few smiles and some lighthearted entertainment to a country and world in desperate need of it. 

Finally, if you've made it this far, we really do thank you for your time and wish you all the best.

From Emprise Entertainment to you - thank you!
