story:
The Project

When a struggling sales team receives a mandatory invitation to a company team builder, they expect another boring event full of ice breakers, trust falls, and other mindless corporate exercises.

Their sales manager has other ideas, though: he’s booked them all a hunting retreat to try and instill a killer instinct into his team and make them the most competitive sales members in the region.  

Some employees embrace the spirit of the trip. Others see it as another waste of the company’s resources. None of them are ready for what’s waiting for them in the wilderness: the woods are ground zero for an evolved strain of Chronic Wasting Disease, a sickness afflicting deer that causes their brains and bodies to rot into a zombie state.  This new strain has made the deer aggressive, and capable of transmitting the disease to people.

When the sales staff heads into the woods with a grizzled hunting guide, their corporate retreat quickly turns into a trip from hell as an infected, rotting deer attacks their group, killing the guide and leaving the hapless employees on their own in the middle of the wilderness.  It’s up to the team to learn how to work together long enough to survive, while uncovering the reasons for the attacking deer and the terrifying disease they carry.

As the body count rises and the deer’s attacks become more devastating, old rivalries surface that drive the team apart and have them fighting each other along with the creatures attacking them.  In a thrilling finale the surviving sales members must defeat the zombie deer, their infected co-workers, and their back-stabbing peers to see which species will emerge as the reigning king of the food chain.

ZOMBIE DEER is a horror-comedy that asks the question “What if Jaws were set in the woods, and featured a killer deer instead of a great white shark?”  It’s “The Office” meets “Grizzly” with a little “Night of the Living Dead” thrown in for good measure.     

This film will be a comedic horror film looking to make social commentaries and bring more awareness of the disease Chronic Wasting:

  • The team involved has created multiple low-budget horror films and tv shows.  Gregg Elder (Bludgeoned, Backwoods), Ebonye Delaney (Blue Shift, Black Wing), David Quiroz (The Lonely Ones, 'Promise: The Sgt Lane Chronicles), Matthew Shilts (Nano Ridge), Andrew Krieghoff (Backwoods 2) Samantha Erdmann (Haters Make Me Famous), Matthew Schaub (G Squad), Steven Green (Blood Orgy of the Dammed)
  • The film will be fun and entertaining and a good way to get people talking about Chronic Wasting. Chronic wasting disease (CWD) is a chronic, fatal disease of the central nervous system in mule deer, white-tailed deer, elk, and moose.
  • Our contributors will be our life blood to create our special effects.  All effects are to be done practically on set. 

Challenges

  • The film will completed on a 100 acre farm in Wisconsin.  We need to house, travel, and feed our cast and crew (5k).  Our biggest expense is our special effects (15K).  Creating the deer and safe amazing action scenes.  
  • Our perks let you get involved and help our cause and our art.  The more involved you are the bigger audience we can reach.
  • If we don't reach our goal we will try to complete the project with the amount raised.  If we go over our goal, 50% of any money raised above our goal will be donated to Chronic Waisting Research.  

There are many ways to get the word out about diseases like Chronic Wasting.  We feel a vehicle like this film will reach sections of the population that wouldn't normally see the specials, documents, and documentaries on the subject.  In order to compete in the marketplace to be seen, we need make our film

  • Fun
  • Entertaining
  • Memorable
  • Safe

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute:

  • Please spread the word and research the disease on your own. Go to:  https://muledeer.org/chronic-wasting-disease/?g...
  • A great animated video that explains Chronic Wasting can be found here. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=74Fz2OUVi_A&amp...
  • And please spread the word about our project!

story:
Hi y'all!

 

I am Alex Vela, a current student at the New York Film Academy. I am reaching graduation soon and am creating my short film titled Wrecking Royalty. My short will tell the story of my character, Bianca Johnson, and her fight for the title of Prom Queen. With this film, I want to spread a simple message: One's happiness cannot be achieved through someone else's pain.  

 

Budget

 

For my film, I am hoping with your help to raise $3,800. This will cover the following:

  • A Director
  • Director of Photography 
  • Editors
  • Location permits and insurance 
  • Costumes 
  • Set design

Thank you all so much in advance!

story:
Who are we?

Petruzzi Productions mission is to inspire and change the world through media and film.  Our goal is to give millions of dollars toward helping this world.

"Not so Perfect"  Call Center  6 Episode Web Series is the first of many productions.  Help us launch and make history as we embark on making this hilarious sitcom with a deeper meaning.

Check out our website:  PetruzziProductions.com


What We Need & What You Get

Call Center 6 Episode Web Series

  • We need a total of 20K for this Web Series to be made.  
  • We have several executive producers that have invested in the project.
  • We need your support and feedback.
  • If we don't reach our goal we will continue to fund raise and are totally committed to producing this show no excuses!  
The Impact
  • This show gives you the chance to laugh & chill out after a long day of work.
  • This show is really about family.  
  • This show is The Office meets Glengarry Glenn Ross

Risks & Challenges

  • Must be funny or the Comedy Sitcom will die quickly.  
  • We are going through a testing phase with a great sample group of 100 people.  If you would like to be a part of this sample group please email us at glenn@petruzziproductions.com.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign by sharing it on Facebook and Twitter.  
  • Subscribe to our channel Subscribe to our Youtube Channel Here

story:
Short Summary -

Matt’s widower father had a deep, consuming obsession with finding gold on his rural property. When he dies he leaves everything in a detailed will to his estranged son.

Shaken from his impassive life by the thought of his mother’s things being sold off to pay his wretched father’s debts, Matt heads back to the farm to find the gold his dad stashed away and collect his mother’s things.

Going back to the property stirs up all his bad memories of the place, as well as unknown truths about who his father really was.

Chris (Director) & Tom (Cinematographer) have been working relentlessly on the concept and story, it's a real passion project for the entire team. 

At the moment we have an incredible location locked in, the script is complete and we are all ready to shoot. 

Blood and Gold is a film we really want to make as well as we possibly can. We have an amazing, dedicated team and need funds to not only take care of them, but also help showcase their talent and effort. 


What We Need -

We are aiming for $2000 to fund this production.

Our funds will be going into Equipment, Production Design, Location, Catering, Distribution and Marketing. 

 Equipment - We want to get the right equipment for the shoot, not just whatever we have on hand. 

Location - We have unfettered access to the wonderful location in rural NSW, as Tom’s family owns the property. The costs associated there include generators for power and petrol.

Distribution - We believe in this film, and want as many people to be able to see it as possible. We’d love to have gorgeous posters made, screenings, hard copies printed (especially for our wonderful backers), and it would perform really well in short film festivals, which cost between $50-$150 to enter.

Without your help we will be shooting with the bare minimum of gear and facilities. The jump from shooting on nothing to shooting with a budget, however small, is immense. Any contribution will make a huge difference.


Meet the Blood and Gold Crew 

Thomas Black - Writer / DOP / Colourist

Christopher Pearson - Director / Writer 

Yolanda Torres - Producer

Einar Eyland - Editor / Colourist  

Bronte Rofe - 1st Assistant Director

Sophie Douglas - Production Designer 

Alex Nelson-Shine - 2nd Camera Assistant 

Murali Madhav - Location Sound Mixer (Sound#1)

Andres Correal - Boom Operator/ Sound Design (Sound #2)


Risks & Challenges  

Having the location being in such a beautiful, rural area slashes our connection to the outside world. We have been to the location a number of times, and getting power for lights is the biggest hurdle we have before us.

Elevating the film above the amateur level is the end goal for these funds. The challenge is using what we have on hand to make sure the film never feels cheap. 


Other Ways You Can Help

FOLLOW US, share and talk about us on:

Facebook.com/bloodandgoldfilm

Instagram: @bloodandgoldfilm 

Use the Indiegogo share tools too

If you have any questions, get in touch with us through our official email: bloodandgoldfilm@gmail.com


We look forward to sharing this journey with you.

- Blood and Gold Crew

story:
This short film is a psychological thriller that needs your support in making it come alive. 

For a quick break down, please watch the above video for questions on what the movie is about, why I am doing it, and why you should support it.  Also, for the purpose of not giving away spoilers for everyone but yet for those who wish to know more what the film is about. Please feel free to reach out to me at jeansmoa@gmail.com and I'll be glad to send you a one sheet treatment that has a break down of this film's story.


Cause and Effect

I didn't take the Chris Rock's Oscar jokes lightly. If anything, it's made me realize even more so that there is something evidently wrong with the #OscarsSoWhite issue. However, this doesn't mean that I'm against hiring or working with someone solely based on their color or sex, I believe in an equal playing field where people that I work with will only be judged based upon by their merit and who they are as a person.


Budget

The whole entire break down of this movie's budget is being used for cast, crew, equipment rental, location rental, props, wardrobe, permits, insurance and post production.

This is a budget estimate that will help me ensure that the main crew and cast other than myself working on this film will be working for pay and not solely just on passion.


Pre-Production

With the funds raised, the project will be able to start finding it's cast and crew, location scouting for sets, hiring set and wardrobe stylist. The process will help bring together the best possible people we can find and make this film come alive. 

Production

With every thing aligned and everyone hired, location scouted, permits and insurance in hand, we'll have a production schedule to shoot for approximately a week.

Post Production

After everything is in the can/hard drives, I will personally start filtering out the footage to start the editing process. A tedious process of going through many rounds of edits with any extra visual effects applied. The final output will be sent to a color mix facility to fine tune it's colors and sound mix facility to sweeten the audio.  Finally, festivals will be lined up and checked for submission to be entered for it's first premiere. For those who don't have access to a festival or city in which we will be premiering at, a link will be provided to those who have pledged towards movie tickets as rewards to join us and post, tweet or blog about it in our future website.

Questions and Inquiries

If you should have any questions or inquiries about the film, please feel free to reach out to me at jeansmoa@gmail.com

Thank You!

-Qi

Risks and Challenges

There will always be risk and challenges when it comes to making a film. From mother nature which could possibly force us to reschedule shoot days to delays on the every day struggle of dealing with traffic noises or sirens that can possibly force us to do extra takes while filming. Then there is the possibility of cast and crew getting sick which could also possibly set things back a bit, but you can trust us in keeping the project moving along with as few possible hiccups as possible.

story:
"Three people…all heavy hitters in their own right, and all three play to win in this battle royal being fought on three fronts—the heart, the bed, and the dance floor."


GOAL

We're raising money for the Pre-Production stage of this forthcoming movie. 

PLEASE MAKE A CONTRIBUTION BY CLICKING ONE OF THE CATEGORIES ON THE RIGHT.


THE STORY

A fallen dance icon steps to resurrection over his vindictive former lover.

Russell Promise—a handsome and prosperous real estate agent—finds himself broke and homeless after the real estate crash of 2008. His passion for dancing leads to his salvation, but lust for his ex-lover may steer him toward damnation.

In this urban romance set in the world of Steppin', Russell is the King of the dance floor and appears to be a lucky man with Monica Thomas and Lynnette Parker—two of the most gorgeous women in town—both deeply in love with him. He finds himself at a crossroads being pulled in love's opposite directions. Can real love compete with lust and lies, and can Russell tell the difference? All three are heavy hitters in their own right, and all three play to win in this battle royal being fought on three fronts—the heart, the bed, and the dance floor.

PLEASE MAKE A CONTRIBUTION BY CLICKING ONE OF THE CATEGORIES ON THE RIGHT.


STEPPIN' / CHICAGO STYLE STEPPIN'

Steppin’ (also known as Chicago-style Stepping) is an urban dance that originated in Chicago. The dance is defined by its unique style and culture within the larger world of Swing Dance. Just as anyone at the top of their game can be called a Heavy Hitter, so, too, are the steppers who are at the top of their game called Heavy Hitters. They Step when they want to have a good time, but they also compete for recognition in friendly dance battles all the way to competing in organized contests for cash prizes. The steppers challenge and dare each other with unique moves and footwork.  Steppin’ also includes the addictive aura of music and has its own sub-genre of music known as Steppers Grooves because of the particular beat and tempo of the songs. I’m also committed to showcasing the Indie artists whose music has helped fuel the dance by featuring their music in the film. Most of them don't get radio airplay, but are big stars in the Steppers world. Showing real steppers dancing to their genre of music puts them in their element and will contribute to the authenticity of the film. Steppin’ was popular in Chicago and the Midwest, but after the release of R. Kelly’s 2003 mega-hit “Step in the Name of Love,” popularity of the dance skyrocketed and swept across the country. I believe that Steppin’ is a valid aspect of Chicago’s cultural identity. The world of Steppin’ has its own culture, including music, style of dress, and attitude. This world is real to the steppers, and I respect that world. Bottom line...I want the steppers to be proud of this film. Our desire is for HEAVY HITTERS to be commercially successful as well as become a cult classic that will endure throughout the years.

AFFILIATED DANCES - Hand Dancing, Swing Dancing, Walking, Bop, Urban Ballroom, Line Dancing, Hustle, Detroit Graystone


Video of Contest


Steppin' is fun, great exercise, and the contests can be quite competitive. The Steppin' community is a loosely-knit family of people nationwide who enjoy the dance and camaraderie of traveling the country to attend different themed Steppin' conventions. These events have expanded in scope to include workshops in finance, health and diet, history, honoring pioneers of the dance, and more. This is one of my favorite videos of a Steppin' contest and a good example of an energetic performance, creative Steppin' moves, techniques, and footwork. Check out the cool but aggressive dancing by Andre Blackwell and the dazzling moves by Lady Margaret Fisher.

PLEASE MAKE A CONTRIBUTION BY CLICKING ONE OF THE CATEGORIES ON THE RIGHT.

When the ladies step...they step like this!

When the men get Stepper's Sharp...


SIGNIFICANCE OF THE MOVIE

HEAVY HITTERS will help capture and preserve this intangible aspect of African American cultural heritage and the legacy of Steppin'. Although HEAVY HITTERS is a drama, it is infused with bits of documentary-style film making in order to include actual Steppin' history and show the passion it inspires. Everyone wants to see their unique expressions and identities recognized and valued as part of the human record, and HEAVY HITTERS is an excellent way to accomplish this for the art of Steppin'. In addition to the fictionalized dramatic narrative, the movie presents an opportunity to trace the history of the dance and its genre of music, as well as actual Heavy Hitters of the dance whose style, moves, and footwork are legendary. The story is structured to marry the narrative with the music while the dance is stylized in a way to exhibit the emotions and healing properties of dancing. It will show how the rut of everyday life can be transcended when you become one with the dance. These aspects of the movie will also help to bolster the legitimacy of Steppin' as an art form. 


YOU'RE IMPORTANT BECAUSE 'EACH ONE CAN REACH ONE' AND 'EVERYBODY CAN TELL SOMEBODY' 

This movie can't be completed without your support. So, we're asking you to join our movement, contribute what you can, and help us spread the word. We call it the 'Each One Reach One' Movement. We ask that each of you reach out to someone else and ask them to support HEAVY HITTERS. We understand that everyone who wants to supports us might not be able to contribute cash. But, every time you share this campaign with someone, you help bring us closer to our goal. You can be of great assistance to us by spreading the word about HEAVY HITTERS. Basically, all you have to do is tell somebody to tell somebody to tell somebody else. Pretty easy, huh?  

                                           

PLEASE MAKE A CONTRIBUTION BY CLICKING ONE OF THE CATEGORIES ON THE RIGHT.


OUR TEAM

DEE ROBINSON, Executive Producer, Writer, Director:  I’m a poet and writer, in other words, a storyteller. Everything for me starts first with a poem that I convert to a song that’s then re-created as a story. In 2009 I was blessed with the opportunity to turn one of my ‘poem-turned song-turned story’ into a short film. That’s when I truly found my voice! For me, film making is the ultimate medium of expression to complete the creative journey from word to screen. Since then, I’ve made three short films, and I’m now embarking on my first feature—HEAVY HITTERS, a romantic drama that is set in the world of Steppin’. I was fortunate to have one of my songs (“I Like It”) become a big hit in the Steppin’ community, which is the inspiration for HEAVY HITTERS. Steppin’ fascinated me, and I was drawn into the magnetic allure of both the music and the dance. I became immersed in its culture and studied it as if I were a student. As a storyteller, I feel it is my duty to tell THIS story and bring this amazing dance to the forefront through narrative film. I am President and CEO of Mentaltainment Media, LLC.  

CATHY LEE, Executive Producer:  Cathy is Business Manager of Mentaltainment Media, LLC.  She has worked in both television and radio production in Indiana, Illinois, Alabama, California, and Alaska. She has a Master's Degree in Business and Organizational Management and a Bachelor of Arts Degree in Telecommunications from Indiana University. Cathy Lee is Vice President and COO of Mentaltainment Media, LLC. 

IARY ISAIAH ISRAEL, Associate Producer: Iary Israel is the CEO and Founder of Word Of Mouth Entertainment, LLC (WOME) and currently one of many noteworthy stepping promoters in the association. WOME was established in 2000 in St. Louis, MO, as the result of a serious need for adult partner dancing. Chicago Stepping was the dance of choice to be introduced to the St. Louis adult social community. After several years of cultivating and infusing Chicago Stepping into the city, there was a need to host a national stepping event which eventually birthed STEPAGANZA—an annual mega event held each May during Memorial Day Week since 2010, and serves as an Awards Gala honoring the lifetime achievement of steppers' contributions to the culture and art form.


PHILLIP GHEE, Producer, Executive in Charge of Production: Phil has over 37 years proven experience in multi-camera television and film style production as Director of Photography; Strong camera and location production methods in film and video techniques with a specialty in lighting; Excellent management skills and experience in programming and post production. Phil has worked at CBS and BET in addition to numerous  independent projects.

GILBERT GLENN BROWN, Asst. Director, Actor: Gilbert is a seasoned performer of stage, television, screen and voice over as an Actor, Writer, Director, Producer and Director of Photography. Currently, he can be seen in the TV series “The Inspectors.” He also has an extensive list of TV and screen credits, including: "Drumline 2: A New Beat", “E.R”, “Shark”, “Cold Case”, “Mercy”, “The Shield”, “The OC”, “The Parker’s”,“Roswell”, “Dreamgirls”, “The Good Fight, “The Eavesdropper”, ”Raising the Heights”, “Romeo & Juliet Revisited” and "Night Falls on Manhattan." He is Producer and Writer for the comedy short “Half Off”, as well as Director and DP on the series "HTMAST."  He is also Co-Creator, Producer, Writer and Director of the forth-coming web series "ALL IN THE TIMING." 


Leighala Jimenez-Hall of Leighala J Management  & Entertainment, Casting. 

FUNDING

HEAVY HITTERS will be produced in stages as we raise sufficient funds to carry out each stage. Steps for each stage are laid out in the actions listed below. In addition to raising funds, our main fundraising goal is to keep production entirely in our hands so we can have complete creative control and keep the original story intact.

STAGE ONE - $20,000 (Time Frame – 60 days)

When we reach $20,000, we can begin Development and Pre-Production, which should cover the Above-the-Line costs, including Script, Storyboard, Casting, Scout Locations, selecting the crew, selecting vendors for equipment, renting gear, tech scout, a table read, auditions. In addition, we can produce a 5-minute pitch reel to expand our outreach to a wider audience.

STAGE TWO

Production – In Stage Two we will begin actual production. By this point we will have completed the shooting script, the budget, and the schedule to make everything work. All of the key elements will have been locked down in preparation to start production, and we can begin shooting the less complicated scenes. Then we'll move on to the more difficult or complicated scenes and complete principle photography. This requires additional pre-production, choreography, staging, and costs associated with a large cast for the big finale. All the money raised will be spent directly toward increased production value, including costs such as wardrobe, building and designing sets, securing locations,  travel, and craft services for cast and crew, and most importantly, to pay our talent and production crew.

STAGE THREE

Post-Production – In Stage Three we will begin editing, color correction, special effects, sound design and re-recording, secure music licenses, digital art, photography, and any other necessary processes in post-production.

STAGE FOUR

Marketing & Publicity – In Stage Four we will begin the marketing process for the film, including festival costs. We will also continue our grassroots marketing strategy to supplement the cost of the film’s promotion. 

NOTICE:

~If your perk is an appearance in the film or special screening, you must be over 18 or accompanied by a parent or legal guardian to participate. 

~ Some perk dates, times, and locations may be subject to change due to unforeseen circumstances, such as weather, production delays, etc.

                                                          ~~~~~

If you have any ideas for perks that you’d like to see included, or other ways you can contribute, please get in touch with us and we’ll see how we can accommodate you. This is all about collaboration and we’re open to suggestions.

                                                        ~~~~~

In the event we don't reach our stated goal, we will either scale down the scope of the film or put the funds in an escrow account and seek other resources until we have enough money to continue.


RISKS & CHALLENGES

We wouldn’t ask you to believe in us if we didn’t believe in ourselves. We’ve already spent almost $9,000 on costs related to HEAVY HITTERS, including  a concept trailer and associated expenses, legal fees, and artwork.

There are risks and challenges in any creative project, including film making. However, we have put together an experienced team whose members are so dedicated to the successful completion of this film that our passion will help us surmount any obstacles presented. We will also pursue additional supplemental fundraising avenues.

Delays that are out of our control, such as inclement weather or devastating acts of nature such as an earthquake, tornado, or hurricane could cause major disruption in production. Problems such as actor or equipment issues and rescheduling might cause delay, but can be overcome. But, delay is not defeat, and we will not stop until HEAVY HITTERS is completed and audiences flocking to see it. 

We started planning this project in 2012 and have invested a lot of time, energy, sweat and tears to see it through. We don’t want to disappoint ourselves, but more importantly, we don’t want to disappoint our supporters. 


ONE MORE THING...

Thank You! Thank You! Thank You! Thank You! Thank You! Thank You! Thank You! Thank You! Thank You! Thank You! Thank You! Thank You! Thank You! Thank You! Thank You! Thank You! Thank You! Thank You! And Thank You!

story:
Help us raise our last $25,000 to launch ALL OF ME:
a new documentary film on eating disorders.

“It’s not just about food and body image—it’s about everything that lies beneath.”

In the United States, 20 million women and 10 million men suffer from an eating disorder at some point in their lifetime, including anorexia, bulimia, and binge eating disorder. (~The National Eating Disorder Association)

However, in spite of this, eating disorders are often a hidden mental health issue. People who are affected by eating disorders and their families often feel stigmatized and frustrated by the lack of services, insurance and health care available to them.

That’s why we are asking you to help support the new film All of Me produced by Kingdom County Productions (KCP) and directed by filmmaker Bess O’Brien.

We need to be talking about this critical issue. We need to hear the voices of people who are suffering from this disease. We need to hear their stories of recovery. We need to listen to parents who struggle with a child who is suffering from an eating disorder. We need to begin a national conversation to raise consciousness and understand more fully about these terrible diseases and how we can intervene and support change.

To date KCP, a non-profit & independent film company, has raised $120,000 toward the making of the movie; we have filmed it, and are now two months away from completion.  We need just $25,000 to finish the film and launch our distribution. You can help us do this with a tax deductible contribution.

Please give to our Indiego-go campaign. Donate what you can—every amount helps – and please share this campaign with everyone you know.  Together, we can help save lives.

More about the movie: All of Me is a feature length documentary film focused on the lives of people who are caught in the downward spiral of eating disorders and their struggle to regain a sense of self-compassion and healing. Eating Disorders, which include Bulimia, Anorexia, Restricted Eating, and Binge Eating, are one of the most hidden forms of addiction and disease in our society. The film focuses on body image, a lack of connection with one’s physical and emotional being, and the need to delve deep within one’s self to find the systemic reasons that triggered the disease. The film is primarily shot in Vermont, however it will be distributed across the United States.

Eating disorders are an addiction that we often do not perceive as such because it is the process of depriving oneself of the basic human need to eat. But anorexia, bulimia and binging are ways to fill a hole in one’s self—in the same way that drugs fill a hole of depression, anger, anxiety, despair. Eating disorders stem from a feeling of “I’m not good enough” and, like drug addiction, not eating somehow makes the person feel that they have a coping skill; not eating is one way to control a part of you that feels lost. Binge eating is also a coping skill and body image issue. And, like drug addiction, the beginning of an eating disorder can spiral into a full blown crisis where not eating food becomes the overriding obsessive monster that takes over one’s life. In fact,Eating Disorders are one of the hardest addictions to treat and to cure. We are inundated with images that promote “thinness” and many people can become obsessed with their body types to the point of taking unhealthy control of their eating habits.

  • The percentage of young girls who start dieting as young as 10-12 years of age has risen dramatically over the last fifteen years in our country. All of Me includes a diverse group of women of all shapes, colors, and sizes between the ages of 14 and 60.
  • Boys are also being affected by mass media depictions of male bodies. All of Me includes stories from the male perspective.
  • Hearing parents’ stories is essential for understanding the impact of these diseases on family and friends. All of Me highlights the powerful stories of parents who struggle with their children who battle these terrible diseases.

It’s not just about body image: All of Me, however, will not simply focus on the media culture that girls and boys are overwhelmed with, but will also delve into discovering the internal and systemic reasons for eating disorders, such as low self esteem, trauma, mental health issues, a lack of self compassion and sense of isolation that many young girls, boys and women feel.  There is also a profound lack of connection to one’s physical body that happens with eating disorders—women detach from their inner physical, soulful self and fixate on their appearance only. What is this about? How do women and men get to this place? What trigger pushes them to stop eating? Why does this control of food become so critical to survive? What are the immediate external issues that are pushing girls and boys to take control of their lives by controlling their eating? How does our culture of driven perfection play into all this? How can we provide prevention and intervention to folks who are susceptible to this disease? How do we bring those afflicted back into their bodies in a meditative, inclusive way that grounds them and empowers them, offering a sense of wholeness rather than division?

The film will also highlight the work of Bree Greenberg-Benjamin who runs the Vermont Center for Integrative Therapy in Burlington, VT. Her treatment center focuses on eating disorders. The film will focus on a number of her patients and the innovative work that she is doing to treat folks with eating disorders. Bree is an expert in the field and believes that, in order to heal folks, one must take a holistic approach to treatment. Bree’s work includes not only talk therapy, but in-depth work to bring these people back into their bodies through interventions including meditation, yoga, acupuncture and group therapy.

Telling your story heals and starts an authentic conversation: We know that telling your story helps heal people. The girls, boys, women and parents who will be involved with this documentary will be asked to raise their voices and speak out about this very invisible addiction.  Through their stories they will move forward in their healing process and they will impact audiences and raise consciousness on this important issue.

  

Touring and distribution of the film:

  • All of Me will premiere in Burlington, Vermont in September of 2016. This will launch a 27 town tour through the state. People from the film will appear with director Bess O’Brien at all the screenings and be part of a Q & A with audiences afterwards.
  • From there, the film will launch a national distribution plan.
  • All of Me will be distributed to schools, colleges and health centers across Vermont and beyond.
  • For more information please contact Bess O’Brien at bobrien@pshift.com.
  • THANK YOU!!  Your support for our film is much needed and greatly appreciated!

Please give to our Indiego-go campaign. Donate what you can—every amount helps – and please share this campaign with everyone you know.

(Use the Indiegogo share tools!)

Together, we can help save lives.
story_txt:
Help us raise our last $25,000 to launch ALL OF ME: a new documentary film on eating disorders.



“It’s not just about food and body image—it’s about everything
that lies beneath.”
In the United States, 20 million women
and 10 million men suffer from an eating disorder at some point in their lifetime,
including anorexia, bulimia, and binge eating disorder. (~The
National Eating Disorder Association)
However, in spite of this, eating
disorders are often a hidden mental health issue. People who are affected by eating disorders
and their families often feel stigmatized and frustrated by the lack of
services, insurance and health care available to them.
That’s why we are asking you to help support the
new film All of Me produced by
Kingdom County Productions (KCP) and directed by filmmaker Bess O’Brien.

We need to be talking about this critical issue. We need to hear the
voices of people who are suffering from this disease. We need to hear their
stories of recovery. We need to listen to parents who struggle with a child who
is suffering from an eating disorder. We need to begin a national conversation
to raise consciousness and understand more fully about these terrible diseases
and how we can intervene and support change.

To date KCP, a non-profit & independent film
company, has raised $120,000 toward the making of the movie; we have 
filmed it, and are now two months away from completion.  We need just 
$25,000 to finish the film and
launch our distribution. You can help us do this with a tax deductible 
contribution.
Please give to our Indiego-go campaign. Donate what
you can—every amount helps – and please share this campaign with everyone you
know.  Together, we can help save lives.


More about the movie: All of Me is a feature
length documentary film focused on the lives of people who are
caught in the downward spiral of eating disorders and their struggle to regain
a sense of self-compassion and healing. Eating Disorders, which include Bulimia, Anorexia, Restricted Eating,
and Binge Eating, are one of the most hidden forms of addiction and disease in
our society. The film focuses on body image, a lack
of connection with one’s physical and emotional being, and the need to delve
deep within one’s self to find the systemic reasons that triggered the disease. The film is primarily shot in Vermont, however it will be
distributed across the United States.
Eating disorders are an addiction that we often do not perceive as such because it is the process of depriving oneself of the basic human need
to eat. But anorexia, bulimia and binging are ways to fill a hole in one’s
self—in the same way that drugs fill a hole of depression, anger, anxiety,
despair. Eating disorders stem from a feeling of “I’m not good enough” and,
like drug addiction, not eating somehow makes the person feel that they have a
coping skill; not eating is one way to control a part of
you that feels lost. Binge eating is also a coping skill and body
image issue. And, like drug addiction, the beginning of an eating
disorder can spiral into a full blown crisis where not eating food becomes the
overriding obsessive monster that takes over one’s life. In fact,Eating Disorders are one of the hardest addictions to treat and to cure.
We are inundated with images that promote “thinness” and many people can become
obsessed with their body types to the point of taking unhealthy control of
their eating habits. 



The percentage of young girls who
start dieting as young as 10-12 years of age has risen dramatically over the
last fifteen years in our country. All of Me includes a diverse
group of women of all shapes, colors, and sizes between the ages of 14 and 60.


Boys are also being affected by
mass media depictions of male bodies. All of Me includes stories from the male perspective.


Hearing parents’ stories is essential for
understanding the impact of these diseases on family and friends. All of Me
highlights the powerful stories of parents who struggle with their children who
battle these terrible diseases.




It’s not just about body image: All of Me, however,
will not simply focus on the media culture that girls and boys are overwhelmed
with, but will also delve into discovering the internal and systemic reasons
for eating disorders, such as low self esteem, trauma, mental health issues, a lack of self compassion and
sense of isolation that many young girls, boys and women feel.  There is
also a profound lack of connection to one’s physical body that happens with
eating disorders—women detach from their inner physical, soulful self and
fixate on their appearance only. What is this about? How do women and men get to this
place? What trigger pushes them to stop eating? Why does this control of food
become so critical to survive? What are the immediate external issues that are
pushing girls and boys to take control of their lives by controlling their
eating? How does our culture of driven perfection play into all this? How can
we provide prevention and intervention to folks who are susceptible to this
disease? How do we bring those afflicted back into their bodies in a
meditative, inclusive way that grounds them and empowers them, offering a sense
of wholeness rather than division?
The film will also highlight the work of Bree Greenberg-Benjamin who
runs the Vermont Center for Integrative
Therapy in Burlington, VT. Her
treatment center focuses on eating disorders. The film will focus on a number of her patients and the innovative work
that she is doing to treat folks with eating disorders. Bree is an expert in
the field and believes that, in order to heal folks, one must take a holistic
approach to treatment. Bree’s work includes not only talk therapy, but in-depth
work to bring these people back into their bodies through interventions
including meditation, yoga, acupuncture and group therapy.
Telling your story heals and starts an authentic
conversation: We know that telling your story helps heal people. The girls, boys, women
and parents who will be involved with this documentary will be asked to raise
their voices and speak out about this very invisible addiction.  Through
their stories they will move forward in their healing process and they will
impact audiences and raise consciousness on this important issue.

   
Touring and distribution of the film:


All of Me will premiere in Burlington,
Vermont in September of 2016. This will launch a 27 town tour through the
state. People from the film will appear with director Bess O’Brien at all the
screenings and be part of a Q & A with audiences afterwards.
From there, the film will launch a
national distribution plan. 

All of Me will be distributed to schools, colleges and
health centers across Vermont and beyond.
For more information please
contact Bess O’Brien at bobrien@pshift.com.
THANK YOU!!  Your support for our film is much needed and greatly
appreciated!


  Please give to our Indiego-go campaign. Donate what
you can—every amount helps – and please share this campaign with everyone you
know.
(Use the Indiegogo share tools!)
Together, we can help save lives.

story:
I’m Eric Hamburg.  Along with my partner Rick English, we’re producing a documentary called “Darryl Jones:  Like A Rolling Stone”.

This is a documentary film inspired by the story of Darryl Jones, musician extraordinaire and bass player for the Rolling Stones.  He is cool, calm, unflappable, but rock solid, both as a player and a person, always watching, listening and learning.  His keen intelligence informs everything that he does.  He is also a teacher and a mentor to young musicians.  Interviews for the film have already been conducted with Keith Richards, Ron Wood, Charlie Watts and others.

Many films have been made about the Stones, but none from this kind of unique insider’s perspective.  The film is somewhat comparable to the Oscar winning “Twenty Feet from Stardom”, with a bit of “Gimme Shelter” as well.  The film is made with the complete cooperation of Darryl Jones.  It is the story of his musical career, but will also document the making of Darryl’s first solo album, which is now in the works. 

Rick and I are lifelong Stones fans, so this project is a labor of love.  I’ve produced films like NIXON and ANY GIVEN SUNDAY with people like Oliver Stone and Anthony Hopkins.  Rick has done photography and video work for companies such as Nike, Apple and others.  Together, we made a documentary called “PREVENTING GENOCIDE”, featuring world leaders such as Kofi Annan, Bishop Desmond Tutu and others.

This is an exciting new project for us, and we want to share it with you.  Making a documentary is not cheap, especially a music documentary.  You need to get music rights, permissions and clearances, and pay legal fees as well as costs for filming and editing.  That’s why we’re asking for your help.

We’re launching an Indiegogo campaign to help raise funds for the film.  Depending on levels of giving, our perks will include everything from picks and T-Shirts to dinner with Darryl and opportunites to jam with him or watch him record in the studio.

Whatever you can give will help us make this film.  If you can’t give now, you can still help by spreading the word about the film.  Thanks very much for your help!

Eric and Rick

story:
Short Summary

Hey Everybody, let me share a little bit about me; my name is Marcos Sanz, I'm a Writer/Director that has been working on Film and Video for around 17 years now, I'm passionate about film, I love writing since I was a teenager and it has been my dream to make a feature film.

I worked in advertising, making TV commercials for 5 years before going to the Toronto Film School, I had a blast and perfected my writing and English there.

Now I decided it's time to make my feature film, I procrastinated a lot in the past years and always made a excuse about work and other projects, but this one, this is my baby and I want to share it with you.

I want to make comedies, and this sport comedy has been my baby and I've been working on it for a long time, as well as with other projects, but this one holds a huge part of my time, memories and soul.

I want YOU to be part of this dream, I want YOU to help me take this baby and make it grow, evolve and be seen by many other people.

This will always be an Indie project and will always be a part of you, you're giving life to this baby, you're giving a place to exist, that's a wonderful way to create, to be part of something, even if you're not physically on location you are going to be there in mind, and you're going to share our happiness and share our milestones, the same ones we're going to share on social networks.

You're always going to be part of the process, from the beginning, this beginning. Since the moment you read this, you're already part of this process, you're already givin life to this baby, to this project.

And for that, I thank you, THANK YOU SO MUCH for taking time to read this and to consider be part of this great project. THANK YOU.

Film Synopsis      

Summer Vibe is the intrepid adventure between two friends who work for the same advertising firm.  Together, they spend a month and a half business trip for a Beach Volleyball tournament in Los Cabos, Mexico where they end up having the time of their lives.

George, the party guy, who's always trying to pick up chicks, finds a way to bring his best friend Steve down to Mexico for their adventure.

Steve, the workaholic, finds the love of his life: the beautiful and athletic Sarah.

Steve finds out that Sarah is a beach volleyball player, and George convinces him to enter the Beach Volleyball tournament in order to win Sarah’s heart.

The only problem is Sarah's ex-boyfriend Jack, an egocentric narcissist beach volleyball player.

Jack also entered the Tournament with hopes of keeping Sarah while trying to defeat Steve and George.

With some knowledge in the indoors volleyball game, they seek the help of a trainer who just so happens to be a narcoleptic ex-professional player named Void.

Feel & Look

What We Need & What You Get

We need $150,000 USD for this movie to be made.

The money is going to be use for:

Casting: 

We want to have the best cast possible on a budget, we're trying to connect with people that add a unique experience to this project.

The project will have a multicultural and international talent, people from the US, Canada and Mexico.

Pre Production:

The location scout and perfect sceneries for a movie takes time and movie and specially, cost money. Local permits, rent deposit and more.

We are also having rehearsals, something any good movie needs, you cannot give your script to an actor and expect everything to be peachy, you need to rehearse and you need to be there with them, all of them and make changes if needed.

Set design: 

Even tho the setting of the movie is going to be in Los Cabos, we do need to create the bleachers for extras to be a part of this experience, if you want to be a part of this experience lets us know and we will be pleased to have you around the shooting dates (Travel expenses NOT INCLUDED)

EPK (Electronic Press Kit): 

Creating an EPK we will inform media outlets about this project, the one that you are allowing to come to life.

Marketing:

Any movie needs marketing, we have a strategy in mind, YOU, letting you guys be a part of all this is going to be our best marketing campaign and being a part of social networks (Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, SnapChat) We need content creators for this and Influencers to be part of this project, that's going to be our strategy.

Production:

We're shooting on RED camera and GoPro cameras for the special looks of the film, since it is going to be on the beach and it's going to be a sport comedy movie, there's a lot of action on a beach volleyball game and we want to be able to capture most of the stuff around.

The heart of the movie; THE CREW, needs to be paid, needs to be fed and needs to be happy with long hours under the sun, moving around sand with heavy equipment while they're being careful with it.

We also need to pay for the location, catering, assistants, drivers and all the people that helps us in the production.

That's where we are going to spend most of the money.

Post Production:
Editing:

Having a lot of footage on 4K takes A LOT of storage, We're going to have an assistant editor browsing for the best shots and setting things up for the chief editor to go thru EVERYDAY

The advantage of having a digital workflow is that if we mess up one shot, we can reschedule faster than waiting for film to be developed and sit thru dailies to re schedule months after everyone is home.

Color Correction:

Every GREAT, AMAZING, SUPERB movie you've seen has Color correction, this is needed for style and composition.

Audio Master:

ADR (Aditional Dialogue Recording) If we have a seagull screaming MINE, MINE, MINE, MINE while a line of dialogue is being said, we're NOT going to leave it like that, we do need to record it again, that's where ADR comes in.

Sound Mixing:

When you watch a movie, the steps, closing doors or fingers snapping sounds aren't actually recorded right there, you need to add it later and there's where the sound mix comes in handy.

MUSIC RIGHTS:

The music plays a really important part of any movie, since it sets up tone, climax and situations nicely and naturally. 

We do need to secure those rights if we want to have that music in there.

And finally

FINAL CUT:

No, not the apple software, the Final Cut of the film, the one all of you are going to enjoy, the one that you guys are making a possibility, the one that is going to be sent over digitally or on Blu Ray, We need to create those!

In any case we do not reach our goal, the money will be designated for pre-production and we're going to modify our budget to make at least a short film with it and have you guys enjoy what could've been.

We're going to make SOMETHING with that money and since you guys placed your trust on us, we're going to make it a short film.

The Impact

IndieGoGo suggests I point out my successful track record with projects like this here, unfortunately I don't have one(YET) But with your trust WE can have a successful track record. 

I have many other projects (TV Commercial and Corporate videos projects) But not a feature film.

Risks & Challenges

There are a lot of risks in any project, especially if you're shooting outside, on the beach.

It could rain, a sand storm, be cloudy with a chance of meatballs, I don't know... But everything is possible and we have to be prepared for any adversity nature throws at us. We could swap outdoor shot for indoor shots, we could shoot a pool scene instead of a sea scene, we can swap the order if we are well prepared to do so, we need to make our research and rehearse our parts.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you love this campaign but don't have money, do not worry, you can help us sharing our social networks, being there when it comes out, talk to us over our social profiles, have fun with our behind the scenes snapchats and instagram photos, YOU ARE a part of this project, this is a project for all of us, you can do great stuff being a part of our digital life.

Send a tweet to people you know, tag people you know in fb/twitter/instagram/snapchat, bring them all towards this project and together we can make this a FANTASTIC EXPERIENCE and give life to this project.

Thank you SO MUCH for being here, to read all of this and hopefully you can share/contribute to this project.

Product Placement Opportunities:

contact us at summervibethemovie@gmail.com

story:
SCORRETE PER LA DESCRIZIONE IN ITALIANO...

Not just a birthday present, but a gesture of heart from his friend and hopefully not only them.

We thought about this alternative gift to see if we could do something important for a friend ... a brother of life.

Always ready to lend a hand to everyone and in every situation:

For work he moved a few months ago in Pavia (Italy) but every weekend he's back in Pisa to be with us.



April 30th it was his birthday and we want to gift him with this, a fundraising to help him pay for his travels.

A lover of nature, food and laughter ...


... Back to Pisa almost always with his scooter along state roads, here are some slides :-)


So we launch this funding campaign with different objectives and a dream ... almost unachievable, we know, but what dream would otherwise?

For everybody we'll get Diego to keep a photographic diary of the natural wonders and cities that will cross along his multiple Pisa-Pavia journeys.

If by some miracle you reach the fifth step we will offer to any willing participant a beer in Pisa. You will have a year to reclaim your beer Emoticon smile

STEP I: € 60 of petrol coupons that will be used for a single round trip pisa-pavia

STEP II: 120 € of petrol vouchers in order to cover 2 weekends

STEP III: 240 € of petrol vouchers. These will last a month of travels

STEP IV: € 440. Same as STEP III, plus a new set of tires for his motorbike

STEP V - THE DREAM:€ 6900. A slightly used (just 12900 km) BMW K 1200 R Sport.

ITALIANO:

Non solo un regalo di compleanno ma  un gesto di cuore da parte di amici e speriamo non solo di loro.

Abbiamo pensato a questo regalo alternativo per vedere se riuscivamo a fare qualcosa di importante per un amico... un fratello di vita.

Sempre pronto a dare una mano a tutti e in ogni situazione:

Per lavoro si è trasferito da qualche mese a Pavia (Italia) e tutti i fine settimana torna a Pisa per stare con noi.


Il 30 Aprile era il suo compleanno  e questo vuole essere il nostro regalo, una raccolta fondi per aiutarlo a pagare i suoi viaggi.

Amante della natura, del cibo e delle risate...


...torna a Pisa quasi sempre con il suo scooter percorrendo strade statali, ecco alcune diapositive :-)



Perciò lanciamo questa campagna fondi con vari obbiettivi e un sogno... poco realizzabile, lo sappiamo, ma altrimenti che sogno è?

Per tutti i partecipanti convinceremo Diego a fare un reportage fotografico delle meraviglie naturali e delle città che attraverserà lungo i vari tragitti Pisa-Pavia.

Se per qualche miracolo si raggiungesse il V STEP offriremo a tutti i partecipanti che vorranno una birra a Pisa città. Avrete a disposizione un anno per reclamare la vostra birra :-)

I STEP: 60€ di buoni benzina che servono per coprire un viaggio di andata e ritorno pisa-pavia

II STEP: 120€ di buoni benzina per coprire due weekend

III STEP: 240€ di buoni benzina per coprire un mese di viaggi

IV STEP: 440€ buoni benzina per coprire un mese di viaggi + 2 gomme nuove per il suo scooter

V STEP - IL SOGNO: 6900€ Una Bmw K 1200 R Sport usata con pochi kilometri (12900) 

PER OGNI INFORMAZIONE: pieropieripisa@gmail.com
story_txt:
SCORRETE PER LA DESCRIZIONE IN ITALIANO...Not just a birthday present, but a gesture of heart from his friend and hopefully not only them.
We thought about this alternative gift to see if we could do something important for a friend ... a brother of life.
Always ready to lend a hand to everyone and in every situation:
For work he moved a few months ago in Pavia (Italy) but every weekend he's back in Pisa to be with us.April 30th it was his birthday and we want to gift him with this, a fundraising to help him pay for his travels.A lover of nature, food and laughter ...... Back to Pisa almost always with his scooter along state roads, here are some slides :-)So we launch this funding campaign with different objectives and a dream ... almost unachievable, we know, but what dream would otherwise?For everybody we'll get Diego to keep a photographic diary of the natural wonders and cities that will cross along his multiple Pisa-Pavia journeys.If by some miracle you reach the fifth step we will offer to any willing participant a beer in Pisa. You will have a year to reclaim your beer Emoticon smileSTEP I: € 60 of petrol coupons that will be used for a single round trip pisa-paviaSTEP II: 120 € of petrol vouchers in order to cover 2 weekendsSTEP III: 240 € of petrol vouchers. These will last a month of travelsSTEP IV: € 440. Same as STEP III, plus a new set of tires for his motorbikeSTEP V - THE DREAM:€ 6900. A slightly used (just 12900 km) BMW K 1200 R Sport.ITALIANO:Non solo un regalo di compleanno ma  un gesto di cuore da parte di amici e speriamo non solo di loro.Abbiamo pensato a questo regalo alternativo per vedere se riuscivamo a fare qualcosa di importante per un amico... un fratello di vita.Sempre pronto a dare una mano a tutti e in ogni situazione:Per lavoro si è trasferito da qualche mese a Pavia (Italia) e tutti i fine settimana torna a Pisa per stare con noi.Il 30 Aprile era il suo compleanno  e questo vuole essere il nostro regalo, una raccolta fondi per aiutarlo a pagare i suoi viaggi.Amante della natura, del cibo e delle risate......torna a Pisa quasi sempre con il suo scooter percorrendo strade statali, ecco alcune diapositive :-)Perciò lanciamo questa campagna fondi con vari obbiettivi e un sogno... poco realizzabile, lo sappiamo, ma altrimenti che sogno è?Per tutti i partecipanti convinceremo Diego a fare un reportage fotografico delle meraviglie naturali e delle città che attraverserà lungo i vari tragitti Pisa-Pavia.Se per qualche miracolo si raggiungesse il V STEP offriremo a tutti i partecipanti che vorranno una birra a Pisa città. Avrete a disposizione un anno per reclamare la vostra birra :-)I STEP: 60€ di buoni benzina che servono per coprire un viaggio di andata e ritorno pisa-paviaII STEP: 120€ di buoni benzina per coprire due weekendIII STEP: 240€ di buoni benzina per coprire un mese di viaggiIV STEP: 440€ buoni benzina per coprire un mese di viaggi + 2 gomme nuove per il suo scooterV STEP - IL SOGNO: 6900€ Una Bmw K 1200 R Sport usata con pochi kilometri (12900) PER OGNI INFORMAZIONE: pieropieripisa@gmail.com

story:
About me

Hi, I'm Abbas Noori Abbood, I grew up in a barbershop in Sadr City, Baghdad. Soon after the war began, I emigrated to Egypt working as an actor in films and theater. Then I came to the United States and now I'm an American citizen.

Bicycle Barbershop

I've been exploring how people cope amidst political conflict though a project called “Bicycle Barbershop” in which I give free haircuts, filming the relaxed conversational encounter of my itinerant barbershop. I've filmed these encounters in Tunisia and Egypt (an excerpt here: https://vimeo.com/157864792/d39c1c7a7c)

Where we are now

And now I'm continuing this project in New York. With filmmaker Craig Marsden, we filmed haircuts with war journalist/professor Christian Parenti and ex-Marine/playwright Maurice Decaul. (https://vimeo.com/130832056, pw = Abbas). This caught the attention of Al Jazeera International, who recently produced a piece about this work. 

With the arrival of election season and the ongoing tonsorial challenges of Donald Trump, we thought, why not give him a haircut? With seed funding and press credentials from Al Jazeera, we traveled to Florida for the lead-up to the March 15th primary, filming informal meetings with haircuts in a variety of places across Florida.

The anxiety around borders and politics of fear have created a sense of urgency around this project. Are we losing the ability to talk to one another? Wherever there is a haircut, something else happens. People relax, speak informally, come together. What can these encounters tell us about this moment?

What we need

We're working with the talented editor/filmmaker Doron Max Hagay and need to continue editing!

So far, we have eight episodes –more actually– of material. A very roughly cut sample of the first episode is here: https://vimeo.com/168066526/e4ea29d9ee.  It's  long and a bit slow, but a start. We have so much we'd like to share with you!

But we've run out of funds. We've been able to travel and shoot the material for the series, but can't afford to edit them. Each episode costs $1,500 to post-produce.

Can you help?

Can you help? Even $25? $300 buys us a day of editing. Every dollar helps us realize our goal!

Help us finish these pieces!

story:
Hi Changemakers, We are happy to welcome you to our crowdfunding campaign and are very pleased you’re taking time to help us achieve this amazing vision of a better tomorrow. UNAS started 2 years ago when I first heard how much money companies like Facebook and YouTube were earning on video advertisement. They are earning billions because advertisers want to reach us with their commercials. I, like many others, was bothered of how often these ads were played. I didn’t visit those websites for advertisement but to stay in touch with friends & family or to watch the latest music videos. This whole industry is so inefficient that making and selling ad blockers is a profitable business now, yet advertisers keep spending billions on those websites… I knew something had to change and I started thinking about what I could do to change all of this. There should be a place where we are willing to see ads in order to keep the other websites ad free, but in order for me as a user to visit any website and watch ads willingly it had to be about more than just keeping Youtube & Facebook ad free. Then in January 2015 I knew what I had to do. The website would be donating to charities!

 

 

I quickly searched for a team that could get this idea of the ground and only contacted the brightest people. Thankfully all of them were excited to work with me in order to make UNAS a global movement. Now 2 years later we have built a platform that can revolutionize not only the ad industry but also the NPO NGO industry. We are ready to start helping those who need it most and we hope that you are willing to join us by signing up on www.unas.world and if possible support us with what will be the last money you ever donate from your own pockets.

 

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We funded UNAS ourselves and made it happen. We have used all of our time, expertise, network and savings to get this movement going. We have some perks for you simply because we want you to have the opportunity to be remembered as a Giver of the first hour  : )

But what we really need is for you to visit our website and watch our promo video. This is very important because advertisers work with advertisement networks and our ad network partner told us that we would need at least 10.000.000 unique visits to our site within a month in order to get 1$ per ad viewed. This means if 10.000.000 good people visit our website during the marketing stage, we will be able to donate 50 cents in your name to each charity who’s video you’ve watched. Simply by watching 1 video every day you would be donating 15$ monthly to those charities!!! So tell your friends and share this campaign on social media to get the 10.000.000 views necessary.

 

 

The Impact

We are making life easier for everyone who uses Facebook, YouTube or any other social media platform by getting rid of the video advertisements there after some time. But we will really make an impact on the many people who truly are in need of help. On UNAS all charities, small and big, will be able to upload “impact videos” and gather funding without any marketing costs. That means more money will go to those in need. We will also be able to stop funding those charities who say they do good but actually are not doing anything worthwhile. In order to keep social control on charities we have built a community section where all of you can discuss certain charities and their projects. This way we can educate each other and make sure we support those charities who are really trying to create a positive impact. We have already partnered with many charities, thanks to our skilled team, who are thrilled about UNAS and we are sure to sign up more once we show them that this is the future of giving.

 

 

Impact videos – What are they?

We call videos on our website impact videos because we do not allow any guilt creating videos with suffering animals, dying children and such but rather simple videos of achievements, recorded with a smart phone or tablet by the people that are doing the charities good work. Impact videos are videos of achievements by the charity that leave us with a happy feeling instead of guilt. Videos of an animal being released back into the wild or of a key to a house being given to a family that has lost its home to a natural disaster. Impact videos will show us what it is the charity is doing and why we should keep funding them. And it is also a way to get to know the volunteers who take time every day to create a positive impact.

 

 

Win Win Win For everyone involved

 

Benefits for YOU

  • No more annoying advertisements where we do not want them
  • No contracts; Never spending your own money
  • Exploring new and small charities 
  • Seeing exactly what our funds are being used for
  • Being part of a global movement that makes the world a little less horrible

 

Benefits for Advertisers

  • 1 place for all their advertisements
  • Knowing that every viewed ad creates a positive impact
  • Combining advertisement and CSR budgets
  • Knowing that viewers of their ads are left with a positive feeling rather than annoyance


Benefits for Charities

  • No marketing expenditure
  • More exposure than before and a bigger funding pool than anywhere else
  • Connecting with followers instantly and creating a true bond with us
  • Enrolling more volunteers since impact videos show true human interactions

 

Perks

 

For press kit inquiries and high resolution photographs please contact us at: 

press@unas.world

1 place for all their advertisements
Knowing that every viewed ad creates a positive impact
Combining advertisement and CSR budgets
Knowing that viewers of their ads are left with a positive feeling rather than annoyance

story:
What It's All About

As I get older, I want to make a difference in the world around me.  I want to do more than pay for someone's coffee or groceries or donate to a charity. I want to really touch people's lives. So earlier this year, I envisioned this app as a way to do that.  Learning to be kind to myself - kinder than anyone else has ever been to me - continues to touch every aspect of my life, and I want others to experience that, too. My life is pretty good these days, but it wasn't always. I've had my share of depression, heartbreak, stress and anxiety. I've felt completely disempowered and overflowing with despair. Although I don't live with those feelings anymore, I know how to be kind and compassionate with myself when they arise. And that makes all the difference.

When those feelings do arise, we need certain things.  And that's where the app comes in. Here's how it will make a difference:

  • You can't shift your self-judging thoughts if you don't know how! And if you don't know how, they can spiral out of control. Access the app for suggestions and practices that will teach you how. Read or stream audio - your choice.
  • You can't shift your thinking or feelings when you're lost in racing thoughts. But if a message pops up on your phone every few hours, reminding to you to stop and breathe, reconnect to your body, remember a time when you felt safe... this could be all someone needs to shift their perspective.
  • Practice, practice, practice, every day, until it becomes a new, healthy, happy habit. The app will monitor your progress in developing a new habit.
  • Sometimes you need a hand, a shoulder, an ear. You need a space to reach out to others who get it. This is community of people expanding their capacity for self-love and simultaneously their compassion for others. They will get it and send support.

And when your own capacity for compassion for others is ballooning, you can:

  • Inspire others!
  • Offer support!
  • Celebrate and share your growth and that of the community.

 

The Real Impact

When we learn to really hear and see all the aspects of ourselves with kindness, healing can finally begin. Our perspectives shift. Many of our needs start to feel met. And, at the same time, learning to forgive ourselves, rather than judging ourselves, and learning to give ourselves what we need, rather than waiting for others to give it to us, is the basis for true empowerment. 

And being kind and compassionate to ourselves amplifies our compassion for others. This is what will make the world a better place! Relationships would be easier if we could soothe ourselves and meet many of our own needs. Following our hearts would be natural if we all felt empowered to live our lives the way we choose. I believe even violence and crime would go down if we felt loved, empowered, enough. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need funding to pay for app development and design. This is a place and a time where all of us can step in together and help. Your monetary gifts will make this possible, but so would development or design skills if you are willing to offer them.

I'm offering as many cool perks as I can dream up, but if you think of something else, suggest it! All of the perks include a year of free access to the premium app.

If you want to invest in the app, contact us to see if we can make that work for you.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help.  You could:

  • Share this page passionately with your own community!
  • Outside of Facebook, please send emails and tell people why you believe in this idea!

And that's all there is to it. We can do this, I know.  

Let's transform the world together, one heart at a time!

 

More Info and practices / meditations/ inspiration coming soon here - 

http://www.iluvmeapp.com/

https://www.facebook.com/ILuvMeApp/

story:
Greetings, I'm the director of ROBERT BLY: A Thousand Years of Joy, and happy to report that from our festival screenings around the world, I know the film is striking a powerful chord with audiences. Now is the time to help more people see the film, and Public Television is the ideal venue.

We've lined up a great PBS affiliate to be the required presenting station, and we have a veteran PBS station relations person to promote and market within the PBS network. (Unlike a nationally syndicated PBS show like, for example, American Experience or Nova, individual programs like ours have to work their way into the network station by station). We have a perfect broadcast tie-in with National Poetry Month in April. What we need in order to launch these efforts is funding. Programs like ours are offered for FREE to the PBS network, while we must cover costs such as station fees, closed-captioning, marketing, etc. (It's been this way for decades with Public Television.) And because 82 mins. is an uneven length (programmers think in terms of hours and half-hours) to schedule, and our goal is acceptance by the greatest number of stations, we will be making a one-hour version. That requires hiring an editor and other costs but insures the highest likelihood of getting picked-up.

The perks offered are all the films I've made featuring Robert, along with a wonderful recent collection of his poetry. Most importantly you will be helping ROBERT BLY: A Thousand Years of Joy be seen on television.

To our international friends, your support is needed, too. A Public Televison broadcast will help open doors to non-US broadcasters and venues.

To pull this campaign off, we also welcome and need your help in alerting more people about it. Please spread the word via social media (Facebook especially as the film has a FB page), Twitter, emails, posts, etc. Indiegogo offers sharetools on its site to help.

With your support, down the road we will have the pleasure of posting the stations and times when the film will be aired. I'm sure you'll agree that in times like these, finding ROBERT BLY: A Thousand Years of Joy on your local PBS station will be a very fine thing indeed.
Many thanks,

Haydn Reiss

story:
We have less than a week left! 

The film has been extremely well received & we have gotten nothing but complements. But just like you can't pay your bills with verbal tips, we can finish the film with verbal complements

 

 

Hey everyone! We are Amanda & Michael Connolly. Collectively we have worked in the service industry for 20+ years. We build our production company while working in the service industry, so we have a bit of a soft spot for it. We believe that the people that bust their ass do deliver customers great service deserve a little recognition. So we decided to make Sex, Drugs & Hospitality. 

Sex, Drugs & Hospitalities give you an in depth look at the realities of working in the service industry; front of house, back of house, behind the Bar, behind the scenes and after-hours. From diners and breastaurants, to club, dives and cafes all around the world. Find out why X amount of the population choose this life of servitude and take a look at what goes on after last call.

Sex, Drugs & Hospitality is the 1st of its kind. A feature length documentary that tells a story from the industry's point of view. We will show all those things that hit so close to home; from Pet Peeves to perks, to all the realities that come with working in the industry. Moral of the story: we believe everyone should work at least one shift in the industry and the world would be a much nicer place.

Production of the film is funded, but now we need to raise the funds to put the final touches on the film. This film needs an awesome sound track: which can get pricy. We are need sounds & color editing, as well as promo material and film festival funds. Throwing in 5 bucks is like buying us a beer & its goes a long way for the film. So be a pall & pick up the tab

 

Keep up-to-date with the films progress & follow us:

https://www.facebook.com/sexdrugsandhospitality/

https://www.instagram.com/travellust_co/

https://twitter.com/TravelLust_co

Thanks for checking out our campaign! Please support the film
story_txt: We have less than a week left! The film has been extremely well received & we have gotten nothing but complements. But just like you can't pay your bills with verbal tips, we can finish the film with verbal complements  Hey everyone! We are Amanda & Michael Connolly. Collectively we have worked in the service industry for 20+ years. We build our production company while working in the service industry, so we have a bit of a soft spot for it. We believe that the people that bust their ass do deliver customers great service deserve a little recognition. So we decided to make Sex, Drugs & Hospitality. Sex, Drugs & Hospitalities give you an in depth look at the realities of working in the service industry; front of house, back of house, behind the Bar, behind the scenes and after-hours. From diners and breastaurants, to club, dives and cafes all around the world. Find out why X amount of the population choose this life of servitude and take a look at what goes on after last call.Sex, Drugs & Hospitality is the 1st of its kind. A feature length documentary that tells a story from the industry's point of view. We will show all those things that hit so close to home; from Pet Peeves to perks, to all the realities that come with working in the industry. story:
So I'm on this quest, during the 2016 season, to document why people are Lions fans, despite all the losing

My name is Mike. I have been in video production for many years. I came up with this idea for a documentary on being a Lions fan last year when my son was born.

This campaign is important to me because I think that there is a lot that we can learn about society as a whole from looking at the people who are Lions fans, the perennial "There's always next year" folks.

Right now, I plan on going to the majority of the home games and interviewing Lions fans. I want to show off the city of Detroit as well as I think the fate of both the city and the team are forever linked. The more contributions I get, the more Detroit music I can use. It will also cover some post production costs and festival submissions to show the world what it means to be a Lions fan.

What I need & what you get

The more help I can get, the better this doc will be. I've done things with zero budget before, and they never go very far. I want to take the funds that I get to make sure that the people who see this documentary get a real feel for what it's like to be a fan of the Detroit Lions. Even if partially funded, the money will be used to make this documentary as Detroit as it can possible be, from music to images.

Contributors will get a variety of things from thanks to a copy of the documentary to an invite to the screening in Detroit.

story:
A lifelong cinephile, I have been making films for several years. Since 2016, I have made five shorts. The past two in particular, The Syrian and Wet Sand, are projects that I regard as my children—I wrote, directed, produced, and edited them. (My IMDb page includes a complete filmography.) To date, my work has been seen by audiences in LA, NYC, Spain, Italy, and Romania.

Matriarch marks my first foray in feature filmmaking. In embarking on my first feature-length project, I am telling a story that is just as personal—probably even more so—than my recent shorts. Anyone close to me will know that I was raised by a single mother who was still a teenager when I was born. My mother, while not dealt the most favorable of life circumstances, embodied strength and resilience and became my primary model for handling adversity. Like many individuals, she has struggled with depression and anxiety—along with countless external obstacles—but she has never succumbed to any obstacle, whether it be internal or external. Almost 45 years old now, she is thriving more than ever; she has grown deeply connected to spiritual life, has become a leader of her synagogue sisterhood, and is going to be newly married in October.

This story is inspired by her younger years; Christine, the protagonist of this movie, is not my mother. Factually, their lives are somewhat different. Spiritually and emotionally, however, Christine's story draws much inspiration from my mother's youth, as observed by me when I was a young child.

As with all of the films that I have made, I am taking a resourceful approach to production. Resourcefulness is something that I learned from studying up on the heroes of independent cinema (Linklater being chief among them for me). However, no feature-length film can be made without incurring a significant amount of expense.

For that reason, I ask for your support. With $15,000, I can hire topnotch collaborators and acquire all the resources (lighting equipment, grip gear, etc.) needed to meet the professional standards of cinema. Feature-length films are typically made for about $5 million at a minimum. However, several mavericks, including Christopher Nolan and Barry Jenkins, shot their first movies for $15K or less, and I take inspiration from them.

I have learned how to overcome many of the challenges of indie filmmaking by being thrifty and by simply having enough grit to keep making films. Although Matriarch poses more creative and logistical challenges than my past films, I know that I can overcome them. With $15K, I feel that I can comfortably bring my story to life on-screen, in a way that will resonate with audiences and catch the attention of festival programmers and industry professionals.

If you are not in a position to contribute monetarily but would still like to help, please feel free to share this page on social media. Also, please note that the preset contribution amounts are merely suggestions. Feel free to contribute any amount that you feel comfortable with. Thank you so much for your support!
