story:
About the Project: 

The Stories:

"Laughing Man":
Jesse White dreams of a career as a comedian. A dream he finds difficult too soon when his stagefright takes over during his first gig at an Open-Mic Night and causes him to stumble. In the days after, his failure haunts him and anxiety and racing thoughts take over. That is, until he thinks of the likes of Jim Morrison and Bill Hicks, and how they sought to expand their minds. Jesse impulsively turns to LSD to help inspire his creative side.

 

"Starlight":
Julius sees a bright light coming from the woods one afternoon nearby his home. He goes to investigate and sees (what appears to be) a man, holding a dead flower and, with a flash of the same light, brings the flower back to life. Julius learns that he is an extra-terrestrial sent to Earth to gather different forms of life for examination. After learning of his extensive universal knowledge, Julius begs to know the origins of the entire universe, but is he ready for what he finds?

 

My Story:

From a young age, I knew I wanted to be a filmmaker. 

I grew up being the only artistic person in my immediate family, and gravitated towards film and writing from the very early age of 4 when I was introduced to Star Wars. I also had discovered a deep love for music and began playing three instruments. When I struggled as a songwriter, I had felt lost. I was attending music college at the time. When everyone else around me was making strong headway with their own music, I felt stuck in a rut I couldn't get out of. It wasn't until my 2nd semester, that I rediscovered my love for writing, 

I started writing screenplays when I was 18. Beginning with a TV Pilot that I  was inspired to write based off an old report I did in High School, I quickly realized that this was my true calling. I had made my first feature film almost 4 years ago, when I was 20, entirely with my own money, and after that I decided to take a step back and focus more on my writing and my craft. Since then, I have written countless screenplays, including some features, and even had a Feature Film Screenplay accepted into the Beverly Hills Film Festival in 2018. 

Having been away from music for so long to pursue film, I had decided to challenge myself for both of these films. I will write, direct, AND compose a musical score for both films. This is something I have never done before - composing a score - but the idea of it gets me really interested and excited.

I also decided to take in more theatre in the last few years, including various shows at the Orpheum, and looking at the local scene, I was fortunate enough to come across some amazing talent. Especially coming from the incredible company of Minneapolis Musical Theatre. Holy crap, do they know how to put on a show!

*"High Fidelity: The Musical" @ Electric Fetus, Minneapolis. Photo owned by and courtesy of Minneapolis Musical Theater

*"Be More Chill" @ Illusion Theater in Minneapolis. Photo owned by and courtesy of Minneapolis Musical Theatre

Now, after the last few years of writing and absobing new stories and films every day, I'm ready to jump back on a set with all the new friends over these last few years and create something we can be proud of.

 

Goals:

The goal is around $3,600. 

Good news is that all the places we will film in we are getting to shoot for free. The other expenses will go towards cast, crew, equipment, catering, film festival fees, etc.

Ideally, Laughing Man would be a 3 to 4 Day shoot and Starlight would be a 1 day shoot. Both films will be shot back to back not long after the campaign ends, should we reach the funding goal!

I will be working with actors from my previous film as well as actors who are more in the Theater community here in Minnesota. All of them have amazing talents that I can't wait to show all of you. We also want to include local musicians for songs to be used in the films, like Al Church and a possibly (nothing is set in stone yet) a local artist who appeared on the Hamilton mixtape!

Once both films are done, we will submit to film festivals all across the world to display the talents of everyone involved. ANYTHING helps. Your contributions help, go spread the word, anything. We all really appreciate it, Let's do this.

story:
Short Summary

Hey there!

I'm Legacy, an aspiring actress, writer and now, future director who is making a film as a response to not getting as much work as I'd like.

As an Afro-Latina, and as a teen, I find it important to tell the stories of my people and to create more opportunity for people that look like me to be onscreen.

For this reason, I think a short film to continue my journey in the arts would be perfect.

I will be producing a film called" 'twenty": When tragic events rock the world of 6 teenage friends, they learn the beauty of friendship and support.

It's an ambitious but doable project with just a little help from you!

 

What We Need & Why

We need donations in order to secure the following:

  1. Locations to shoot.
  2. Licenses for song use.
  3. Costumes for the cast.
  4. Sound, editing & lighting equipment.
  5. Insurance & Permits to film in public.
  6. Company management to care for the cast and crew.

The Impact

This film will give visibility to minority youth. It not only allows us to do something fun but this project will create an environment for us to learn and grow in our chosen fields of work. (directing, acting, writing, producing, etc.)

Risks & Challenges

Our main challenge is meeting the deadline to enter the film into certain film festivals and competitions. We will need to start immediately and have a quick turnaround time in post to make this work.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to give monetary donations, that's fine! Donations in the form of costumes, transportation, equipment, and food are welcome as well. We ask that you please share this link on any of your social media platforms to help us on our way. We greatly appreciate your time and donations.

story:
I'd like to welcome you to our Indiegogo campaign. My name is David Bertucci, and I am the executive producer of BLOODLANDS and the owner of Gliding Eagle Entertainment. I have over 20 years experience in the entertainment business, and for the past two years, my production team and I have been working tirelessly to finance and complete this film.    

         Please take a look at my  Linkedin | IMDB | Facebook | Instagram | Twitter | Vimeo |

In 2006 I decided to leave Los Angeles and go back to my home town of Chicago and focus my time on Theatre and the family company Task Force Inc. I became part of a theater group at The Artistic Home Theatre in Chicago. We put together shows that would help showcase actors and help writers explore there work in Cut to the Chase workshops. But my life completely changed in 2010. I hope that you never experience a serious crime committed against you; an act that is intended to cause harm, It can deeply affect you and change your life forever. On November 25th, 2010, I was attacked by three muggers in Chicago, and as a result, I was in a coma for seven days.   

  

     https://chicago.cbslocal.com/2010/12/02/actor-found-seriously-injured-in-river-north/

After the attack, I was in bad shape, and I was scared. I woke up from the coma wondering why I was in the hospital. I was having a hard time remembering anything. I had double vision. I started to cry and cried for many months after. I felt that my life was over. I felt that I was never going to act, create or produce again, let alone live a normal life. It took me two years to heal. I worked with specialists tirelessly and was able to make a full recovery. After my recovery and soul searching I made a decision to leave Chicago and go back to LA in 2014. Film making and acting are my life and you can only get so far in Chicago. I left for Los Angeles, worked with old friends and built new relationships in the entertainment business, developed my project and invested my savings in BLOODLANDS but ran out of money to finish it... 

Half of  BloodLands is in the can, and with that footage, I was able to put together a trailer and a 23 minute proof of concept reel. It introduces the characters, some storyline, and shows the overall tone of the movie: a gritty, crime thriller with an ensemble cast.

OFFICIAL TRAILER...

      

23min PROOF OF CONCEPT REEL

Unfortunately, we weren't able to shoot any of the action scenes because they were cost-prohibitive. Those elements of filmmaking can't be cheated, or people get hurt. Through my prior (unsuccessful) Kickstarter campaign, I was able to meet awesome people that LOVE the story of BloodLands and want to contribute there time, knowledge, and resources to help finish it.

                                    

I met Nick Rian's owner of Ghost Ring Tactical through a long-time friend. Nick will be contributing his time as tactical advisor on BloodLands. Nick is also contributing his land in New Mexico for a location. This was a huge win for BloodLands. Nick Rians and Ghost Ring Tactical are helping save, what would have cost the production thousands of dollars because he believes in Bloodlands story.

Ghost Ring Tactical will give 10% OFF any 4-day classes, with a contribution of  $40 or more to BloodLands. You'll also be entered into a drawing to win ONE  4day class with Ghost Ring Tactical (a $1200 value) and a chance to play one of the bad guys in BloodLands using your amazing gun and fighting skills.

                      GHOST RING TACTICAL information  | Website | Facebook | Instagram |

                                       

                                        Nick Rians and David Bertucci practicing on the range

                                     

BloodLands had another huge win meeting Casting Director Jami Rudofsky at The Village Acting Studio, Jami read BloodLands and loved it. Jami will be contributing her time, knowledge, and resources to help cast the rest of BloodLands. 

Jami has been casting television, film, and theatre in Los Angeles for over to 20 years. Casting Credits include, the original Gilmore Girls,/CW And Gilmore Girls A Year In The Life NETFLIX, Masters of Sex/SHOWTIME, EMMY nominated Conversations in LA/AMAZON and Stargate Origins/MGM. Jami has been the Resident Casting Director and Artistic Associate at the award-winning Celebration Theatre for 13 years. Jami Rudofsky contribution also helps save, what would have cost production thousands of dollars because she believes in Bloodlands story.

Jamie Rudofsky (The Village Acting Studio) will be offering 20% off to her on-going audition classes, you'll be entered into a drawing for a chance to win a walk-on role in BloodLands and one free month in Jami's audition class with a contribution of $20 or more... 

                   Casting director Jami Rudofsky information | Website | Facebook | IMDB |

The contribution of these two top-notch people in their respected business is amazing and helps  save production cost

The wins keep coming. I met Justin Shadowrabbit_clay_guy   he is an artist and prototype designer who sculpts one-of-a-kind creations. All his sculptures are 100% hand-made using colored clay. He doesn’t use molds or paint so each piece is truly unique and customizable. I commissioned him to do a Senesi John Kresse claymation figure. Justin will be contributing his time and resources to BloodLands, giving one of kind claymation of the Bad ASS Sensei John Kresse, autographed by the Sensei himself for a fraction of his cost. |Website |

I have many people who believe in and contribute their time, knowledge and resources to complete BloodLands but I still have to rent equipment and cover production cost.

I'm raising $25,000 with a stretch goal for $35,000 for the film because filmmaking is costly, I can cut so many corners in different areas to keep the cost down. But I want to make a great film and I can't do it entirely alone, which is where you come in--every contribution will help me make this film and making it the best it can be.  Your generous contribution will go towards:

Paying the crew (DP, 1st AD, AC, Gaffer, Best Boy, Sound Mixer, etc)

Equipment Rentals (Arri Alexia camera, props, production cars(police, ambulance vehicles) 

Food & Transportation

Production Insurance 

I will proceed with an assembly edit, to establish any need for additional filming

Then I will (production) do complementary filming (money out of my pocket) if required

I will then go into post-production: Final editing, color grading, sound design, music scoring, up-scaling, etc.

Promotion and distribution to festivals (spreading the word as widely as possible is why we do this!)

As you can see, completing this film requires the expenses of equipment rentals,  traveling, filming, insurance, post-production, and distribution And for these, your much-appreciated contribution, no matter how small, would make a huge difference towards finishing BloodLands.

A serial killer is at large, butchering young migrant women on the U.S.-Mexican border. Detective Maria Trevino is obsessed with stopping the murderer at any cost, although before her investigation is over she will be drawn into a vast conspiracy of corruption that will not only threaten her life but put her very soul at hazard. How far over the line will she go? Will the hunter become the hunted? Will a cop become a criminal in the name of justice? Welcome to the suspense thriller that is BLOODLANDS 'a crime saga'. 

The cast includes Martin Kove (Karate Kid, Cobra Kai), Gina La Piana (Criminal Minds, Bones),  Jesse Kove (On Wings of Eagles), Jesus Ruiz (S.W.A.T., Get Shorty), myself, and many more!  

At the center of our story are three fantastic characters. Detective Maria Trevino is a woman trapped between two worlds on the U.S./Mexico Border. Her white male co-workers don’t trust her as a Hispanic woman. And her community, especially her activist daughter Elena, does not trust her as a cop. After discovering a serial killer, Trevino is forced to partner with the brother of a possible victim, Detective Braden Greggs. He is a combat vet and private contractor, tortured by the disappearance of his sister almost 20 years ago. He feels Trevino is in over her head, and she fears Braden will go on a slash and burn for the truth. Overseeing their investigation is the unscrupulous Sherriff who got Trevino fired, Lonnie Dugan, played by veteran actor Martin Kove in a revelatory performance. He must steer their investigation away from his corrupt interests. Together, their investigation reveals a deadly underworld – a world Trevino does not understand, a world Braden is all too eager to destroy, and a world Dugan can’t escape.

In addition, we have a sprawling ensemble of characters that take will take us into the many different corners of society. Miguel Carranza is a migrant worker whose best friend Carlos tragically dies on their journey to America. His character helps give voice to the real victims of the story, the poor and vulnerable migrant workers who live at the mercy of greater powers. Deputy Grus Dugan is Lonnie's son and right-hand man, he's a violent racist who doesn't have the same views as his father. Santino Garcia runs the trafficking corridor for his Cartel and treats his bloody empire as nothing more than a business. Elena Trevino is Maria’s precocious and idealistic 16-year-old daughter. The two love each other deeply but have a toxic relationship when it comes to Maria’s job. 

Each of these characters will be faced with moral choices on their path. The timid and good-natured Miguel will be tempted by a life of crime. Grus will have to find out how to stay alive. Dugan, weary from years of lying and killing, will have to decide if he still has it in him. And Maria Trevino, the moral center at the heart of BLOODLANDS, will have to choose how far she is willing to go for the truth.

Thank you so much for taking the time to look at my campaign page. You're Awesome...

                                                           

                       GLIDING EAGLE ENTERTAINMENT: Facebook | Twitter | Instagram | Vimeo
story_txt: I'd like to welcome you to our Indiegogo campaign. My name is David Bertucci, and I am the executive producer of BLOODLANDS and the owner of Gliding Eagle Entertainment. I have over 20 years experience in the entertainment business, and for the past two years, my production team and I have been working tirelessly to finance and complete this film.             Please take a look at my  Linkedin | IMDB | Facebook | Instagram | Twitter | Vimeo |In 2006 I decided to leave Los Angeles and go back to my home town of Chicago and focus my time on Theatre and the family company Task Force Inc. I became part of a theater group at The Artistic Home Theatre in Chicago. We put together shows that would help showcase actors and help writers explore there work in Cut to the Chase workshops. But my life completely changed in 2010. I hope that you never experience a serious crime committed against you; an act that is intended to cause harm, It can deeply affect you and change your life forever. On November 25th, 2010, I was attacked by three muggers in Chicago, and as a result, I was in a coma for seven days.          https://chicago.cbslocal.com/2010/12/02/actor-found-seriously-injured-in-river-north/After the attack, I was in bad shape, and I was scared. I woke up from the coma wondering why I was in the hospital. I was having a hard time remembering anything. I had double vision. I started to cry and cried for many months after. I felt that my life was over. I felt that I was never going to act, create or produce again, let alone live a normal life. It took me two years to heal. I worked with specialists tirelessly and was able to make a full recovery. After my recovery and soul searching I made a decision to leave Chicago and go back to LA in 2014. Film making and acting are my life and you can only get so far in Chicago. I left for Los Angeles, worked with old friends and built new relationships in the entertainment business, developed my project and invested my savings in BLOODLANDS but ran out of money to finish it... Half of  BloodLands is in the can, and with that footage, I was able to put together a trailer and a 23 minute proof of concept reel. It introduces the characters, some storyline, and shows the overall tone of the movie: a gritty, crime thriller with an ensemble cast.OFFICIAL TRAILER...      23min PROOF OF CONCEPT REELUnfortunately, we weren't able to shoot any of the action scenes because they were cost-prohibitive. Those elements of filmmaking can't be cheated, or people get hurt. Through my prior (unsuccessful) Kickstarter campaign, I was able to meet awesome people that LOVE the story of BloodLands and want to contribute there time, knowledge, and resources to help finish it.                                    I met Nick Rian's owner of Ghost Ring Tactical through a long-time friend. Nick will be contributing his time as tactical advisor on BloodLands. Nick is also contributing his land in New Mexico for a location. This was a huge win for BloodLands. Nick Rians and Ghost Ring Tactical are helping save, what would have cost the production thousands of dollars because he believes in Bloodlands story.Ghost Ring Tactical will give 10% OFF any 4-day classes, with a contribution of  $40 or more to BloodLands. You'll also be entered into a drawing to win ONE  4day class with Ghost Ring Tactical (a $1200 value) and a chance to play one of the bad guys in BloodLands using your amazing gun and fighting skills.                      GHOST RING TACTICAL information  | Website | Facebook | Instagram |                                                                               Nick Rians and David Bertucci practicing on the range                                     BloodLands had another huge win meeting Casting Director Jami Rudofsky at The Village Acting Studio, Jami read BloodLands and loved it. Jami will be contributing her time, knowledge, and resources to help cast the rest of BloodLands. Jami has been casting television, film, and theatre in Los Angeles for over to 20 years. Casting Credits include, the original Gilmore Girls,/CW And Gilmore Girls A Year In The Life NETFLIX, Masters of Sex/SHOWTIME, EMMY nominated Conversations in LA/AMAZON and Stargate Origins/MGM. Jami has been the Resident Casting Director and Artistic Associate at the award-winning Celebration Theatre for 13 years. Jami Rudofsky contribution also helps save, what would have cost production thousands of dollars because she believes in Bloodlands story.Jamie Rudofsky (The Village Acting Studio) will be offering 20% off to her on-going audition classes, you'll be entered into a drawing for a chance to win a walk-on role in BloodLands and one free month in Jami's audition class with a contribution of $20 or more...                    Casting director Jami Rudofsky information | Website | Facebook | IMDB |The contribution of these two top-notch people in their respected business is amazing and helps  save production costThe wins keep coming. I met Justin Shadowrabbit_clay_guy   he is an artist and prototype designer who sculpts one-of-a-kind creations. All his sculptures are 100% hand-made using colored clay. He doesn’t use molds or paint so each piece is truly unique and customizable. I commissioned him to do a Senesi John Kresse claymation figure. Justin will be contributing his time and resources to BloodLands, giving one of kind claymation of the Bad ASS Sensei John Kresse, autographed by the Sensei himself for a fraction of his cost. |Website |I have many people who believe in and contribute their time, knowledge and resources to complete BloodLands but I still have to rent equipment and cover production cost.I'm raising $25,000 with a stretch goal for $35,000 for the film because filmmaking is costly, I can cut so many corners in different areas to keep the cost down. But I want to make a great film and I can't do it entirely alone, which is where you come in--every contribution will help me make this film and making it the best it can be.  Your generous contribution will go towards:Paying the crew (DP, 1st AD, AC, Gaffer, Best Boy, Sound Mixer, etc)Equipment Rentals (Arri Alexia camera, props, production cars(police, ambulance vehicles) Food & TransportationProduction Insurance I will proceed with an assembly edit, to establish any need for additional filmingThen I will (production) do complementary filming (money out of my pocket) if requiredI will then go into post-production: Final editing, color grading, sound design, music scoring, up-scaling, etc.Promotion and distribution to festivals (spreading the word as widely as possible is why we do this!)As you can see, completing this film requires the expenses of equipment rentals,  traveling, filming, insurance, post-production, and distribution And for these, your much-appreciated contribution, no matter how small, would make a huge difference towards finishing BloodLands.A serial killer is at large, butchering young migrant women on the U.S.-Mexican border. Detective Maria Trevino is obsessed with stopping the murderer at any cost, although before her investigation is over she will be drawn into a vast conspiracy of corruption that will not only threaten her life but put her very soul at hazard. How far over the line will she go? Will the hunter become the hunted? Will a cop become a criminal in the name of justice? Welcome to the suspense thriller that is BLOODLANDS 'a crime saga'. The cast includes Martin Kove (Karate Kid, Cobra Kai), Gina La Piana (Criminal Minds, Bones),  Jesse Kove (On Wings of Eagles), Jesus Ruiz (S.W.A.T., Get Shorty), myself, and many more!  At the center of our story are three fantastic characters. Detective Maria Trevino is a woman trapped between two worlds on the U.S./Mexico Border. Her white male co-workers don’t trust her as a Hispanic woman. And her community, especially her activist daughter Elena, does not trust her as a cop. After discovering a serial killer, Trevino is forced to partner with the brother of a possible victim, Detective Braden Greggs. He is a combat vet and private contractor, tortured by the disappearance of his sister almost 20 years ago. He feels Trevino is in over her head, and she fears Braden will go on a slash and burn for the truth. Overseeing their investigation is the unscrupulous Sherriff who got Trevino fired, Lonnie Dugan, played by veteran actor Martin Kove in a revelatory performance. He must steer their investigation away from his corrupt interests. Together, their investigation reveals a deadly underworld – a world Trevino does not understand, a world Braden is all too eager to destroy, and a world Dugan can’t escape.In addition, we have a sprawling ensemble of characters that take will take us into the many different corners of society. Miguel Carranza is a migrant worker whose best friend Carlos tragically dies on their journey to America. His character helps give voice to the real victims of the story, the poor and vulnerable migrant workers who live at the mercy of greater powers. Deputy Grus Dugan is Lonnie's son and right-hand man, he's a violent racist who doesn't have the same views as his father. Santino Garcia runs the trafficking corridor for his Cartel and treats his bloody empire as nothing more than a business. Elena Trevino is Maria’s precocious and idealistic 16-year-old daughter. The two love each other deeply but have a toxic relationship when it comes to Maria’s job. Each of these characters will be faced with moral choices on their path. The timid and good-natured Miguel will be tempted by a life of crime. Grus will have to find out how to stay alive. Dugan, weary from years of lying and killing, will have to decide if he still has it in him. And Maria Trevino, the moral center at the heart of BLOODLANDS, will have to choose how far she is willing to go for the truth.Thank you so much for taking the time to look at my campaign page. You're Awesome...                                                                                  GLIDING EAGLE ENTERTAINMENT: Facebook | Twitter | Instagram | Vimeo

story:
Short Summary

Hello friends,

My names is Earl Wayne Crabtree II, and I am a story teller. Years ago the idea for North Baldwin came to me while delivering mail on a long, narrow, and dusty road called, well...you guessed it, North Baldwin. 

Over the next eight years two impactful moments helped for not only the stories structure, but message. When I was a child I experience the horrific September 11th attacks with a mind unable to grasp the scope of what had happened growing up in the midwest. Although it was frightening thinking our country could be attacked at any moment, I at least had the comfort of being from nowhere and far away from those attacks. 

One seemingly normal night as an adult man with two films under his belt, owning a film/photography company, and being overly tired from it all I decided to watch a 9/11 documentary. Without knowing I'd be incredibly moved experiencing the tragic events all over again but this time as an adult man, I found myself wide eyed, and in tears by the end. I knew this meant I had to do something, anything, even if it was a small contribution through my own love of filmmaking. So, I did.

I made this movie to remind us all of the tragic events, then uncanny heroism from not just the firefighter, policeman, physiatrists, doctors, but even the common man from the street that feel witness to the event. This movie is to remind us we are all for one and one for all. This films goal is to give, and to give to those who lost, to those who will truly NEVER FOGET, those brave people that live on. 

Help me make this possible! Help us do something that is truly great and selfless. If you were unable to give because you were a child like me, now is your chance to give. As the great David Letterman said himself, a small town in Montana was going through a two year drought when 9/11 happened. Even though they were broke and hungry, they got together and send NYC money as a group. If that doesn't tell you enough about the human spirit, I can't help you. 

FILM TEASER

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fOsOPwAjl1Y
 

What We Need & What You Get


Be more than just a "NEVER FORGET," post on September 11th this year. Let's raise $20,000 at least for the victims of this horrific crime. The money we raise will be divided evenly and personally given to one Policeman's family, Firefighter's family, Doctor's family, and two tower worker's families. The more money we raise the larger amount of people we can give back to. If we break $20,000 we will give to ten families!!!! 

 

The Impact

Everyone makes the 9/11 Never Forget post each year on the dot. Everyone in the world was affected by this day, and it still shows. Think of those that lost that day, lost loved ones. The lingering horror continues and this films goal is to do something this year, give something, even if it's just a dollar. 

This project aims to showcase the incredibly heroism of the human spirit in the face of terrible evil. It is a quality that cannot be described effectively with words, and thusly it's beyond admirable. Let's remind the world how connect we are, how much we love each other, and how we really won't, "Ever Forget." 

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest fear with this project is that those who are able to give ignore this because it's isn't September 11th. We fear pop culture is  the reason for many posts made on this day, and we want to get people to really think on this topic. Even if you can't give, don't just make a post on 9/11. Go back and watch the footage, get reacquainted with the day and feel something. This feeling we hope creates action, whether it's in your own lives, with friends or family, or for a cause you care about. Let's create this healthy action that is inside us all. Let's move away from the pop cultures fads, the monkey see monkey do attitude that social media has created, let's exist and give back.

Regards,

NWP Films

story:
Who We Are

Hello! We are two Palestinian-American women working to fund a short-film to act as a preview for a TV show pitch we have been working on to tell the stories of relatable minority women. We want to create a space where those behind the camera are as diverse as those in front of the camera and highlight the perspectives of characters that have yet to be featured in film and television. In a world of remakes, reboots, and reimagining male media with all female-casts, we hope to create original content about women who have not existed on your screens.

What We Need 

Luckily, we have matched up with a wonderful production company and some great resources in Atlanta, Georgia to fill the crew for this short. This crew will consist almost exclusively of minorities: women, queer folx, and people of color. Thus far in the process, many have backed the idea of this project and are donating their time and equipment to help make this happen. Even with all the support of this idea, we still need $6,000 to really solidify all we need to film in October. As short-film budgets go, this is a relatively small cost. This money will go towards paying musical talent, catering for cast and crew, lighting rentals, location costs, props, wardrobe, insurance, etc.! Any and all donations to this short are greatly appreciated and will go a long way in getting this project off the ground.

Why It's Important

Having grown up seeing no one that looks like us on TV, we want to give Arab women the space in media they deserve. We want brown girls and women to have characters to look up to and identify with - that are flawed, multi-faceted, knowable, and painfully believable.

story:
Everyone has to start somewhere.

 

With this fundraising campaign, we hope to kick off the start of a long career making short (and one day feature length) films. But it will only happen with the support of friends, family, and people like you. 

 

The Breakdown.

 

Just so you know where your money is going, here's a handy breakdown of what it costs to make a short film.

 - Food! = $1,000

 - Cast and Crew Wages = $2,500

 - Film Festival Submissions = $1,000

 - Props = $500

story:
Short Summary

In a world full of seemingly endless negativity and vanity, the documentary film TRUELOVE is the perfect antidote. This movie will bring on the hugs and happiness to all that witness a slice of life through the eyes of Callie Truelove, a 16-year-old girl with Williams syndrome, a rare genetic disorder that gives her the superpower of LOVE! Rooted in a deletion of a number of specific genes in the chromosome #7, this disorder can cause devastating physical and cognitive complications, but it also can have some near-miraculous side effects. Callie was created to always find the good in all people, places and things around her. This unburdened outlook on life comes from the heart of this angelic girl who touches the lives of everyone she encounters by either warming their day, making them smile, to changing their lives forever. This film will chronicle Callie’s journey as she spreads the love by meeting other very special people with Williams syndrome, and in the process.. makes some of their dreams come true!

What We Need & What You Get

This crowd awareness campaign has two main goals:

  1. Raising awareness of Williams syndrome across the globe! Help us spread the word by  posting and sharing with #WSaware and by sporting and sharing any of your Truelove Perks!
  2. Just to make it clear, this campaign is not raising funds to produce this film, but rather to help Callie make some big dreams come true for some very special individuals with Williams syndrome that she'll meet on her journey as part of our Film. The more people who support this campaign, the bigger the dreams we can make come true.

Every supporter of our campaign at any level will get a digital copy of the Film as soon as it is released. In essence, by participating you get to be one of the very first people to see this film! 

We have also designed some great perks, all aimed at raising awareness of William syndrome, while also spreading love and kindness... the kind that Callie sees through her eyes every day.

The Impact

Knowledge is power! And the first step is becoming aware. Williams syndrome is a rare genetic disorder that affects 1 in 10,000 people all over our planet. Greater awareness means greater understanding and acceptance, which will help change lives for everyone living with the condition, and those closest to them that are affected as a a family. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help! Use the Indiegogo share tools and spread the love by sharing, liking and commenting on your social media platforms.

For more information about Williams syndrome visit https://williams-syndrome.org

Follow our "See a Heart - Share a Heart" campaign on Instagram: @a.dose.of.truelove

About The Producers

TRUELOVE will be produced by Former Prodigy Media, a production company co-founded by Christopher Knight, better known for his iconic TV role as America’s favorite middle son, “Peter Brady” on “The Brady Bunch”, and his long time friend, two-time Emmy Award-nominated producer Phil Viardo. Viardo and his team have been working with the Truelove family for nearly two years, in order to figure out the best way to share Callie's superpower of Love with the world. When finished, we intend for this film to speak for itself! For more information on the company, please visit www.formerprodigymedia.com.

story:
Short Summary

Kinetosaur: The Legacy of John Payne is a short documentary about how the creator of kinetic dinosaur sculpturist John Payne who helped pioneer the Asheville River Arts District and launch a robust arts community in Western North Carolina. He created fourteen magnificent, fully interactive, recycled metal dinosaur sculptures with exposed mechanics inspired by actual fossils. In 2003, sculptor and innovator John Payne purchased a wedge-shaped building in a forgotten, industrial area in Asheville, NC. John would go on to open the doors of this building to other artists and entrepreneurs which would eventually become the hub of what is known today as the River Arts District. Handpicking each artist that worked in his building, John would often subsidize the rent through creative projects in order to help struggling artists. His legacy continues to thrive today with over twenty studios and businesses calling the Wedge home. John’s "Kinetosaurs" still roam the earth as part of a national traveling exhibition to the delight of audiences young and old. Following a six-month run at The Children's Museum of Indianapolis, the exhibit began a six-year tour of sites throughout North America. Through a mix of interviews and archival footage we bring you John’s story from the perspective of those who knew him best.

Photos of John courtesy of Michael Mauney.

From the Director

John Payne was a key figure in the development of the River Arts District in Asheville, NC. Preserving his story for future generations is a cornerstone of this project. John empowered so many artists and gave them an opportunity to pursue their creative passions by providing them with an affordable place for them to work. I know this about John first hand, as I was one of those artists whom he gave a chance. I first met John in my twenties when I was living in a land squat close to the Wedge building just shortly after he purchased the building. John was so kind and always had inspiring words of wisdom to share. From that moment I began dreaming of finding my creative self. About five years later that dream came true, when I began working with a group of filmmakers in the building.

We are raising finishing funds for our documentary “Kinetosaur: the Legacy of John Payne.”  For more than a year we have been working diligently researching, shooting interviews and other footage, and gathering archival media related to John’s work and the impact he has had on Asheville and the greater region.  That’s why we are asking for your help!

John’s story is an example of how one man can influence an entire culture, and with this documentary we want to inspire another generation of artists to be bold and adventurous in the pursuit of discovery; to create larger-than-life expectations for themselves just as John did.  As a contributor, you will not only help us finish the documentary, but also help us market and distribute it to museums, schools, universities, libraries, and to more conventional avenues such as film festivals, On-Demand platforms (like Amazon Video, iTunes, Google Play, Youtube, etc.) and public broadcast television programs (like PBS’ Reel South and POV).

What We Need & What You Get

In total, we are asking for $25,000 in grassroots donations to pay for equipment/personnel to shoot one or two more interviews with key people, hire a sound designer and music composer, hire a professional title designer, and pay for additional marketing and advertising for the premiere in early Spring 2020.

Check out our composer, Meg Mulhearn's soundcloud page here.

Currently, we have what’s called an “assembly cut” where the basic structure of the film is outlined, and we are continuing to embellish and finesse the cut into its final form, known as “Picture Lock.”  The film then goes through the Sound Design process where the sound-scape is created. This is done by closely editing and cleaning existing audio, and recreating sounds in a controlled environment known as “Foley.”  Next, a Composer comes on board to arrange original music to compliment the “Picture Lock.” Finally, we finish the film with professional titles, color correction to give the film its final “look,” and formatting to prepare it for a formal release.

If we don’t reach our intended goal of $25,000, not to worry.  By scaling back some of these elements, doing what we can ourselves, and limiting the overall vision for the marketing campaign, we can still deliver a short documentary that we and the donors can be proud of.  Reaching our goal however is still the main priority, with proper funding we believe that a larger audience can benefit from John Payne’s unique impact on the art world and American culture.

 

 

The Impact

So far, BackRow Films has been responsible for two successful crowdfunding campaigns raising a total of over $35,000 for narrative projects.  “Ultimate World” a fictional comedy was crowdfunding successfully this summer through Seed&Spark and is set for festival release through BackRow Films in December 2019.  

BackRow Films are a proud collective of filmmakers, musicians, performers, and other artists who first bonded in the back row of our class at film school in North Carolina.  Through our natural leadership and love for original stories, we formed a crew of repeat collaborators committed to creating “alternative” narrative and non-fiction content, and supporting emerging talents who challenge contemporary forms and processes of  the cinematic arts. With a focus on motion-picture development, BackRow Films hopes to bolster independent-minded filmmakers, performers and their projects.

Due to our North Carolina artistic roots "Kinetosaur: The Legacy of John Payne" is a singularly important project for us and directly reflects our own values as filmmakers.

The Filmmakers

Director/Editor: Mitch Rumfelt

cut his teeth as a filmmaker when his first independent feature Wanderlost was selected for The IFP Emerging Narratives Lab, which went on to receive an international DVD distribution deal. Since graduating from UNC School of the Arts with a BFA in filmmaking Mitch has maintained a creative and logistical presence in the North Carolina film industry. Serving as a producer, award winning editor, and location specialist for the North Carolina Film Office. He is a production guru on commercials, music videos, documentaries, and feature narrative films.  He currently resides in Asheville, North Carolina dedicating himself to fostering unique and emerging perspectives in the independent film world.

Producer: Kyle Andrew Bell

is a Los Angeles based narrative and documentary filmmaker from North Carolina. He graduated with a rare hybrid-degree from UNC School of the Arts where he produced and starred in many award-winning short films. Rota, the only student film to win Best Narrative Short at Riverrun International Film Festival, was also recognized with Jury Awards from FantaFestival and Another Hole In The Head. Beast, starring, produced, and co-written by Bell, went on to win Best International Short by Cine//B and was nominated for Best Student Film by Ivy Film Fest at Brown University. In all, his works have screened in over thirty different countries, at various venues including the Director’s Guild of America in Los Angeles, FID Marseille, France, and a special curation by The Museum of the Moving Image in New York City. Bell recently formed BackRow Films where he continues to produce, act, and engage with emerging talents in the cinematic arts.

Director of Photographer: Daniel Judson

is a Producer and Director of Photography with nearly fifteen years experience in commercial and entertainment production. His work has appeared on MTV, BET, VH1 and HBO. He has shot, edited and produced music videos for several major label artists as well as many independent acts including, two Grammy Award winners.  He served as Director of Photography on the independent narrative feature film “Wanderlost,” which was selected for the IFP Emerging Narratives Lab and it went on to win several festival awards, including Best Cinematography on its way to distribution. He DP’d the feature documentary “We Won’t Bow Down” while also co-producing the film. His commercial work has appeared in national and regional markets across the US and his entertainment work has earned festival awards around the world. 

Risks & Challenges

Though you can never fully anticipate how successful a film will be our team is dedicated to lovingly telling the story of John Payne.  Aside from the creative responsibility of the story much of the success of today's films are due to enough funds being reserved for social media and marketing.

We understand: times are tough.  If you just cannot make a contribution today, then please simply help us share the word!  Follow, like, subscribe to our social media sites, and tell all your friends about John and our project!  At the very least, please share some cool kinetic-dinosaur photos because who doesn’t like dinos!?
story_txt:
Short Summary
Kinetosaur: The Legacy of John Payne is a short documentary about how the creator of kinetic dinosaur sculpturist John Payne who helped pioneer the Asheville River Arts District and launch a robust arts community in Western North Carolina. He created fourteen magnificent, fully interactive, recycled metal dinosaur sculptures with exposed mechanics inspired by actual fossils. In 2003, sculptor and innovator John Payne purchased a wedge-shaped building in a forgotten, industrial area in Asheville, NC. John would go on to open the doors of this building to other artists and entrepreneurs which would eventually become the hub of what is known today as the River Arts District. Handpicking each artist that worked in his building, John would often subsidize the rent through creative projects in order to help struggling artists. His legacy continues to thrive today with over twenty studios and businesses calling the Wedge home. John’s "Kinetosaurs" still roam the earth as part of a national traveling exhibition to the delight of audiences young and old. Following a six-month run at The Children's Museum of Indianapolis, the exhibit began a six-year tour of sites throughout North America. Through a mix of interviews and archival footage we bring you John’s story from the perspective of those who knew him best.

Photos of John courtesy of Michael Mauney.
From the Director
John Payne was a key figure in the development of the River Arts District in Asheville, NC. Preserving his story for future generations is a cornerstone of this project. John empowered so many artists and gave them an opportunity to pursue their creative passions by providing them with an affordable place for them to work. I know this about John first hand, as I was one of those artists whom he gave a chance. I first met John in my twenties when I was living in a land squat close to the Wedge building just shortly after he purchased the building. John was so kind and always had inspiring words of wisdom to share. From that moment I began dreaming of finding my creative self. About five years later that dream came true, when I began working with a group of filmmakers in the building.

story:
Ansiedad is an advocacy senior thesis film, written by Karina A. Diaz. This story was created in order to provide education on the topic of anxiety ("ansiedad," as it's known in Spanish), as well as to create a conversation in communities where it isn't openly spoken about. It is a perspective on mental health through the lens of culture and faith intertwined. 

The story follows a latina college student in her final months of school before graduation. Her ambitious plans for her future are jeopardized when she takes an impossible course with an unsympathetic professor. The thought of potentially not graduating, along with the pressures of being a first generation student manifest her anxiety.  Not only does she endure the academic battle but also the internal battle against her growing anxiety.

We're seeking your financial support, which would allow this film to complete its goal of bringing empathy and support to those affected by anxiety as well as break stigma surrounding it. Many suffer in silence, but through this film we hope to give their voice an opportunity to be heard. 
Your financial support would be applied towards all cost related to cast, auditions, film equipment, location rentals, craft services, marketing, film festival entries, etc.

We humbly ask you to strongly consider financially supporting this film. In doing so you are helping in creating awareness and advocacy for mental health. Thank you in advance for your consideration.

story:
OVERVIEW


Sophia's grandparents and great-grandparents (Sophia的曾祖父母和祖父母）

A second-generation Taiwanese American (Sophia) travels to her mother's hometown in Tainan, Taiwan to discover the history behind her great-grandparents’ 60+ year old sauce company, Mercy Food.

With the current timeline, our plan is to film the documentary in approximately one week during the spring in the food capital of Taiwan. This will be right after the factory finishes their renovations. We will also feature local food, sights, and culture.


企劃概述

一個第二代台美人Sophia (張詠慧）計劃到她母親台南的故鄉，發掘她曾祖父母有60年歷史的醬料公司，慈光食品。

依照目前的時間表，我們計劃在台灣的美食之都-台南，以一個星期拍攝記錄片，也會包括當地的美食、景觀和文化。

 

KEY CREW | LI HO! 你好!


From left to right: Sophia, Alan, Melly

Sophia J. Chang is the producer, director, and the great grand daughter of the sauce factory's founders. She previously produced and directed her mini web series on family recipes, MeNU.

Alan Chung is our brilliant, Taiwanese American director of photography who has previously worked on videos with companies such as Netflix, Walmart, and Toyota.

Melly Lee is our incredible set photographer whose clients have included Beyoncé, Google, Warner Bros., LEGO, and UNIQLO.
 

有關我們，你好！
Sophia J. Chang （張詠慧 ）製作人也是導演，這個記錄片主要是探索她的家族歷史。請參閱她在網路的微電影、家庭食譜系列，MeNU。

Alan Chung 台美人攝影導演，有豐富的工作經驗，曾經和Netflix、沃爾瑪和豐田汽車公司合作錄製影片。

Melly Lee 是劇照攝影師，碧昂絲、谷歌、華納兄弟、樂高和優衣庫都曾是她的客戶。

 

WHY WE CHOSE THIS STORY

Sophia's grandma was the best cook she knew, so when her grandma developed dementia and eventually passed away, Sophia realized there was so much she didn't know about her own family. She regretted not being able to save her grandma's recipes and not learning more Mandarin and Taiwanese to better communicate with her own grandparents before they passed. This project serves as one of the ways to connect with and preserve a part of Sophia's ancestry she knows little about. Not to mention, the original hot sauce (and very first sauce created by Mercy Food) is the one Sophia's mom grew up eating and liking the most.

The entire team involved is also keenly interested in food - especially when it comes with a meaningful story. Some of Sophia's Tainan favorites include sabahee  (steamed milkfish), popiah (spring rolls), and ba zan (sticky rice). Alan expressed his love for Taiwanese night market food and how he too wanted to show good eats that truly represent Taiwanese cuisine and have a local perspective.


拍攝動機

我們年紀越長，更體會到連結和保存家族歷史的重要性，特別對第二代的台美人。Sophia 沒有機會和她已過世的祖父母探討。所以她想藉著這個企劃和她不熟悉的祖輩們做連結。一方面這個影片的主題，慈光食品的辣椒醬也是非常美味的。

我們的團隊對食物有很敏銳的觀察，特別是食物背後的故事。Sophia最喜愛的台南美食，包括虱目魚、潤餅和肉粽。Alan則對台灣的夜市十分喜愛，想要把真正代表台灣的菜肴和當地的特色介紹給更多人。

 

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

Our small crew is largely volunteering their time and talents to support the making of this film. This fundraising goal currently covers the very basic needs of transportation (a whole 60% of this budget!), food, lodging, and some equipment for one week of filming in Taiwan. 20% of this budget will go towards post-production. Any additional funds will go directly towards the crew as honorariums.

Some of the challenges are dealing with filming in a foreign country, translations (with the help of Sophia's mom (hi mom!) and Alan), and having financial support to make this documentary happen.

It's definitely ambitious, but we believe in the importance of sharing a story of family heritage, culture, and food. With our combined experiences in storytelling and filmmaking, we are ready to build a personal project of our own. We hope this story will encourage others to treasure their own history, loved ones, and every bite.
 
我們需要的贊助

我們幾個人的團隊大多是義務的貢獻出他們的時間和才能，來支持這個影片的製作。現在募款的目標，只是包括在台灣一個星期所需要的基本交通費（60%的預算）、食住和一些器材。

在外國拍攝影片有其挑戰性，有語言的溝通（有Sophia的母親和Alan的幫忙）和經濟上的支援可以讓影片順利完成。

雖然是雄心壯志，但是我們相信分享家族的歷史故事、文化和食物很有意義。共同運用我們説故事和製作影片的經驗，我們已準備好開始這個企劃。希望這個故事可以鼓勵其他人也珍惜他們自己的歷史、家人和每一口美食。

 
 
OTHER WAYS TO HELP
Share this Indiegogo campaign with friends and family and/or follow us @SweetChiliDoc on Instagram and Facebook. We appreciate each and every dollar, share, and like.
 
其他贊助方式​
和家人朋友分享這個衆籌平台（ Indiegogo campaign）, 也可在臉書和IG上追蹤我們@SweetChiliDoc。我們十分感謝每一個分享、按讚和經援。
 

THANK YOU for all your support!

謝謝你們所有的支持

story:
Short Summary:

Novel is an ethical clothing line by the co-founders of UNCHAINED. We raised $3,722 for our fall garments and launch costs and will continue to raise funds the next 60 days toward our goal of raising $20,000 this year.

Our Company:

Novel ensures dignity and transparency from our sourcing, to manufacturing, to our delivery whereby you can confidently wear a better story. 

With highest levels of transparency and quality, we ensure that all our fabric is slave-free using organic, sustainable materials that won't harm the environment. As a result of fast fashion, many major clothing companies utilize factories that exploit workers through debt bondage, forced labor,  involuntary child labor and with extremely dangerous working conditions to make the clothing we wear everyday. Novel believes in doing things differently. We are starting Novel in Ohio, creating dignified, transparent and sustainable jobs by manufacturing our garments here in the U.S. As we grow, we will empower survivors of human trafficking and those at risk of being trafficked through employment opportunities with Novel.  We need YOU to partner with Novel to change the course of history for people and the planet. YOU are the hero of this story. 

The Novel Campaign: 

With your partnership, the funds raised from this Indiegogo campaign will bring the first Novel collection to market. Novel needs YOU to help us make this a reality. 

We are raising $20,000 for the following:

  •  Fabric - Purchasing ethical  fabric to manufacture our garments 
  • Manufacturing - The manufacturing of our sample garments  
  • Bringing Novel To Market - Photography & Website
                                                   

 Our First Global Partners:

Novel is working with a silk supplier in Siem Reap, Cambodia that only works with sustainable, natural dying methods and gives sustainable jobs to women in need.  All of our Fall 2016 Collection will have elements of silk hand-crafted by these incredible artisans. 

                         Fall 2016 Collection

                                     

(From Left to Right) Elodie Dress, The Caroline, Tatiana Pant, Zaria Top

                                                'Illustrations by Mimi Honeycutt'

                                                      'Edited/inked by Jake Kiley'

(From Left to Right) The Summer Pant, Isadora Kimono Robe, The Mimi Dress, The Pearl Coat, The Madeline Top 

The Impact:

By contributing to Novel, you are partnering to create a sustainable, high-end fashion line  that will allow people to wear a better story.  You are also helping us:

  • Create sustainable manufacturing jobs in the U.S. , with the eventual goal of sustainable dignified jobs across the globe. 
  • Help train individuals at risk of exploitation including survivors, homeless and refugees
  • Help lift individuals out of poverty
  • Raise awareness about the injustice of fast fashion and labor trafficking

Risks & Challenges

On the journey of starting Novel, we have experienced many risks and challenges.  We have done in-depth research on all our fabric materials from farm to factory, the limited amount of ethical choices has taken great work and certainly has not been an easy process. 

 However, we are committed to partnering with organizations choosing ethical practices, ethical materials of utmost quality from around the world, supporting co-ops, fighting for the rights of farmers, and creating sustainable jobs in the process. 

Our History: Given our background, we are sure that Novel will succeed.  We have past experience in launching product to fight human trafficking that has proven successful.  UNCHAINED introduced a bracelet in THE LIMITED stores nationwide in 2015 that raised  $32,500 for the UNCHAINED Survivor Scholarship Fund that was awarded to 2 survivors of human trafficking in January of 2016.  

Definitions:

Ethically Sourced: Ethically sourced means fair and safe labor practices, including outlawing child labor. It also ensures that workers are paid a fair price for their labor. 

Certified Organic:The World Health Organization (WHO) estimates that approximately 22,000 people die each year in developing countries as a result of the chemicals sprayed on non-organic cotton.  All of our materials are GOTS (Global Organic Textile Standard) certified organic.  Certified Organic means that both the production of the fibre on the farm, and the processing of this fibre into textiles has been checked at every step of the processing supply chain, has met organic standards and is certified by one of the many governing bodies. Organic textiles  fibres are free from herbicides, pesticides or anything genetically modified.  

Natural Dyes:Our raw materials for the dyes are taken from nature rather than constructed from dangerous chemicals.  We value the health of our clients by utilizing organic textiles and natural dyes since chemicals used in dyes are absorbed into the skin and can be harmful, specifically to those that suffer from asthma and allergies.

Other Ways You Can Help:

- Please like and share our Novel Facebook page! 

- Promote us on social media and contact anyone you think would be interested in contributing financially to our campaign.

- Make some noise about Novel! 

- Please share this campaign with your friends and anyone that would be interested in wearing a better story!

story:
Ballet Pointe Shoes is a short period fantasy and an original short fairy tale story written by Gisela Pereira, inspired on the 18th and 19th century in England and the red shoes tale. Shot on the Arri Alexa, Ballet Pointe Shoes brings the best ballet art dance to the camera in the form of a narrative fairy-tale storytelling film.

The project is at its final stage and requires funds for finishing up. These funds are needed to pay outstanding production expenses, post production costs, and festival submission fees. 

At this stage there are no risks associated to the funds raised since the project is finishing up - it only needs additional funds to settle all expenses.

I hope you can help :)


The rehearsals...


Here is a taste of the visual effects being done on the magic shoes...



Check out the complete team of Ballet pointe Shoes on IMDb:  Crew and Cast


Vision = storyboard = screen 

Storyboard

Hardworking team

story:
The Film

We want to make this film as EPIC as possible, and we need your help to do that!

  • We want to go all out on Art Department. From swords and shields, to capes and armor.
  • Good food equals a happy set equals a better film overall! Plus it might take too much time to try and hunt and scavenge ourselves when we're out in the wilderness. 
  • We want to shoot in some fantastical locations to match our story. As fun as it would be to shoot guerrilla style at Medieval Times, it might be easier if we get a space to ourselves.  

The Impact

I've always loved Fantasy, and that lead me into the world of geekdom. I find that girls in the nerd community are often treated like outsiders, and are suspected of 'faking' it all. This is incredibly frustrating, and I wanted to tell a story about it. 

Feminism has an incredibly important place in media today, and what is being a nerd if not being a consumer of media? There needs to be more representation and positive stories about women in geeky things, because that will encourage more women to be unafraid to share their nerdy side, and maybe try things they never thought they were allowed to before. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cant contribute to the project that's okay, please share this page so we can get as many people interested as possible. Spread the word!

story:
The Story:

Snow Fish is a short film exploring themes of manipulation, mind-control and claustrophobia in a codependent relationship.  Laura struggles to care for her partner Joan, who is still grieving the death of an ex lover. While Laura finds herself at her wits' end trying to heal Joan and move forward, Joan withdraws further into her own painful memories.

the Cause:

This is an all-women cast and crew production. One of our main objectives is to inspire young women to pursue a career in film, despite the obstacle of gender inequality in the industry. We are fostering an environment where our crew members, primarily college students and recent graduates with a passion for filmmaking, are able to  obtain the technical skills needed on set. Another objective is to get these filmmakers to connect with one another as they enter the workforce. This project is not only important for film practice and education, but also a wonderful opportunity to build a community of female filmmakers. 

The Cast:

Mertxu Curutchet studied with Uta Hagen and Carol Goodheart. Her ethnically ambiguous features and timeless air make her seamlessly slip into characters of different times and origins. She acted on stage productions shown at Columbia University, Newyorican Poets Cafe and The Riant Theatre. She took on a wide range of leading and supporting roles in various independent films, to be screened at local and international film festivals. She appeared in an art installation for the artist C. Jimenez Cahua “Mother Tongue, Language Product".She was born in Buenos Aires and resides in New York City for most of her life.

Nana Ponceleon was born in Venezuela, but spent her early years in Baton Rouge, LA. She has lived between Venezuela and the USA ever since. Today, she is based in NYC. She recently graduated from Stella Adler Studio of Acting. Even though her interest in art began in her childhood, it was only recently that acting became her full time career. She has worked in many films in Venezuela including the award winning international film "The Zero Hour" (La Hora Cero) recently featured in HBO, as well as plays and films in NYC.

the Crew: 

Snow Fish was shot on location in Brooklyn, NY by a crew of talented and creative young women.
 
Writer/Director: Zoë Mancuso grew up in a theatre family where she developed an aptitude for storytelling, and this became the foundation for her directing style. Her work is described as "passionate realism, with a focus on the modern female experience." Mancuso recently graduated from Sarah Lawrence College, where she studied screenwriting and directing. She currently lives in LA.
 
Director of Photography: Sarah Maloney is a graduate of Sarah Lawrence college where she studied film history and visual theory. Maloney began as an experimental filmmaker and brings an element of play and wonder with her even to the most narrative of projects. Over the past 2 years she has been working as a freelance filmmaker in NYC and Brooklyn. She recently moved to LA.
 
Producers: Zoë Mancuso, Sarah Maloney, and Sophia de Baun
Production Designer: Sophia de Baun
Assistant Director: Ottavia Brey
Assistant Camera: Ami Glazer
Gaffer: Lynn Chlumecky
Sound: Annie Murighan and Hannah Rifkin
Script Supervisor: Rae Ellis
Assistant to the Director: Keira Castellitto 
 
A big thank you to this amazing group!
 

the Cost:

This campaign will be our final push to fully funding our film. 

We have been able to narrow the budget to $3,000.  If we achieve our goal, we will be using the funds to pay for some of the most important components. Without these funds, we won't be able to make our film become what we want it to be.

  • Post Production: This includes professional color grading, sound editing, as well as music rights to bring our story to life. The overall aesthetic of the film is cold and delicate, simultaneously moody and darkly vibrant. 
  • Entry Fees: We hope to enter Snow Fish in as many film festivals as we can in 2017, both domestic and international! These include, but are not limited to: Sundance Film Festival, Tribeca Film Festival, Austin Film Festival, Outfest, Provincetown International Film Festival, Manhattan Film Festival, Chicago Underground Film Festival, Sonoma International Film Festival, LA Indie Film Festival, Budapest Pride LGBTQ Festival, Palm Springs Film Festival, Frameline San Francisco International LGBT Festival, CINISLAM: Vermont LGBT Short Film Festival, and Outrageous Santa Barbara LGBTQ Film Festival.
  • Replenishing our funds: In the making of Snow Fish, we paid out of pocket to cover costs for pre-production, equipment, locations, props/wardrobe, transportation, and craft services. We hope to be able to replenish these costs!
  • We offer many incentives and will provide you with sweet goodies for your kindness. 

 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't help fund the film, it would mean the world to us if you could share the campaign with family, colleagues, and friends. 

    Exposure is incredibly important to us and we rely on it! 

    If you have a minute to share this on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tumblr, or any other social media platform, please do! You can share using Indiegogos share tools!

story:
Short Summary:

Milk & Cookies is a NYU Tisch Student Production about Rex Igor Ger, a middled age burnout with an unshakeable obsession with food. After buying a large batch of CookieGirl Scout cookies that he cannot afford, Igor gets in a tiff with two vengeful CookieGirl scouts. Get ready for some comedy, action, and fun!

The Dream Team:

Director: Victoria (Vicky) Lim

Assistant Director: Emily Zhao 

Producer: Maria Hill

Producer: Will Monahan

Fundraising : Summer Sagansky

Cinematographer: Cody Powers

Production Designer: Prisca Choe

Gaffer: Andre Bonk


THE TALENT:
Matthew De Titta as REX

Susan Karpman as GRANDMA

Stephanie Marantz & Reina Guthrie as BUTTERCUP SCOUTS

What We Need 

Making a movie is crazy expensive! Not only do we have to pay to make the production itself, we also have to take care of the hard-working crew on set.

Here is how our funding will be used:

Production Design ($1,650)- wardrobe, set design, props (including prop weapons), SFX make-up, etc.

Crew & Cast: Board, Transportation, and Food ($1,950)- This will be a three day overnight shoot. We need to provide food, transportation, and board for a hardworking twenty person crew and cast.

Location ($850): We are renting a stylized house in beautiful Ocean Grove, NJ   

Stunt Coordinator ($300): This movie has stunts! Woo! We are using a professional stunt coordinator in order to make the fight scenes look realistic.

Permits ($300): Because we have special scenes we must pay for special city permits

**** check out our perks to get more bang for your buck!

Here is the famous "Tisch Kids Are Cool" Poster/Sticker made by Mama Lim

^^^ Proof that your friends, family, coworkers, and enemies will love it!

story:
Short Summary

In a sleepy Texas town, the Wylie brothers struggle to cope with life after the sudden death of their parents in a tragic accident.


Join the ABB filmmaking team as we embark on a quest to create the next great independent success. Similar to the smash hit indy classic Garden State, starring Zach Braff, this story captures the endearing personality of small towns across the country. The love, fellowship and even humor portrayed by neighbors during times of tragedy and loss. By becoming a part of the project, you will get a first hand experience of making a movie. It's our goal to involve you in each step of the process! You'll have access to concept art, page excerpts from the script, location photos and a chance to visit the set and meet the cast. In addition, you'll even get to weigh in on important decisions like casting in interactive Facebook postings! 

THE STORY

It’s 40 days later...and LUKE WYLIE hasn’t uttered a word since the night of his parent’s death. His older brother Brady resolves to work away his pain, which bodes
poorly on his relationship with ADDIE JACOBS, whose parents live on the land the
brothers inherited.
Eventually Brady reaches out, befriending a charismatic church counselor SAMANTHA WRIGHT, who earns the trust of younger brother Luke. Brady’s boss and wealthy land owner, ADRIAN BISHOP tries to convince Brady to sell him the land, while Addie’s father, JAMES pleads with Brady to finalize the sale of the inherited Sampson Dairy over to the Jacob’s family.
As matters of family dissolve, and Luke’s silence reaches its peak, the distraught Brady boils over, forging decisions that will rock the entire small town landscape. As all seems lost, it’s Luke, alone and searching, who seeks out the ultimate help from above in an attempt to heal personal wounds and mend the broken bond between he and Brady, before its too late. 


The ABB team is both passionate and experienced in the motion picture industry - there is not a team more suited for the task of delivering to you "A Broken Bridge". 

JOSH MILLS // TJ AMATO PRODUCER, DIRECTOR

Josh Mills and TJ Amato are an award winning Producer/Director team with over 16 years of production and finance experience in both film and television. Both honed their skills in the studio realm working on big budget features such 300, 3:10 to YUMA, as well as hit shows such as ABC’s IN JUSTICE, Comedy Central’s THREE STRIKES and the CBS Crime Drama THE UNIT. Recently they produced and directed several commercials and feature films including the feature documentary SUGAR WARS and the feature film BROTHER’S KEEPER released in theaters last Summer. 

JONATHAN MURPHY // WRITER, ACTOR,PRODUCER

Jonathan Michael Murphy was born and raised in Arlington, Texas in the heart of the Dallas/Ft. Worth Metroplex. It wasn't until high school that he began performing in shows. He began acting in his high school drama department then went on to performing at community theatres after graduation. He performed in Ft. Worth's Famous Casa Manana Theatre among various other theatres in the greater Dallas/ Ft. Worth area. At the age of 20, he participated in the Model and Talent Search of Texas, where he met, former manager, Craig Wargo. Jonathan attended Texas Christian University and was a member of the Phi Delta Theta fraternity before moving to Los Angeles. Since then, he's appeared on several successful independent features and network Television shows, including Without A Trace, Judging Amy, Crossing Jordan, Wildfire, October Road, Cold Case, Life on Mars, House MD and NCIS. 

Murphy's IMDb Screen Credits.


JEFF MURPHY // EDITOR

Jeff Murphy is an award-winning editor who is well versed in all aspects of the post production world. From on-set editing and supervision to visual effects and the final cut, Jeff Murphy has the talent and resources that a successful production requires. Jeff Murphy was recently awarded 2 Bronze Telly Awards for producing and editing the series NO IGNORING. Along with feature length films and documentaries, Jeff’s filmography includes trailers, music videos, military training series and corporate marketing productions, including a commercial for the Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 game. Jeff’s contribution on the U.S. ARMY 360 CULTURAL AWARENESS project won a Bronze Telly Award, two Gold Davey Awards and a prestigious Stevie Award at the 2009 American Business Awards. Additional recent projects include 2 Bronze Telly Awards for the Desert Wind faith feature BROTHER’S KEEPER starring Michael Rooker, W. Earl Brown, NOT ANOTHER NOT ANOTHER MOVIE starring Chevy Chase, Burt Reynolds and Vinnie Jones, ACTS OF VIOLENCE starring Leelee Sobieski and Ron Perlman and IN/SIGHT starring Sean Patrick Flannery, Natalie Zea and Christopher Lloyd.


SCOTT PECK // DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY

Scott Peck, an award winning member of the Directors Guild of America and the Cinematographers Guild, has worked in short and long format film and television projects for over a decade. Peck has proven his strength as a leading cinematographer, a producer and a creative storyteller. From feature films and network television to commercials, Scott has the experience and depth few young filmmakers can match. His most recent narrative credits include the psychological thriller Insight, the studio comedy, A VERY HAROLD AND KUMAR 3D CHRISTMAS and the Desert Wind Film’s period crime drama BROTHER’S KEEPER. Past credits also include Director of Photography for the Warner Brother’s series MOONLIGHT and the Jerry Bruckheimer’s CLOSE TO HOME. Scott has also helmed commercial campaigns for the retail giant Nordstrom’s as well as the blue chip security firm, Northrop Grumman. Peck is currently working on the hit AMC period dramatic series TURN starring Jamie Bell, Angus MacFadyen and Heather Lind. 




Where does the Indiegogo money fit in? Good question. We've budgeted our film to the last penny and with your help, we'll have every dollar we need. All of our campaign money will go directly towards locking in the TALENT we need for our amazing characters! 

Have any questions? We'd be happy to answer them!


We know. You've backed a crowd-funded project before and that was the last you ever heard of it. So how do you know backing this project will actually lead to a finished film? Well for one, this isn't our first rodeo. The filmmaking team has worked on over 35 films combined and knows how to get a film to the finish line. We have the infrastructure to produce the content, development funds in place and currently we are in full swing on the production raise! 

The creative team behind A Broken Bridge has been hard at work making this film a reality and as we get closer to production, we look forward to adding more members to the "A Broken Bridge" family. The calendar below gives you an sample of what the schedule of the filming, completion and delivery will look like. 



We wanted to thank you for stopping at our campaign page. Whether you choose to contribute to A Broken Bridge or not, we'd love for you to join us on the journey of making this feature film. Stay up to date on our Facebook page for production updates in the coming weeks. And be sure to share with your friends!

...And that's all there is to it!
story_txt:
Short Summary In a sleepy Texas town, the Wylie brothers struggle to cope with life after the sudden death of their parents in a tragic accident.   


Join the ABB filmmaking team as we embark on a quest to create the next great independent success. Similar to the smash hit indy classic Garden State, starring Zach Braff, this story captures the endearing personality of small towns across the country. The love, fellowship and even humor portrayed by neighbors during times of tragedy and loss. By becoming a part of the project, you will get a first hand experience of making a movie. It's our goal to involve you in each step of the process! You'll have access to concept art, page excerpts from the script, location photos and a chance to visit the set and meet the cast. In addition, you'll even get to weigh in on important decisions like casting in interactive Facebook postings! THE STORYIt’s 40 days later...and LUKE WYLIE hasn’t uttered a word since the night of his parent’s death. His older brother Brady resolves to work away his pain, which bodespoorly on his relationship with ADDIE JACOBS, whose parents live on the land thebrothers inherited.Eventually Brady reaches out, befriending a charismatic church counselor SAMANTHA WRIGHT, who earns the trust of younger brother Luke. Brady’s boss and wealthy land owner, ADRIAN BISHOP tries to convince Brady to sell him the land, while Addie’s father, JAMES pleads with Brady to finalize the sale of the inherited Sampson Dairy over to the Jacob’s family.As matters of family dissolve, and Luke’s silence reaches its peak, the distraught Brady boils over, forging decisions that will rock the entire small town landscape. As all seems lost, it’s Luke, alone and searching, who seeks out the ultimate help from above in an attempt to heal personal wounds and mend the broken bond between he and Brady, before its too late. The ABB team is both passionate and experienced in the motion picture industry - there is not a team more suited for the task of delivering to you "A Broken Bridge". JOSH MILLS // TJ AMATO PRODUCER, DIRECTORJosh Mills and TJ Amato are an award winning Producer/Director team with over 16 years of production and finance experience in both film and television. Both honed their skills in the studio realm working on big budget features such 300, 3:10 to YUMA, as well as hit shows such as ABC’s IN JUSTICE, Comedy Central’s THREE STRIKES and the CBS Crime Drama THE UNIT. Recently they produced and directed several commercials and feature films including the feature documentary SUGAR WARS and the feature film BROTHER’S KEEPER released in theaters last Summer. JONATHAN MURPHY // WRITER, ACTOR,PRODUCERJonathan Michael Murphy was born and raised in Arlington, Texas in the heart of the Dallas/Ft. Worth Metroplex. It wasn't until high school that he began performing in shows. He began acting in his high school drama department then went on to performing at community theatres after graduation. He performed in Ft. Worth's Famous Casa Manana Theatre among various other theatres in the greater Dallas/ Ft. Worth area. At the age of 20, he participated in the Model and Talent Search of Texas, where he met, former manager, Craig Wargo. Jonathan attended Texas Christian University and was a member of the Phi Delta Theta fraternity before moving to Los Angeles. Since then, he's appeared on several successful independent features and network Television shows, including Without A Trace, Judging Amy, Crossing Jordan, Wildfire, October Road, Cold Case, Life on Mars, House MD and NCIS. Murphy's IMDb Screen Credits.JEFF MURPHY // EDITORJeff Murphy is an award-winning editor who is well versed in all aspects of the post production world. From on-set editing and supervision to visual effects and the final cut, Jeff Murphy has the talent and resources that a successful production requires. Jeff Murphy was recently awarded 2 Bronze Telly Awards for producing and editing the series NO IGNORING. Along with feature length films and documentaries, Jeff’s filmography includes trailers, music videos, military training series and corporate marketing productions, including a commercial for the Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 game. Jeff’s contribution on the U.S. ARMY 360 CULTURAL AWARENESS project won a Bronze Telly Award, two Gold Davey Awards and a prestigious Stevie Award at the 2009 American Business Awards. Earl Brown, NOT ANOTHER NOT ANOTHER MOVIE starring Chevy Chase, Burt Reynolds and Vinnie Jones, ACTS OF VIOLENCE starring Leelee Sobieski and Ron Perlman and IN/SIGHT starring Sean Patrick Flannery, Natalie Zea and Christopher Lloyd.SCOTT PECK // DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHYScott Peck, an award winning member of the Directors Guild of America and the Cinematographers Guild, has worked in short and long format film and television projects for over a decade.
