Ελληνικά


ΠΕΡΠΑΤΏΝΤΑΣ ΤΗΝ ΚΎΠΡΟ — Ένα ταξίδι 60 ημερών για την κατανόηση του πολιτιστικού
διαχωρισμού σε ένα νησί της Μεσογείου




Πως ξεκίνησε
Στις 20 Ιουλίου 1974 τα τουρκικά
στρατεύματα εισέβαλαν στο νησί της Μεσογείου, ,απαντώντας σε πραξικόπημα  που οργανώθηκε από Ελληνοκύπριους εθνικιστές.
Μέχρι τον Αύγουστο του ίδιου έτους, ο τουρκικός στρατός είχε καταλάβει το 40%
του νησιού. Μέχρι αυτήν την ημέρα, το νησί παραμένει γεωγραφικά, πολιτικά και
εθνικα διαχωρισμένο  από μια ουδέτερη ζώνη
όπου  φρουρείται απο τα Ηνωμένα Έθνη  και εκτείνεται σε περισσότερα από 112 μίλια.

Το Ταξιδι μας 
Το Μάιος 2016, τρεις άνθρωποι θα περπατήσουν 400 μίλια σε
60 ημέρες και θα κανουν  το γυρο της
νήσου  Κύπροου με  στοχο να να συγκεντρώσουν ιαφηγήσεις, βίντεο
και φωτογραφίες σχετικά με το διαχωρισμό που ειναι σε ισχύ για πάνω από σαράντα
χρόνια. Με την χρήση  πολλαπλών μορφών μέσων
ενημέρωσης, το ταξίδι μας  oπου
χρηματοδοτείται εν μέρει από το NationalGeographicYoungExplorersGrant θα παράγει μια πολύπλευρη
εκπροσώπηση της κυπριακής ταυτότητας που θα παρέχει μια βαθύτερη κατανόηση των
πολιτιστικών και πολιτικών  δυναμικών αυτής
της διαιρεμένης νήσου.
Κατά τη διάρκεια του ταξιδιού μας, θα σταματήσουμε και θα
συνομιλήσουμε με τους τοπικούς νέους σε κάθε πλευρά του οδοφράγματος. Κάθε
άτομο θα του δοθεί μια ψηφιακή φωτογραφική μηχανή για μία έως δύο ημέρες και θα
του ζητηθεί η λήψη φωτογραφιών ή σύντομα βίντεο που εξηγούν τη ζωή τους ως
Κύπριος. Με την ενθάρρυνση των συμμετεχόντων να τραβήξουν τις  φωτογραφίες και τα βίντεο οι ίδιοι, θα δώσουμε
προτεραιότητα στις δικές τους φωνές και τις προοπτικές, παρά μιλώντας για
λογαριασμό τους.


Ο ΣΤΟΧΟΣ ΜΑΣ 
Σε πλήρη αντίθεση με την πολιτική
πραγματικότητα του διαχωρισμού, ο στόχος αυτής της εκστρατείας είναι να
δημιουργήσει μια ολιστική εικόνα των τοπίων, των πολιτισμών και των λαών της
χώρας . Πέρα από τα πιθανά οφέλη για το παρών και το μέλλον των Κυπρίων, το
ταξίδι μας θα δημιουργήσει μια βαθύτερη κατανόηση αυτού του διαχωρισμού , και θα
συμβάλει στην διαλόγους σχετικά με τις εθνικές και θρησκευτικές διαιρέσεις σε γενικά
πλαίσια .
Όλα τα δεδομένα που συλλέγονται θα  φορτώνονται σε ένα διαδραστικό διαδικτυακό
χάρτη, καθώς  η εκστρατεία προχωρά (η επίσημη
ιστοσελίδα έρχεται σύντομα!). Οι επισκέπτες στην ιστοσελίδα μας, θα βιώσουν
την  Κύπρο, όπως την βιώνουμε εμείς  με εικόνες και πλάνα που συνδέονται με
συγκεκριμένα σημεία στο τοπίο, ως μέρος του αυτό το διαδραστικό χάρτη. Μπορείτε
επίσης να  επικοινωνείτε μαζί μας κατά τη
διάρκεια του οδοιπορικού μας αφήνοντας ένα σχόλιο σχετικά με τις αποστολές μας.

Πως μπορείτε να βοηθήσετε. 
Χρειαζόμαστε
τη βοήθειά σου! Εισφορές από το National Geographic Young Explorers μας  έχουν βοηθήσει  να ξεκινήσει το έργο, αλλά χρειαζόμαστε τη
βοήθειά σας για την ολοκλήρωση του .Ελπίζουμε υπάρχουν αρκετά τολμηροί όπου
σκέπτονται σαν εμάς , εκεί έξω που πιστεύουν στην αποστολή μας και είναι
πρόθυμοι να μας  υποστηρίξουν και να
λάβουν μέρος στο έργο μας! Αν θέλετε να συνεισφέρεται  –ανεξαρτήτου του ποσού -θα εκτιμηθεί  πολύ! Τα χρήματα που θα μαζευτούν  θα χρησιμοποιηθεί  υλικά  πρώτης ανάγκης όπως  τρόφιμα, νερό, και των εργαλείων που θα
χρησιμοποιηθούν !
Δεν μπορείτε να συνεισφέρεται οικονομικά ?Είναι εντάξει! Βοηθήστε μας να μαθευτεί το
έργο μας ! Βοηθήστε με την αναδημοσίευση  αυτής  της
σελίδας  σε ιστοσελίδες κοινωνικών μέσων
μαζικής ενημέρωσης, και την ενθάρρυνση της οικογένειας και των φίλων για να
υποστηρίξουν την αποστολή μας.
 Είσαι
από Κύπρο και θες να βοηθήσεις στην αποστολή μας ? Χρειαζόμαστε τη βοήθειά σας πάρα πολύ!
Χρειαζόμαστε  συμμετέχοντες, ιδανικά
18-35 ετών, πρόθυμους να μας καθοδηγήσουν μέσα από τόπους καταγωγής  τους,  να ανοίξουν  τα σπίτια τους, και να μοιραστούν τις ιστορίες
τους! Επικοινωνήστε μαζί μας για περισσότερες πληροφορίες! 

Η ομάδα 
Πρόκειται για μια οικογενειακή υπόθεση! Δύο
αδέλφια, ένας ξάδελφος, και ένας αδελφικός φίλος  πρόκειται να περάσουν  1440 συνεχόμενες ώρες μαζί και  προσπαθήσουν να επιβιώσουν!

Άννα – Ομαδάρχης , νέα εξερευνήτρια του NationalGeographic, & αδελφή 
Πίσω από κάθε μεγάλη ομάδα ανδρών, είναι
μια ακόμα καλύτερη γυναίκα! Η Άννα είναι ο εγκέφαλος πίσω από αυτή την εκστρατεία,
και η ομαδάρχης . Ως αρχαιολόγος, είναι ειδικός στη διαχείριση μικρών  ομάδων σε υπαίθριες  περιοχές  και εξωτερικούς χώρους, καθώς και στο
συντονισμό καθηκόντων σε  απομακρυσμένες
περιοχές.


Χαράλαμπος - Τοπικός Οδηγός, γνώστης της
κουλτούρας , και εξάδελφος
Ο Χαράλαμπος τα
ξέρει όλα! Διαθέτει μεγάλη εμπειρία σε υπαίθριες δραστηριότητες και γνώστης της
κουλτούρας , δεν υπάρχει κάτι που δεν μπορεί να χειριστεί.


Βασίλης  - Συντονιστής , Επιχειρηματικές εργασίες , και
 αδελφικός φίλος 
Με
εργασιακό παρελθόν στο κλάδο  της
υπαίθριας περιπέτειας ο Βασίλης πάντα  περιμένει
την επόμενη ευκαιρία για μια νέα περιπέτεια. Ο Βασίλης  είναι ένας καταξιωμένος ναυτικός, φανταστική
χορευτής, αξίζει να σημειωθεί ότι έχει καταφέρει να πιάσει ψάρι μόνο με τα
χέρια του. 

Alexi – Εμπειρογνώμονας Κυπριακής πολιτικής, σύγχρονος  MacGyver, & Αδελφός
Ο Αλέξης  ενεργεί ως ο κ Miyagi σε αυτή την ομάδα από εξερευνητές. Σπασίκλας με μεγάλη γνώση στην πολιτική
διακυβέρνηση  όπου του αρέσουν οι νέες
περιπέτειες.O Αλέξης  θα προσφέρει τις συμβουλές του προς τα μέλη
της ομάδας από την Καλιφόρνια.


Many Thanks to Our Supporters! 

National Geographic Society
H Άννα έλαβε επιχορήγηση μέσο του Young Explorers Grant που παρέχεται από το Εθνικό Συμβούλιο του  National Geographic Expeditions. Η επιχορήγηση αυτή κατέστησε δυνατή αυτή
η εκστρατεία, αλλά απαιτούνται περαιτέρω οικονομικοί πόροι για την διεκπεραίωση
αυτής της αποστολής.

Πακέτα εισφοράς  

$10.00USD
Donor wall
 Ένα ταξίδι 400 μιλίων ξεκινά με ένα βήμα . Ένα
μεγάλο ευχαριστώ από όλη την ομάδα.Το όνομα σας θα προστεθεί στο τοίχο με τα
ονόματα δωρητών στην επίσημη ιστοσελίδα της αποστολής μας .
Υπολογιζόμενη ημερομηνία παραλαβής : Μάιος 2016 

$25.00USD
Shout-Out
Λάβετε ένα social media
shout-out και ευχαριστίες από την ομάδα, κατά την διάρκεια της αποστολής τους.
Υπολογιζόμενη ημερομηνία παραλαβής : Μάιος 2016 

$50.00USD
Snailmail
Αλληλογραφία όπως τον
παλιό καλό καιρό  λάβετε σαν δώρο μια
καρτ ποστάλ από την ομάδα κατά την διάρκεια της αποστολής τους. 
Υπολογιζόμενη ημερομηνία παραλαβής : Ιούνιος 2016 

$75.00USD
Shake it Like a Polaroid Picture
Λάβετε μια
φωτογραφία Polaroid από την ομάδα κατά την διάρκεια του ταξιδιού όπου θα
αναγράφονται οι συντεταγμένες της τοποθεσίας όπου τραβήχτηκε.
Υπολογιζόμενη ημερομηνία παραλαβής : Ιούλιος  2016 

$100.00USD 
12-Month Calendar
θα σας
αποσταλεί 12 μηνιαίο ημερολόγιο με τις καλύτερες φωτογραφίες από το ταξίδι μας.
Υπολογιζόμενη ημερομηνία παραλαβής : Ιούλιος  2016 

$300.00USD
Day Sailing Adventure
Απολαύστε  ένα 4ωρο ταξίδι- ημερήσια κρουαζιέρα με το
ιστιοπλοϊκό Catalina 22  για εσάς και 2 φίλους σας στο Long Beach της
Καλιφόρνιας  με καπετάνιο  τον Βασίλη , τα έξοδα ταξιδιού δεν
συμπεριλαμβάνονται . 
Υπολογιζόμενη ημερομηνία παραλαβής : Σεπτέμβριος  2016 
Αριθμός πακέτων : 2

$400.00USD 
Evening Boat Cruise
4ωρη δειλινή
κρουαζιέρα με στάσεις σε μπαράκια για εσάς και δυο φίλους σας με το ιστιοπλοϊκό
 Catalina 22 στην περιοχή Alamitos Bay Long Beach,CA .Ο πρώτος γύρος από
ποτά σε κάθε στάση  είναι κερασμένα .Τα έξοδα ταξιδιού δεν
συμπεριλαμβάνονται .
Υπολογιζόμενη ημερομηνία παραλαβής : Σεπτέμβριος  2016 
Αριθμός πακέτων : 2

$1,000.00USD 
Join the Crew
Αυτό το πακέτο εισφοράς σας δίνει την δυνατότητα να
περπατήσετε μαζί μας για πέντε μέρες κατά την διάρκεια της Αποστόλης .Δεν
συμπεριλαμβάνονται τα έξοδα του ταξιδιού. 
Υπολογιζόμενη ημερομηνία παραλαβής :Ιούνιος  2016 
Αριθμός πακέτων : 3

story:
Tommy Hall, the guru of '60s psychedelic rock, is a fascinating figure in musical history. Tommy Hall and his 13th Floor Elevators were the first psychedelic band in history and helped bring in this psychedelic era. Tommy is considered by many to be the best lyricists of his time. Slip Inside This House is a documentary about the life of Tommy Hall of The 13th Floor Elevators: his childhood, his days as a student at the University of Texas in the 60s, his studies in the philosophies in consciousness and cosmic human experience, the inspiration behind his art, the forming of The 13th Floor Elevators, and aspects of The Design (his current work). Tommy is a reclusive figure that has not allowed anyone to interview him in-dept on film. The project started in April 2015 when Tommy Hall gave George Ripley both his cooperation and blessing to the project. It is not likely ever to occur again. Note: A explanation of the lyrics to "Slip Inside this House" was filmed as part of the documentary. Many have wanted to know the meaning of this opus for ages without luck in getting them. In this documentary, audience will get a 40 minute explanation by Tommy where he reads out each verse and explains the meaning. It will tell his life through vintage and contemporary photographs and numerous interviews with Tommy, members of The 13th Floor Elevators, and their soundman, contemporaries and audience members from the sixties as well as Tommy's former-wife, his stepson, his brother, and his sister.

Currently the project has obtained numerous photographs from various time periods of Tommy Hall's life. It has also obtained a scan of the Texas Governor's proclamation in recognition of the The 13th Floor Elevators directly from the Governor's office. Also of note, Tommy Hall has re-recorded three of his old songs to be used in the soundtrack, and as well, he is contributing several new musical compositions for the soundtrack.

The project has interviewed many people closest to Tommy Hall including:

  • Tommy Hall: many hours of interviews so far
  • Clementine Hall: Tommy Hall's former wife
  • Roland Hall: Tommy Hall's stepson
  • Carolyn Hall Lawrence: Tommy Hall's sister
  • Peter Hall: Tommy Hall's brother
  • Ronnie Leatherman: 13th Floor Elevators bass guitarist
  • Danny Thomas: 13th Floor Elevators drummer
  • Bill Bentley: friend and supporter
  • Billy Gibbons of ZZ Top: friend and supporter
  • Dana Erickson: Wife of Roky Erickson-13th Floor Elevators guitarist/vocalist
  • Powell St. John: Songwriter (for The 13th Floor Elevators) and performer
  • George Kinney of The Golden Dawn: close friend and supporter
  • Christian Bland of The Black Angels: supporter and follower
  • Freddie Krc: fan, supporter, and head of the Texas Music Union
  • Jack Orbin: Stone City Attractions, Inc  General Owner

Many other interviews with others close to Tommy are forthcoming. We are attempting to get rights to use Stacy Sutherland (the 13th Floor Elevator’s lead guitarist) and Sandy Lockett (The 13th Floor Elevator’s soundman) interviews with their estates. Gay Jones, Tommy Hall’s significant other of 48 years, is pending.

The 13th Floor Elevators' contemporary influence has been acknowledged by 1960s musicians such as Billy Gibbons of ZZ Top, Peter Albin of Big Brother and The Holding Company, Chris Gerniottis of Zakary Thaks and Jack Casady of Jefferson Airplane.

Today, The 13th Floor Elevators continue to influence new generations of musicians.



Risks & Challenges

Our challenge is reaching our goal and hopefully doubling or tripling the amount we seek. As it is the amount we seek only covers editing, postage on the perks, and fees. Any additional monies should go towards covering the cost of the perks as well as additional footage that we might buy to enhance the movie that much more.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
As a grassroots campaign with no big business backers we need money to promote a positive vision for Europe and a progressive case for ‘in’ in the EU referendum.

Your support will help us to establish an office, employ a national organiser, and expand our network of volunteers and grassroots campaigning profile.

We are delighted to be teaming up with Philosophy Football with some great offers if you’re able to donate to our campaign. Donate £35 and receive an Another Europe Is Possible t-shirt – worth £12.99 – and donate £60 and choose another t-shirt from the Philosophy Football range (most retail at £22.99). 

What will my money fund?

Your support will help us to fund the employment of a ‘campaign and ideas organiser’ and establish a national office.

Should I donate if you are not close to your target?

Yes! Every penny raised will support the development of our campaign – from campaign resources for local groups to national and regional events.

Should I donate if you’ve exceeded your target?

Yes! If we exceed our target then it’s very likely we will be able to employ a support worker for local and regional campaigners. 

Why should I back Another Europe Is Possible over other EU referendum campaigns?

With your support we won’t let the EU referendum become an argument between big business and little Englander nationalism. Help us promote an internationalist vision for social justice, environmental protection, democracy and human rights.

Another Europe Is Possible is the only ‘In’ campaign saying, ‘Stay in Europe, to change Europe’.

What could I receive if I support the campaign?

  • Donate over £10 and receive a thank you from the Another Europe Is Possible Twitter (we can include a link to your twitter handle if you have one).
  • Donate over £35 and receive a Philosophy Football Another Europe Is Possible t-shirt (retail price £12.99).  
  • Donate over £60 and choose a second t-shirt from the Philosophy Football range (most retail at £22.99).

story:
Op. Room NO.2 Feature length documentary

 

EXISTENCE AND FINITUDE : close look inside operating room

To choose the operation room and the forms of life surrounding it for the spatial focus of my documentary entails a delicate task requiring both artistic and technical sensibility. My interest in hospital spaces and discourses began when I start reading French historian and philosopher Michel Foucault. His elaboration on various spaces established around different relations of power, both in its visible and invisible forms, made me perceive the architecture of everyday life from completely different perspective.

Somewhere during this period, I began to attend operations at one hospital in the city of Zagreb under the supervision of a worldwide reputable neurosurgeon. As a hospital photographer I had a chance to witness more closely the mechanic of hospital life: constituted of hundreds and hundreds trained and disciplined gestures and speech acts. In the same time I got very interested in the intimate story of the chief surgeon, whose whole life was intertwined with those of hospital spaces and discourses. The great part of his early experience as a young surgeon came during the war in Croatia in the nineties in which he took a part as a field medic. Part of his success was an unusual emphasis on the doctor-patient relation, not just as a manner of courtesy but considering it an important aspect of patient’s healing process. 

 

The movie I decided to make is my contribution to an “archeology” of such spaces, and my final aim is to delineate the discursive formations and forms of subjectivities which are constituted in the operation room (and which are constitutive to it, in the same manner). The task that lies in front of me is difficult insofar as the story I wish to tell is driven out of context, without the beginning or end, focusing on a six months in the life of the neurosurgeon. Still, I don’t want that this movie becomes one more reality-based documentary. 

The thing that interested me the most is the type of discourse intertwined around spaces such as the operation room, articulated through a kind of quasi-metaphysical phrases like “between life and death”, “the bare life surgeon holds in his hands” etc. I wish to deconstruct this kind of conceptualizations in a way not to negate the importance of the care for patient’s health, but to try to show that it is possible to articulate a different type of statements beyond emotional (or transcendent) categories.

 

There is a kind of “banality” present inside the operation room. Banality in a sense that it is not so much about the atmosphere of fear and anxious struggle for bare life, but much more about well-organized routine, rational scientific method and cold precision. Silence, rustle of medical instruments and muffled sounds of medical machines – this is the operation room as it appears in its “banality”, stripped of the quasi-metaphysical language of an uninvolved observer. Furthermore, on the level of the form of language of cinematography it is not about any kind of drama, tragedy, or an attempt to imitate cinéma vérité, but about construction of different semantic field in which one is able to rethink the whole subject matter. I will not claim that with this I reveal something “truer” or “more real” behind the generalized discourse; I simply want to offer another perspective, emphasizing some elements and omitting the others. Reality is not to be revealed, but is constructed through various attempts destined to never fully grasp its totality.

 

INDIEGOGO goals

 

We’re looking to raise a minimum of €200,000 (EUR) which will insure the full production of the feature-length documentary. This covers over 6 months of full-time production, and two months of post-productin.

 

 

Research and development of the project started 1 years ago since Croatian Audiovisual Centre decided to support script development for Op. room N0.2. Since than the entire team have been assembled and the principal photography is set to start on October 1st, 2016.  The film will be a full-time production from August/2016  until  July/2017

 

What your funding supports!

Pre-production

Production

Post-production

Equipment rental

Music and score

Original artwork

Color grading

Digital Cinema Package

PR strategy

Online marketing 

Advertising

DVD/BLU RAY production

Distribution

Permits

Legal counsel

 

REWARDS for your support 

To show our gratitude for your contribution, we are offering some unique and exciting perks, which we will be updating and adding to throughout the campaign.

 

WHY THIS SUBJECT

In this film I want to enter those spaces that bear a certain mark of finitude.  Operation room seemes like one of such spaces – a crossroad on which a cinematographer truly becomes aware of its limits, both in a manner of technology and its own conditions of observation. Therefore, my aim is neither to transcend nor to transform the phenomenal limitation of profession but to cope with it in a sort of „existential” manner. Life as a concept, life as an object of cinematic framing, and life as a „real thing“, a lived experience, are three different things which unfolds in a way that one must become aware of the absurdity of ever thinking to grasp it in a non-mediated manner. To use Kantian terms, the noumenal seemed impenetrable, while the phenomenal left me unsatisfied.

 

Funds raised beyond our target will be used to apply to more film festivals (55%), festival marketing (33%), and festival travel (12%).

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to financially contribute to the campaign, you still can play a vital role by sharing this link on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and all other social media platforms. It is only with all of us working together that we can make this project happen.

And that's all there is to it.

THANK YOU!

In the same time I got very interested in the intimate story of the chief surgeon, whose whole life was intertwined with those of hospital spaces and discourses. The great part of his early experience as a young surgeon came during the war in Croatia in the nineties in which he took a part as a field medic. Part of his success was an unusual emphasis on the doctor-patient relation, not just as a manner of courtesy but considering it an important aspect of patient’s healing process. 
 

The movie I decided to make is my contribution to an “archeology” of such spaces, and my final aim is to delineate the discursive formations and forms of subjectivities which are constituted in the operation room (and which are constitutive to it, in the same manner). The task that lies in front of me is difficult insofar as the story I wish to tell is driven out of context, without the beginning or end, focusing on a six months in the life of the neurosurgeon. Still, I don’t want that this movie becomes one more reality-based documentary. 
The thing that interested me the most is the type of discourse intertwined around spaces such as the operation room, articulated through a kind of quasi-metaphysical phrases like “between life and death”, “the bare life surgeon holds in his hands” etc. I wish to deconstruct this kind of conceptualizations in a way not to negate the importance of the care for patient’s health, but to try to show that it is possible to articulate a different type of statements beyond emotional (or transcendent) categories.
 

There is a kind of “banality” present inside the operation room. Banality in a sense that it is not so much about the atmosphere of fear and anxious struggle for bare life, but much more about well-organized routine, rational scientific method and cold precision. Silence, rustle of medical instruments and muffled sounds of medical machines – this is the operation room as it appears in its “banality”, stripped of the quasi-metaphysical language of an uninvolved observer. Furthermore, on the level of the form of language of cinematography it is not about any kind of drama, tragedy, or an attempt to imitate cinéma vérité, but about construction of different semantic field in which one is able to rethink the whole subject matter. I will not claim that with this I reveal something “truer” or “more real” behind the generalized discourse; I simply want to offer another perspective, emphasizing some elements and omitting the others. Reality is not to be revealed, but is constructed through various attempts destined to never fully grasp its totality.

 
INDIEGOGO goals

 
We’re looking to raise a minimum of €200,000 (EUR) which will insure the full production of the feature-length documentary. This covers over 6 months of full-time production, and two months of post-productin.
 

 
Research and development of the project started 1 years ago since Croatian Audiovisual Centre decided to support script development for Op. room N0.2. Since than the entire team have been assembled and the principal photography is set to start on October 1st, 2016.  The film will be a full-time production from August/2016  until  July/2017
 
What your funding supports!
Pre-production
Production
Post-production
Equipment rental
Music and score
Original artwork
Color grading
Digital Cinema Package
PR strategy
Online marketing 
Advertising
DVD/BLU RAY production
Distribution
Permits
Legal counsel
 
REWARDS for your support 
To show our gratitude for your contribution, we are offering some unique and exciting perks, which we will be updating and adding to throughout the campaign.
 
WHY THIS SUBJECT
In this film I want to enter those spaces that bear a certain mark of finitude.  Operation room seemes like one of such spaces – a crossroad on which a cinematographer truly becomes aware of its limits, both in a manner of technology and its own conditions of observation. Therefore, my aim is neither to transcend nor to transform the phenomenal limitation of profession but to cope with it in a sort of „existential” manner. Life as a concept, life as an object of cinematic framing, and life as a „real thing“, a lived experience, are three different things which unfolds in a way that one must become aware of the absurdity of ever thinking to grasp it in a non-mediated manner. To use Kantian terms, the noumenal seemed impenetrable, while the phenomenal left me unsatisfied.
 
Funds raised beyond our target will be used to apply to more film festivals (55%), festival marketing (33%), and festival travel (12%).

 
 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to financially contribute to the campaign, you still can play a vital role by sharing this link on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and all other social media platforms. It is only with all of us working together that we can make this project happen.And that's all there is to it.THANK YOU!

story:
In September of 2014 they stopped my heart to open it up and fix it. My life has never been the same. If anything is going to change your life I guess dying would be pretty high on the list.

A doctor asked me what I was going to do with my second chance.  After thinking about it I asked myself “If I could anything I wanted to do what would I do?”  Well, I’m in film school.  I’m becoming more intimate with something I have always loved.  A world I’ve dabbled in for decades.

In the past 6 weeks I have worked on 6 short films including directing my own. This has been a tremendous learning experience and I had a great deal of fun being part of all of these projects.  However, due to expense of working on these and all of the costs associated with filming mine I’m left a little short in post-production.

Because of location issues and date changes forced on me, I had to re-permit, make several changes due to location requirements and add time to the shoot. All of which cost me more money.

The funds raised will go to paying some of the production costs, completing the project, licensing music and external work with other professionals. I’m hoping to enter this film into some festivals.

I know times are tough and people are busy. But, if you’re interested in helping out I’d appreciate it.

Thank you

Jerry

story:
Thank you to everyone who supported this campaign.  We look forward to finishing this film and sharing it with the world!

THE OFFICIAL TRAILER IS HERE!

I'm excited to share with you our official trailer. Check it out!



Hardboiled  is a satire of the urban American crime drama featuring two tough talking detectives, Harry and Callaham, who happen to be an egg and a slice of ham.  The 20 minute film is shot entirely in stop motion and each character, set piece, and prop has been built by hand right here in DUMBO, Brooklyn.

I’m a stop motion director by trade and together with the help of many talented friends and colleagues I’ve managed to complete 80% of the film with little-to-no funding.  But now it’s time to finish it and finish it the right way.


What remains is the fabrication and shooting of the final climactic scene of the film: the showdown between our hero detectives and the nefarious Juicy LeStraw (a strawberry, naturally).  


Help me finish this film by funding this final leg of the production.  In joining me you’ll be supporting independent film and the craft of stop motion animation.  You’ll bring to fruition a filmmaker’s dream that was set in motion almost a decade ago and is now ready to be shared with the world.  And you’ll join a vibrant community of supporters who also have a soft spot for food who can talk.





Detectives Harry and Callaham don’t play by the rules, resulting in suspensions and beatings at the hands of their boss, the explosive Knishoner. Undaunted by departmental politics, the Ham and Egg detectives set off in pursuit of a killer targeting eggs. With a mix of old fashioned police work and help from a bacon pimp, an oyster, and Olive the forensics specialist, Harry and Callaham make a shocking discovery that places the eggicides at the nexus of organized crime, real estate, and the skyline of the city itself.



Here's a little bit about the team behind this film.


Peter Sluszka is an Emmy award-winning director with over 18 years of experience in commercial, music video, television and feature film production.  He’s animated or directed over 300,000 frames of stop motion animation- that’s a lot of pictures to take!  He created the animated sequences for Miquel Arteta’s Youth in Revolt, collaborated with Michel Gondry on Bjork's "Crystalline" and has directed videos for Bat for Lashes, Moones, Regina Spektor and The Decemberists.


The legendary, Tony Award winner George Irving voices the nefarious Juicy LeStraw and the down-on-his-luck, busking street-dog.  George Irving’s career spans seven decades but in the animation world he is most celebrated for his portrayal of the Heat Miser, in Rankin-Bass’ classic holiday special, The Year Without a Santa Claus.  Cartoon historians will also recognize him as the narrator of Underdog.


Edd Hall voices Harry, the quick witted, quicker tempered detective who’s obsessed with the job.  His deadpan gravel-voiced egg, is but one facet of a long and varied career in film and television.  Most recognized as the long time announcer on The Tonight Show with Jay Leno, Edd can also be seen or heard in comedy sketches for Saturday Night Live and on David Letterman, just to name a few.

Joey Wells voices Callaham, the hyper macho loose-cannon of the department.  Joey is an accomplished comedy writer and performer best known for BET’s Comicview and Kevin Hart: Seriously Funny.  As a member of the Plastic Cup Boyz, Joey performs his stand-up comedy for a global audience and can be frequently seen on tour.

Emmy winner Anne Heche voices Olive, the intellectual forensics researcher and a love interest of Harry’s.  Best known for her feature film work in Donnie Brasco and Six Days Seven Nights opposite Harrison Ford, she is also a natural comic actress, bantering effortlessly with Ed Helms and John C. Reilly in Cedar Rapids.  She brings the same moxie to her characterization of Olive and can also be heard in the recurring animation role of Cherry Cream Soda on Cartoon Network's Adventure Time.


Lola Glaudini voices Pearl, the sassy barmaid clam who serves up drinks and valuable information to Harry and Callaham.  Lola is best known for her portrayal of Elle Greenaway on CBS’s Criminal Minds and as Deborah Ciccerone-Waldrip on HBO’s The Sopranos and can most recently be seen on Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D..



I am seeking $75,000 to pay for the labor, materials, equipment, and studio space needed to build and shoot the final scene.  Stop motion animation is a very labor intensive process and with your support I can hire additional fabricators and animators to work alongside me to complete the project in a reasonable amount of time.  Having the extra help will also reduce the length of time I will need to rent equipment and studio space, bringing those costs substantially down.  Since every character, prop, and set piece is built and animated by hand the funds will also be used to pay for all the materials including lumber, casting resin, armatures and foam.




A SOCIAL MEDIA SHOUT OUT from @HardboiledFilm and Hardboiled DIGITAL CONTRIBUTOR BUTTONS to use on your own social media profiles.

DESKTOP & MOBILE WALLPAPERS featuring scenes from the film. Also includes a social media shout out and digital contributor buttons.

DIGITAL DOWNLOAD OF THE FILM. The purest perk there is.  Looking for more swag?  Scroll down for $40 and above to get the film plus much more!

8 x 10 PRODUCTION STILL SIGNED by director Peter Sluszka. Also includes desktop & mobile wallpapers, digital contributor buttons, and a social media shout out.

A LIMITED EDITION HARDBOILED T-SHIRT. Also includes a signed 8 x 10 production still, desktop & mobile wallpapers, digital contributor buttons, and a social media shout out.

DIGITAL DOWNLOAD OF THE COMPLETED FILM plus a signed 8 x 10 production still, desktop & mobile wallpapers, digital contributor buttons, and a social media shout out.

Your NAME IN THE FILM'S CREDITS plus a digital download of the film, a signed 8 x 10 production still, desktop & mobile wallpapers, digital contributor buttons, and a social media shout out.

A DOWNLOADABLE MAKING OF VIDEO plus your name in the credits, a digital download of the film, a signed 8 x 10 production still, desktop & mobile wallpapers, digital contributor buttons, and a social media shout out.

A HARDBOILED COTTON CANVAS TOTE BAG plus the downloadable Making Of video, your name in the credits, a digital download of the film, a signed 8 x 10 production still, desktop & mobile wallpapers, digital contributor buttons, and a social media shout out.

A MEMORABILIA PACK including a digital download of the film, a signed 8 x 10 production still and a miniature prop used in the film (selected by the Director)!  Also includes the digital contributor buttons and a social media shout out.

A HAND DRAWN HARDBOILED CHARACTER SKETCH of your choice, plus a Hardboiled cotton canvas tote bag, the downloadable Making Of video, your name in the credits, a digital download of the film, a signed 8 x 10 production still, desktop & mobile wallpapers, digital contributor buttons, and a social media shout out.

An invitation to the NYC PRIVATE PREMIERE SCREENING of the film with crew. Plus a hand drawn Hardboiled character sketch of your choice, a Hardboiled cotton canvas tote bag, the downloadable Making Of video, your name in the credits, a digital download of the film, a limited edition Hardboiled t-shirt, a signed 8 x 10 production still, desktop & mobile wallpapers, digital contributor buttons, and a social media shout out. Does not include transportation to/from premiere screening.

BREAKFAST WITH PETER SLUSZKA at an NYC restaurant plus an invitation to the private premiere screening, a Hardboiled cotton canvas tote bag, the downloadable Making Of video, your name in the credits, a digital download of the film, a limited edition Hardboiled t-shirt, a signed 8 x 10 production still, desktop & mobile wallpapers, digital contributor buttons, and a social media shout out. Does not include transportation to/from premiere screening and breakfast.

A MINIATURE PROP USED IN THE FILM (selected by the Director), plus an invitation to the private premiere screening, a Hardboiled cotton canvas tote bag, the downloadable Making Of video, your name in the credits, a digital download of the film, a limited edition Hardboiled t-shirt, a signed 8 x 10 production still, desktop & mobile wallpapers, digital contributor buttons, and a social media shout out. Does not include transportation to/from premiere screening.

A 6 x 8 HARDBOILED ART BOOK featuring art and photos from the production and behind the scenes. Plus an invitation to the private premiere screening, a Hardboiled cotton canvas tote bag, the downloadable Making Of video, your name in the credits, a digital download of the film, a limited edition Hardboiled t-shirt, a signed 8 x 10 production still, desktop & mobile wallpapers, digital contributor buttons, and a social media shout out. Does not include transportation to/from premiere screening.

A PREMIUM MINIATURE PROP used in the film. These props are more prominent in the film than the other props. Plus a 6 x 8 Art Book, an invitation to the private premiere screening, a cotton canvas tote bag, the downloadable Making Of video, your name in the credits, a digital download of the film, a t-shirt, a signed 8 x 10 production still, desktop & mobile wallpapers, digital contributor buttons, and a social media shout out. Does not include transportation to/from premiere screening

A 4 HOUR ONE-ON-ONE ANIMATION TUTORIAL with Peter Sluszka (on set or via skype). Plus a 6 x8 Art Book, an invitation to the private premiere screening, a cotton canvas tote bag, the downloadable Making Of video, your name in the credits, a digital download of the film, a limited edition t-shirt, a signed 8 x 10 production still, desktop & mobile wallpapers, digital contributor buttons, and a social media shout out. Does not include transportation to/from premiere screening/tutorial.

A HANDMADE CHARACTER FIGURINE (choice of the Knishoner or Donut) plus a 6 x 8 Art Book, an invitation to the private premiere screening, a hand drawn character sketch, a cotton canvas tote bag, the downloadable Making Of video, your name in the credits, a digital download of the film, a t-shirt, a signed 8 x 10 production still, desktop & mobile wallpapers, digital contributor buttons, and a social media shout out. Does not include transportation to/from premiere screening.

A HANDMADE CHARACTER FIGURINE (choice of Harry or Callaham) plus a 6 x 8 Art Book, an invitation to the private premiere screening, a hand drawn character sketch, a cotton canvas tote bag, the downloadable Making Of video, your name in the credits, a digital download of the film, a t-shirt, a signed 8 x 10 production still, desktop & mobile wallpapers, digital contributor buttons, and a social media shout out. Does not include transportation to/from premiere screening.

NAMING RIGHTS FOR ON SET BILLBOARD. You give us the name or message and we'll design it into the set. Plus a 6 x 8 Art Book, an invitation to the private premiere screening, a hand drawn character sketch, a cotton canvas tote bag, the downloadable Making Of video, your name in the credits, a digital download of the film, a t-shirt, a signed 8 x 10 production still, desktop & mobile wallpapers, digital contributor buttons, and a social media shout out. Does not include transportation to/from NYC.

ON SCREEN EXECUTIVE PRODUCER CREDIT plus a billboard in the set, choice of one character figurine, a premium miniature prop, a 6 x 8 Art Book, invite to the private premiere screening, a hand drawn character sketch, a cotton canvas tote bag, the downloadable Making Of video, a digital download of the film, a t-shirt, a signed 8 x 10 production still, desktop & mobile wallpapers, digital contributor buttons, and a social media shout outs. Does not include transportation to/from premiere.




I hope that you’ll consider joining me in this project.  Whether you donate $1 or $1000, every single cent will help push this film towards the finish line.  If you aren’t able to give but still want to be involved there are other ways you can help!

  1. First and foremost, tell your friends!  Sharing is caring and in this case the more people we can let know about this project, the better chance we have of being successful.  Use the share links on this page to help spread the word.

  2. If you are in the NYC area, I’m looking for a low- or no-cost space to shoot in.  I’ve accounted for space rental in my budget but any money I don’t have to use towards that can be used to make the film look even better.  If you or anyone you know has access to a large studio space please contact me!

story:
Thank you for your interest in Crazy8s.

As some of our traditional sponsors are dealing with funding shortages, we are now reaching out to fans of short films and the arts in general for additional funding support so that our filmmakers can continue to make the best possible film they can through Crazy8s.

WHAT IS CRAZY8s?

Crazy8s is an annual 8 day filmmaking challenge that provides funding and support to emerging filmmakers in British Columbia to help them produce a professional short film. Over the last 17 years, it has grown to become a cornerstone of talent development in the province.

Since 1999, Crazy8s has given opportunities to 91 filmmakers and their teams of producers, writers, cinematographers, art directors, editors, composers and cast to produce fully funded, professional short films and present them to an audience of film professionals (as well as non-professionals) in Vancouver and around the globe.  It has become the place to discover new talent, provide valuable on-set training and give opportunities for filmmakers to create work that can be used to launch their careers in the film industry. 

Including crew and performers, Crazy8s has provided working opportunities for over 2,200 people.

This past year we had 179 people apply to Crazy8s 2016.  Twelve teams are chosen to move forward into the story editing round where they are paired up with professional story editors who help them craft their scripts.  Based on the final script, six projects are selected for production.  Those six filmmaking teams are given cash plus services generously provided by a host of sponsors.

This year, the 8 days of production will run from Feb 12 to 19 and our Gala screening and party will take place on Saturday, Feb 27th.

Crazy8s is run by the Crazy8s Film Society, a not-for-profit society.  It was created to foster support for emerging filmmakers who have little or no access to funding for short films.  


WHAT DO WE NEED, AND WHY DO WE NEED IT?

We are currently looking for $2,500 in support.  This goes toward the general operating costs of running Crazy8s including everything from insurance, equipment costs, publicity and advertising to venue rentals to part of the funds that go to each team.

WHAT WILL YOU GET?

Donating to Crazy8s means that you will be contributing to a reputable non-profit society and to the cultural landscape of Vancouver and BC.

The Highest Donor will get a one night stay at the Sandman Hotel in downtown with a minimum donation of $100. If a tie, a name will be drawn.

Furthermore, everyone who donates will have his/her name thanked in the Gala program and if you donate $100 or more projected on the screen at the Feb 27 Gala Screening for an audience of potentially 1,700 people.

out to fans of short films and the arts in general for additional funding
support so that our filmmakers can continue to make the best possible film they
can through Crazy8s.

story:
Short Summary

Someday America will be attacked with chemical agents, like those already used by Iraq, Syria and ISIS. Who will go in under hostile fire to detect and identify the chemicals and clean up the contamination? The Red Dragons of the 2nd Chemical Battalion, who are trained and equipped to go into the very heart of a chemical cloud and protect our warriors on the ground. In March 2016 the Red Dragons will enter “The Box” at Fort Polk, Louisiana to achieve their mission in rugged field conditions under attack from a smart, tough opposition force that doesn’t want them to succeed. This video will capture their training with its challenges, successes and failures and will tell the story of what it takes to be ready to protect America from chemicals in the hands of our enemies.

Why support this project?

This video, titled "Dragons in the Box" will educate both civilians and military personnel about how the U.S. Army will defend America against chemical attacks abroad or in the homeland. This is a danger so terrible that we would all rather not think about the possibility of mass casualties through lung damage, aggressive viruses, or nerve poisoning. The Red Dragons take on the responsibility of thinking about it and preparing to protect us. This story needs to be told because success requires money from Congress and support from the public.

What's the money for?

This is a bare-bones budget project. I will do the shooting, editing and marketing myself because frankly I don’t have any other resources. The funds will be used to get the professional level equipment that it takes to produce a quality project, and to help pay my lodging expenses during the project. I'm putting in a lot of my own money but if this campaign doesn’t make goal I will have to use cheaper equipment and my lodging may be a tent in a campground near Fort Polk.

Who am I and how do you know I can do this?

Even without resources I’m positive I can do a good job on this project. I've produced several short videos about the 2nd Chemical Battalion, marketing videos for my wife’s career as a clothing designer, and a proposal video for an invention she has patented. All these I’ve done on my own, the results have been effective and I’ve gained knowledge and experience that will make this project even better than the previous ones. I expect to run myself ragged but the result will be worth it.

How You Can Help

  • Please contribute if at all possible
  • Spread the word to others who may be interested.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to inform your friends!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Brandy M. Miller. I am a leader, an advocate, and a connector of people and ideas. I want to become a person known for restoring hope to the hopeless and giving the voiceless back their voices. My core values: faith, hope, and love. I am creative, enthusiastic, passionate, and courageous. I hope others describe me as compassionate, driven, and fearless. 

 I'm the author of 5 published books and more than a dozen I haven't published yet. I spent the better part of the last four years of my life devoted to writing, and the last three serving the needs of writers. I know exactly how hard it is to get your book finished, polished, and ready for publication. I know how discouraging it can be and how many pitfalls there are on the road to publication. 

My big goals: To help 40 Day Writer Reality TV become a reality so that writers can know what it takes to succeed and see that it is possible and so that publishers don't have to fear investing in first time authors because they can be assured that the authors will have what it takes to make it, to help the people of Flint, Michigan reclaim their homes and their voices, and to return to the people the power to make themselves heard. To accomplish my goals I must become committed to making them happen, I must become connected to the people who can help me, and I must become a mentor to those who are not where I am yet.

I want to help writers just like me get the help they need to get their books finished and out there. The 40 Day Writer Reality TV Series would help them, and every aspiring author out there, do that by showing them what's involved and how the book publishing and marketing industry works.

It would blow away the myths and reveal the hard work that goes into taking a book idea and making it a best seller.And America is ready for a show like this.  67% of Americans watch reality TV shows. 81% of Americans believe they have a book in them, and would like to see it published. There is currently no reality TV show that addresses the needs of this audience. The 40 Day Writer Reality TV show would change that.

What It Will Take

I have budgeted $1,250,000 to fund a single season of this show. 
$250,000 Live pitch event (footage to be used in season opener):  covers the cost of hiring a camera crew & production staff, renting a venue, feeding and housing the crew, transportation for the agents & coaches who will review the pitches, insurance, etc.
$100,000 Lodging, meals, and supplies for the writers during the 40 day competition
$250,000 Transportation for guest judges, agents, and coaches to and from the 40 day event sites
$150,000 Celebrity guests, agents, and coaching meals and accommodations
$500,000 Accommodations, meals, and salaries for staff members during the 40 days
The Perks
Donate $5 - Get an ebook copy of The Write Time: How to find all the time you need to write a book
Donate $25 - Get an ebook copy plus a printed copy of your choice of How to Write a Fiction Book in 40 Days or How to Write a Non-Fiction Book in 40 Days.
Donate $125 - Get the book plus access to the online video course that will accompany the books 
Donate $625 - Get print versions of all three books plus access to both online video courses and an invitation to join once-a-week group coaching sessions
Donate $3,125 - Get an invitation to one of 10 all-expenses-paid (transportation excluded) weekend writing workshops, once-a-week group coaching, and once-a-week email check-ups for ongoing support plus the books and online trainings.
Donate $15,625 - Get an invitation to one of 5 all-expenses-paid (transportation excluded) 7 day writer's retreat plus once-a-week group coaching, once-a-week email check-ups for ongoing support, books, and online trainings - PLUS - your finished book and your name will be highlighted in one episode of the 40 Day Writer opening season.
Donate $80,000 - Get an invitation to an all-expenses-paid (transportation excluded) 40 day writing bootcamp. It's a dry run for the show and will give us the all-important sizzle reel, so there will be judges, there will be agents, there will be coaches there to help, and there will be publishers competing for your manuscript if you make it to the final rounds. However, unlike the actual competition, you'll still be getting help and support to complete your manuscript, polish it, and present it. Yes, there will be "elimination" rounds, but all that means is that you won't be appearing on the camera from that point forward. We'll move you to a separate section of the retreat center and you'll work on your manuscript there. Plus, your book and your name will be highlighted in episode one of the season.
- OR - 
Candidate Sponsorship. If you don't want the retreat, but you want a relatively cheap way to promote your business, you can back a candidate. Your company name and logo will appear on screen whenever the camera is focused on your candidate. You will also get 30 seconds of on-air time during the episode to explain what made you choose that candidate to sponsor. Plus, you'll get a one-time only "save my candidate" ticket that allows you to veto a single elimination round for your candidate.
Donate $250,000 - Episode sponsorship. Your company name and logo (or book title and author name, etc) will appear in the opening credits of the show, plus you will be given 2:30 of air time during that episode to talk about 40 day writer and why you chose to sponsor it. Plus, you'll get a guest judge seat on that episode.
Donate $1,500,000 - Season sponsorship. Your logo and company name (or book title and author name) will be named in the opening credits of the show as the title sponsor.  Your representative will be given 2: 30 of talk time each episode, and every member of the staff and crew plus every candidate will wear a hat with your logo and name. Plus, your company (or you, if you're an author) will get a guest judge seat on every episode.

What If We Don't...

Raise Enough Funds

It depends on how much of the money is raised. If I can raise half, I can pursue sponsorships and even grants to make up the difference. There are alternate routes we can pursue to make this a reality, and I won't give up on our dream without fighting for it.

Find a Network Willing to Pick It Up

Not to fear. That's what the internet is for. If need be, we will host webisodes of our first season, take the money and the awareness we raise from that, and push forward. It's possible, given the nature of the show's content, that we may very well be able to get it up using public access tv resources.

The Impact

Watching a show like 40 Day Writer's Reality TV Series can encourage people who may have been thinking about writing to step up, get out there, and get heard. It can also give them important reality checks, letting them know what publishers and editors want to see, and what makes for a successful book.

There's a lot of benefit to be had for everyone involved in this. Viewers get an inside look at an industry that most people view as nothing short of magic, writers get an incredible opportunity to put their work out there and have it viewed by potentially millions of people. Imagine being able to have your book developing a fan base from the first sentence you write until the moment you publish - you'd remove a lot of the work of selling a book before you even began.

Agents are able to sift through submissions to find potential winners for them by searching using a simple hashtag. Coaches get an opportunity to show their stuff and encourage the work of a new crop of writers.

Publishers get the opportunity to bid on risk-free books by new authors who come prepared with author platforms and audiences already following their every move. There are only winners in this competition. 

Even the losers go home with exposure for their book ideas, contacts, and connections made in the publishing industry that are invaluable in getting published later.

This has the chance to change everything. And we can make it happen.

Risks & Challenges

Television is always a risky proposition. Networks may offer to pick up a series only to decide to drop it after a pilot doesn't do well or when a few episodes don't go over as planned. It's going to be absolutely critical that if you support it, you blog about it, you tweet about it, you write about it, and you share it everywhere you go both on and offline. 

These are the things that will not only help build an audience for it, but sustain that audience and allow it to grow. So once we start this campaign, discuss it, talk about it, express your feelings about it and what you would like to see happen with it. Share it with others. Because if we want this one to happen, it's going to be up to us to make it happen.

I realize that I am a relatively unknown author. That is going to scare some people. I don't have a book published through a major publisher. That's going to scare some people, too. However, I have already secured a promise from at least one well-connected vip in the publishing industry (who doesn't want to be named yet) that if we get further along in the project he will throw his support behind it. 

And the more backers and supporters I can get on this, the easier it will be to find others to do the same.

Other Ways You Can Help

Remember, if you can't back it, that's okay. Support it. Tweet about it, blog about it, share it to your favorite social media site. Share the idea in the real world with your co-workers, family, friends, and people at school. 

Did you support it? Great! Contact me at brandy@40daywriter.com. Let me know where you posted, what you did, and how you gave, and I'll post a link to your website and a thank you on my website http://40daywriter.com

And that's all there is to it.

story:
What is Wanna Be Hero?

Wanna Be Hero is a super fun experimental short. The reason I say experimental is because the short is a very basic story, however the goal is to make it feel comical and intense through great camera work. You will follow a Nerd who isn't doing much with his life, but dreaming for a better one. A life where super heroes really do exist. Is it possible to gain super hero powers just by putting on a costume??

Why should I Fund This project?

This project is meant for all ages and will be entertaining for all to watch. Funding this project is not only helping this video, but also a bigger project. The project's name is KRealProductions and my film company. The goal of my film company is to make skits, shorts, and feature films with loads of behind the scene content and tutorials. It will become a film resource hub for those who want to learn about film.  It is free and available for anyone who wants to learn about film; ranging from beginners to those who are more experienced. Funding this project will create more and more great videos like this one. It will be content rich, but also very entertaining.

Why $1810?

The $1810 is for two things! First, it will bring the DJI RONIN M gimbal into the production. The 3 axis gimbal helps stabilize footage to create a very professional looking video (for more information go to: http://www.dji.com/product/ronin-m ). The DJI RONIN M costs $1,400. It is pricey...but the results are outstanding!

Second, the money is also going towards a crash pad! Crash Pads are meant for stunt work and are essential for the safety of the actors and stunt men. The mat is $410.

Risks and challenges

Injuries are very possible with these action shorts. 
We can go about this by having safe equipment like the mats and proper fight choreographers on set.

Run out of ideas? 
Absolutely not. With a creative team comes a creative work flow so we will always be bringing you more content.

Enough money to do more shorts? 
We want to make our business as successful as possible on YouTube. Which means bigger projects...our goal is to make revenue so over time we can work our way up to these bigger projects.

The hardest part of this business is kickstarting it from a dream to reality. Your generosity and contributions will help us reach our goals! Once we make our first short it will get us the push we need to make more!


PHOTOS!

Below is a Crash mat


Below is a DJI RONIN M

First, it will bring the DJI RONIN M gimbal into the production. The 3 axis gimbal helps stabilize footage to create a very professional looking video (for more information go to: http://www.dji.com/product/ronin-m ). The DJI RONIN M costs $1,400. It is pricey...but the results are outstanding!Second, the money is also going towards a crash pad! Crash Pads are meant for stunt work and are essential for the safety of the actors and stunt men. The mat is $410.Risks and challengesInjuries are very possible with these action shorts. We can go about this by having safe equipment like the mats and proper fight choreographers on set.Run out of ideas? Absolutely not. With a creative team comes a creative work flow so we will always be bringing you more content.Enough money to do more shorts? We want to make our business as successful as possible on YouTube. Which means bigger projects...our goal is to make revenue so over time we can work our way up to these bigger projects.The hardest part of this business is kickstarting it from a dream to reality. Your generosity and contributions will help us reach our goals! Once we make our first short it will get us the push we need to make more!PHOTOS!Below is a Crash matBelow is a DJI RONIN M

story:
Summary

The relationship between a father and his son is put to the test when he realizes his son's dreams may not align with his own.

About Us

Nicholas Quiles

Director

Nicholas Quiles is a senior, film-making student at Montclair State University. He has directed several films including, "Dispatch" and "Six Degrees of Separation." In 2013, he founded the university's Video Production Club and continues to serve as President of the organization. Before college, he studied digital video production at Communications High School, a vocational academy in Wall Twp., N.J.  After graduation, Nick hopes to produce digital content for the online streaming services.

Collin Borow

Producer

Collin Borow is a sophomore, studying television production at Montclair State University. He is currently serving as Vice President of the Montclair State University Video Production Club. He has worked on multiple student films as Script Supervisor. "Hold the Mayo" is the first film project that he will be acting as sole-producer on. After graduation, Collin aspires to become an accomplished television producer.

What are your contributions going toward?

We determined that we can fund our full project with a $3,000 budget. Below is a brief breakdown of our budget.

Two-Way Street: How We Reward YOU!

Thank you so much for helping us, "Hold the Mayo," but we can't leave you hanging without some extra perks! Every contribution helps us get one step closer to our goal so we want you to feel like one of the family here at "Hold the Mayo" and give you a HUGE Thank You for everything. Not only will you receive bragging rights for helping us, but there are digital behind-the-scenes production booklets, signed art from the film, signed scripts from the cast and crew, a chance to be an extra in our film, and much much more! Just click the "Perks" icons to see all the ways we say THANK YOU to our contributors.

Why We Care & Why You Should, Too!
We care about this project for so many reasons, but the main reason why we need your help is because like all indiegogo accounts, we don't have enough funds to build our vision into reality.
The planning and ideas it took to create this dream came from a very personal place: the internal struggle we have with ourselves to accept the reality before us pushing against the life we want to hold onto. Change is always a perplex and misunderstood action, but we believe we have a script that definitely portrays key elements of that internal struggle and we want to bring that dynamic out into light. 

Risks & Challenges

All films come with challenges that filmmakers need to creatively overcome. Our greatest challenge is likely to be shooting scenes in our restaurant location. Filming in an active business is never easy! We have an extended shooting schedule to ensure that we are able to complete all principal cinematography.

Next, funding is another potential challenge. In the event that we do not meet our goal, we will adjust the budget accordingly. Funds will only go towards crucial elements of the film. As college students, we are very good at stretching a dollar and making it last.

Other Ways You Can Help

Support our campaign by sharing it on social media! Every share and mention helps bring attention to our project.
