story:
LOGLINE

"Kampung Tapir is about alienation in this modern world, and our desire for connection."

主旨

「《四不像新村》探討的是現代社會裡的疏離，以及我們與人連結的渴望。」


SYNOPSIS 

High antennas on rooftops stretch into the sky, in an old village called Kampung Tapir in Johor Malaysia. Within one of the houses are ANNE and her husband BEN, on their regular visit back home to their little daughter TUNG, who’s raised by Ben’s parents. Anne, who just got promoted and granted a Permanent Residency, tries to suggest bringing Tung to Singapore for good, where the couple works and lives, but fails to do so in front of Ben’s family, who hopes for the opposite. On the bus back to Singapore, Anne finally confronts Ben right before the bus hits an endangered animal – a Malayan Tapir. Anne finds herself trapped in the middle of nowhere, not fitting in both places, drifting away from her loved ones. Just like a wandering Tapir.

故事簡介

馬來西亞柔佛州一座名為四不像新村的村落裡，家家戶戶的屋頂上有著高聳的天線，以捕捉鄰國新加坡的電視訊號。其中一戶人家裡，安（31歲）和阿明（30歲）正在打包行李，結束這每週返鄉、探望居住在公婆家的女兒彤（5歲）的行程。安掙扎著要提出帶女兒到新加坡，與同在那裡工作的夫妻倆定居。但是，面對一心想回鄉團聚的丈夫與公婆，她怎麼也說不出口，自己已升遷、獲得新加坡永久居留證的消息。終於，在返途新加坡的巴士上，安向阿明開了口，但是還來不及有結論，巴士就撞到了一隻在馬來西亞野外瀕臨絕種、卻在新加坡動物園裡生存的動物──馬來饃，也俗稱四不像。安就像這隻倒地不起的動物一樣，迷失在新馬兩地的公路上，與故鄉、家人漸行漸遠，找不到自己的歸屬感。

ABOUT US  製作團隊

We are a group of friends who are crazy about films and worked together since film school for years. We are also young Asian filmmakers who are naïve, but resilient in telling stories of our generation, our homeland through film.

我們是一群熱愛電影、合作多年的同學與好朋友，試圖說出我們這個世代裡的家國故事，有點天真、卻很堅持的亞洲青年電影創作者。

Writer/ Director 編劇、導演｜Aw See Wee 歐詩偉

──Son of Johor, Malaysia 馬來西亞柔佛之子


       


“When I was in film school in Taiwan, our teachers would encourage us to film in our homeland, because it is where we were born and bred, and a place we can portray with the purest emotions. My fellow Johorians and I have been watching Singaporean TV since childhood, and grown up discussing to work in Singapore. It’s as if we’ve been staring at the island across the border all our lives, and that feeling is deep rooted in us.

Soon, I will be filming Kampung Tapir in my homeland, and just the idea of presenting the unique architectural landscape, the old bus stops, and the crowd lining up in the borderline- everything screaming Johorian, is making me emotional. Because this features my homeland carries, don’t exist elsewhere, and cannot be duplicated.”

「我在臺灣就讀電影的大學時期裡，老師們經常鼓勵學生回到自己的家鄉拍攝。家鄉是我們生長了幾十年的地方，總有些情懷可以用最純真、直接的感受去表達。我周遭的柔佛子民，從小在家收看的是新加坡的電視節目，長大後朋友之間也討論著要去新加坡工作。站在亞洲南端看著對面的島嶼，心情五味雜陳。

透過《四不像新村》，而讓我可以回到家鄉拍攝，我心裡特別激動，想把柔佛人的情感和情懷，透過捕捉當地的獨特建築地貌、人來人往的陳舊巴士站、以及通過關卡的人群等影像聲音，呈現在這部片子裡。因為我家鄉的這些特質，其他地方找不到，也複製不了。」


WHY IS OUR FILM SPECIAL？影片獨特之處

What is a Malayan Tapir? 什麼是馬來饃？

                       

We will skip the biology terms! A tapir has a synonym in Chinese, called “Like-nothing-else”. It has the nose of an elephant, the skin color of a panda, the weight of a cow, and eyes like human. It exists on its own, either in biological category, or in real life. It lives alone, unable to fit in any group, not even with its own species.

把真的馬來貘先介紹比較好。

艱澀的生物學我們就不談了！馬來饃擁有另一個名稱，叫作四不像。牠有著大象的鼻子，貓熊的膚色，牛的體重，人一樣的眼神，獨自存在在自己的生物類別裡、亦獨來獨往地生存著，無法融入任何群體，即使是同類。

Portrait of Current Johorians 當代柔佛子民的描繪

In our film, the tapir was hit over by a bus because of trying to cross the road looking for food. It was starving in its original inhabitat, and to survive, crossing the road was its only option.

Anne, our main character, is just like the tapir herself, travelling across the border, earning valuable Singaporean dollars for a better future, sacrificing the chance to take care of their elders, not witnessing her child’s growth, and alienating herself from her family and her homeland.

Our director Aw See Wee is from Johor, Malaysia, and studied Filmmaking in Taiwan for 6 years. When he came back home, he was shocked on how estranged he felt in his own country, and how much he himself has changed. He also observed how his fellow young Johorians, also migrant workers in Singapore, felt just like a Tapir, a “Like-nothing-else”, and confused of their self-identity. That inspired him to write down the story of Kampung Tapir.

《四不像新村》裡的馬來貘被撞傷了，因為牠想要過馬路至對面尋找食物。牠原本居住的地方糧食越來越少，越過危險的馬路是唯一的生存選擇。

片中的女主角──安，就像馬來饃一樣，為了更好的未來和孩子的前途，她必須和丈夫到新加坡工作賺取更值錢的新幣，卻因此照顧不了老人家、見證不了小孩的成長，和家人、故鄉之間的關系疏遠了。

全世界都在發生著為了更好的生活，而流動去異鄉工作的人。安，其實和許多人有關聯，或者說，其實我們可能都會是安，一個在別人的土地上工作、卻無法融入，在自己家園也漸漸無法適應的人。

來自馬來西亞柔佛州的導演歐詩偉，大學赴臺灣就讀了六年的電影，學成返鄉時，他強烈地感受到家鄉一股最熟悉的陌生，也或許是自己改變了。他也觀察到許多前往新加坡工作的同儕，同樣面臨著一種四不像的灰色困惑，是激發他寫下《四不像新村》故事的靈感。

Capture the Disappearing Landscape 捕捉即將消逝的柔佛景象


High antennas are everywhere on top of the houses in Northern Johor, Malaysia. They are 15 feet, and indestructible, rain or shine. They are used to receive signals from Singaporean TV channels, and thus most Johorians watch Singaporean TV shows, and can even sing the Singapore national anthem.

Soon, in 2017, Singaporean TV channels will all be digitalized, meaning the high antennas in Johor will no longer exist. As a filmmakers, what we could do is to preserve this special scenery on film and keep them alive for future generations.

在馬來西亞柔佛州北部一帶，高天線到處可見。15尺的高度，風吹雨打也立足不倒。高天線接收的是新加披電視臺的節目，因此多數柔佛人長期收看對岸星國的電視，甚至讓還會唱新加坡國歌。

2017年後，新加坡電視臺即將邁入數位化，意味著柔佛州高天線的建築地貌，將會成為歷史。身為電影工作者，我們可以做的是把現在特有的環境記錄下來，讓他們永存在影像裏，留給後人欣賞與討論。

How to film a tapir? 马来貘怎样拍？


This is something a lot of you are curious, excited and worried about. After all, Tapirs are endangered, existing only in the wild life of Malaysia, Indonesia, and Thailand. On the premise of not hurting any of them, we wish to collaborate with Pusat Konservasi Hidupan Liar Sg. Dusu, a reserve center in Malaysia for Malayan Tapirs, and film them within the area for materials in post-production. We will also build a fake Tapir model to shoot with for the bus scenes.

這是很多人好奇、興奮和擔憂的問題，畢竟馬來貘是稀有動物，只在馬來西亞，印尼和泰國地區出現。在不傷害馬來貘的前提下，我們希望可以跟Pusat Konservasi Hidupan Liar Sg. Dusun配合，也就是馬來貘保護中心，在保護區實際拍攝馬來饃的畫面作為素材。同時，我們亦會製作一個馬來饃模型，進行片中撞車橋段的拍攝。

FIRST LOOK 風貌搶先看！

Border Scene: Anne looking back at her homeland.

海關關口，安回望家鄉。

Dining Scene: Family dynamics.

用餐橋段裡，家人之間的關係與疏離。

Anne’s Scene: Her alone moments.

安獨自一人的片刻喘息。

Anne and Ben’s room design in Johor Grandparents House.

柔佛公婆家裡，安和阿明的房間概念圖。

Living room design in Johor Grandparents House.

柔佛公婆家裡，客廳概念圖。

MAIN CREW 主創團隊

Producer- OOI WEI SENG｜製片－黃偉誠

Wei Seng is a “village boy” grown up from Kedah, the northern state of Malaysia. He started interested to filmmaking while he was in secondary school.

Wei Seng went to China for his further studies, major in Film Directing at Communcation University of China. His student work “LALA” has won a prize from Student Video Festival in China.

After the graduation, Wei Seng went back to Malaysia and started lecturing filmmaking classes in Han Xing College, also he produced a short film “JAMBOREE” at 2015.


黃偉誠出生於吉打，亞羅士打，是一名土生土長的吉打牛。

在中學時期，就對制作電影這一行感興趣。之後到中國傳媒大學深造，主修為電影導演。大學作品“LALA" 在第二屆大學生影像節獲得最佳劇情獎。

畢業後，回大馬的大同韓新傳播學院擔任導師，教導電影制作課程。在2015年，也制作了一部短片名為“JAMBOREE”。

Writer/ Director- AW SEE WEE｜編劇、導演－歐詩偉

Graduated from Motion Picture Department of NTUA, Aw See Wee is a Malaysian filmmaker who went to Taiwan to pursue film studies.

His short film “DINNER” has been selected by several film festival including KINOKI Film Festival (Mexico), KKIFF (Malaysia), etc. His final year project “LUNCH” was also well received by festivals such as CAMERIMAGE (Poland), L’lnconnu Festival (France) and Bangkok International Student Film Festival (Thailand).

In 2015, See Wee also participated in Sabah Film Academy and received the Mentors Award. His first short film shot in his homeland Malaysia “HIGHWAY” was the top ten finalist of BMW Shorties (2015) competition, and official selection of KKIFF(2016). See Wee is now based in Malaysia and plans to make more films.


歐詩偉，馬來西亞新生代電影工作者，畢業於臺灣藝術大學電影系。

他的大學作品《晚餐》入圍了不少電影節包括了KINOKI Film Festival(墨西哥), KKIFF (馬來西亞)。他的畢業作品《午餐》也參與了幾個國際電影節CAMERIMAGE (波蘭)，L’lnconnu Festival (法國) 和曼谷國際學生電影節（泰國）。

2015年，詩偉參與了亞庇電影學院得到了Mentors獎項。他第一部在家鄉馬來西亞拍攝的短片” Highway” 入圍了 BMW Shorties比賽十強 (2015) 以及KKIFF (2016) 。 歐詩偉會在馬來西亞發展，也打算在自己的家園制作更多的影視作品。


Cinematographer- LEE LING｜攝影－李麟

Lee Ling born in 1989, Penang Malaysia, he studies filmmaking in Motion Picture Department of NTUA(Taiwan).

Lee Ling served as cinematography and gaffer during the study period. During this few years, he‘s been taking part in over 20 film production, mostly in camera and electrical department.

“Jamboree” is his first directed short film shot in his hometown Penang. This is also his graduate film project.

His cinematography debut, “He Has Never Come” which shot on Super 16mm has received numerous good review. The digital cinematography short film “Oh My Lisa” also has a good comment by the lecturer, “Highway” which is his first cinematography work in Malaysia, one of the top ten finalist of BMW Shorties (2015) competition.


李麟來自馬來西亞美麗的檳榔島，出生1989年的他，同樣也是臺灣藝術大學電影系的學生。

在求學期間，他大部分是擔任攝影以及燈光的崗位。同時之間，在技術組的崗位，也在業界參與了超過20部的影視作品。

“Jamboree” 是他第一部指導的短片作品，在他熟悉的家鄉檳城完成的畢業作品。

李麟的super 16mm攝影處女作 “He has Never Come”得到了不少好反應。另一部攝影作品 “Oh My Lisa” 也受到大學教授好評。“Highway”是他第一部在馬來西亞的攝影作品，入圍了 BMW Shorties 十強比賽(2015)。



Assistant Director- RINA B. TSOU｜副導－鄒隆娜

Taiwanese-Filipina filmmaker Rina B. TSOU studied filmmaking at Motion Picture Department of National Taiwan University of Arts. Being of two lands, she has an intimate understanding of the East and Southeast Asian situation and has applied her unique sensibilities to the issues raised in her films. This can be seen in her latest short film Arnie, about the situation of transient Filipino workers in Taiwan, competing at the 2016 edition of the Cannes Film Festival Critic’s Week. Based in Taipei, she is currently working on a short documentary Ching Mei’s Hands, slated to release later in the year and developing her first feature film project, titled, Raining Roses.

台灣/菲律賓電影工作者，畢業於國立臺灣藝術大學電影系，入選培訓於2015年柏林影展新銳營、盧卡諾影展導演學院。多元文化背景為其創作畫布，促成跨國合拍契機。最新短片作品《阿尼》描繪高雄前鎮漁港裡，一群菲律賓籍漁工的生命切片，入圍2016年坎城影展國際影評人週單元短片競賽。後製中的紀錄短片《青梅的手》，聚焦於一位嫁來台灣的中國籍媽媽，因身份問題產生的謬遇。開發中的首部劇情長片計畫《緋雨的季節》，命題為跨越成長的陣痛與蛻變，並透過台灣大學畢業男孩與菲律賓風災倖存少女的相遇，譜出一段愛慾與自我探索的交錯旋律，入選法國南特影展X台北電影節「國際提案工作坊」、金馬創投會議、東京FilmEx影展Tokyo Talents工作坊、越南Autumn Meeting導演工作坊等國際平台。

Production Designer- YEE YUN PING｜美術－俞雲冰

Yee Yun Ping (Fisshy )was born and grew up in Kuala Lumpur City. Graduated from National Taiwan University of Arts. She directed short film “Bro” which has been expose in Viddsee.

She is now working as graphic designer in MOVART Project, widely exploring herself in filming art. Painting is her way to express her thought. Believe in God and good things in humanity, as she believe in Devil and the evil in people`s mind.

Not really a workaholic or alcoholic. 

俞雲冰出生和長大的地方在吉隆坡，也是從臺灣藝術大學畢業。她的短片指導作品“Bro"可以在 Viddsee 觀賞。

她現在是 MOVART Project公司的平面設計師，還在廣泛探索電影美術。善於用筆的她，常常透過畫畫來解釋她的想法。社會教導相信上帝和好東西，但她也相信惡魔和人心中的惡念。

她不是個工作狂，也不是個酒鬼。

Editor- Erik Moh｜剪接－巫志隆


Erik has been hanging around with creating short film or others work which related to creativity since college. For example, during his studies, even though he’s major in advertising but he still joins broadcasting students and work with their assignment together. After 5 to 6 years working in film industries, Erik has experiences editing tv-programme, sitcom, short film, music videos, tele-movie and features film.

巫誌隆一直遊任於短片創作和多方面藝術相關的工作。例如，在他還是學生時期，盡管他主修廣告傳播，但他還是參與了廣電科系學生們的畢業短片制作。經歷了在電影業的5至6年光景，巫誌隆擁有了多方位的經驗，如：電視節目剪輯，情景喜劇，短片，音樂短片，電視電影和電影的制作。
Soun Design- SEAN YAP SHAO CHI｜聲音設計－叶肇麒

Sean Yap is a studied filmmaking in Chapman University, even before being officiated into film school, the act of combining images together was always a fascinating and engrossing process to Sean, an act that he would eventually learn was called editing. He loves collaborating with other filmmakers to achieve their vision, slowly but surely crafting the film in the cold darkness of the cutting room.

葉肇麒在一次不願幫忙的朋友情況下，跟音響設計結緣了。在他還來不及阻止遙遠散播，一傳十，十傳百，電影學院的學生，都以為他是專業的音響設計一般人的印象，對音響設計就好像好萊塢大制作電影會出現的爆破和刺激的聽覺享受。對肇麒來說，有更深層的小細節去挖掘，讓電影在音響設計的幫助下，營造電影的真實感: : 電腦的呼呼聲，吊扇的晃動聲，報紙褶皺的聲音從客廳傳到房間……試想想，如果這些聲音消失了，生活會是如何？

WHY WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT? 籌資動機

We now have initial financing from winning the Shortcuts workshop held by Malaysian TV station Astro Shaw and FINAS, but we are still 6,500USD short of budget. We need your support so we can start shooting by the end of July, 2016.

目前我们已经有初步資金，來自於马来西亚电视台Astro Shaw和FINAS舉辦的Shortcuts短片計畫競賽工作坊赢得的奖金，但还需要6,500USD来完善地籌拍片子。我們懇請您的支持，讓我們可以在7月尾順利進行拍摄。


Your  support will be used in these costs:

您的捐款可以让我们的拍摄资金用在：

  • Transportation and Accommodation 交通住宿费 

  • Props and Location Settings (ex. Fake Tapir model, bus rent, home setting) 
    美术（马来貘模型，巴士，家）

  • Talent Fees 演员费用 

  • Shooting Equipment 拍摄器材 

  • Location Expenses 场地费用

  • Wardrobe, Hair & make up 演員造型

  • VFX 電影特效 


OTHER WAYS TO HELP 大家來相挺！

  • Be one of our collaborators! Sponsoring for logistics, food, post-production, etc., please contact us for more detailed marketing plan at: kampungtapir@gmail.com

  • Share the link of this campaign on your social media outlets

在您的社群平台上分享此計畫的群眾募資專頁：


  • Tell your friends and family about us and send them the link to this campaign.
     向您的親朋好友推薦、分享享此計畫的群眾募資專頁。

  • Follow us on Facebook 
    至我們的臉書專頁按讚，追蹤我們的消息：

 https://www.facebook.com/kampungtapir

  • Use #KampungTapir when talking about us.

在社群平台提及我們的計畫時填寫 #四不像新村 ＃KampungTapir。


WHERE WILL THIS FILM GO?  影展與發行規劃

  • Phase one第一階段：

Film Festivals 各大國際影展、電影節。

  • Phase two 第二階段：

Astro A-List and worldwide media platform.

馬來西亞最大電視台Astro的A-List藝術頻道與全球媒體平台。

  • Phase three第三階段：

Johor screenings, Non-profit and Educational Collaborations

柔佛州放映活動，以及各式公益、教育推廣合作。


COLLABORATORS 合作夥伴

Click on the logos for more information about our collaborators.

想瞭解我們的合作夥伴，請點閱圖片連結。

             

  Shortcuts                                          Next New Wave


        

Astro Shaw                                   FINAS MALAYSIA

 

GENERAL INFORMATION短片資訊

Film Genre 電影類型｜Drama, Fantasy, Fiction Short（奇幻、劇情短片）

Film Length 電影長度｜15-20 minutes 分鐘

Format 電影規格｜DCP 2K Digital, Color 彩色、5.1 Surround 環繞音效、1:1.85 銀幕比例

Production Country 出品國｜Malaysia 馬來西亞

Supported by 出品方｜Astro Shaw, FINAS, Next New Wave

Completion Date 完成日期｜2016-09-11

Language 語言｜Mandarin 華語、English 英語

Contact聯絡窗口｜kampungtapir@gmail.com

THANK YOU 由衷感謝您！

Making films is never easy, and short films are often not taken seriously as an independent art form of cinema.

We have strived winning all three stages of the Shortcuts Workshop to fight for the chance to making this film, and will not stop our pursuit to make the best of Kampung Tapir.

We wish to start a new wave of fearless (maybe also shameless) attempts for Malaysian young filmmakers to engage the world in their short film creations, because for us: Cinema is always about making a connection.

想拍片從來不輕鬆，屬於短片獨有的電影美學與語言，更是經常不受重視。

我們奮力地全數過了Shortcuts短片計畫競賽設立的三關，斬了好多將，才贏得這次的拍攝機會。我們把《四不像新村》拍到最好的衝勁和努力，更是永無止盡。

我們希望透過這次的募資計畫，啓動一場馬來西亞年輕電影創作者無畏的（甚至無恥的）嘗試，嘗試將全世界納入我們短片創作的環節裡進行交流。因為對我們而言，電影永遠都是一場觸擊人心的互動。

Yours truly, 誠摯感謝

Kampung Tapir Team 《四不像新村》團隊成員

See Wee 詩偉、Wei Seng偉誠、Ling李麟、Rina 隆娜、Fisshy 雲冰、Erik志隆和 Sean肇麒  敬上
story_txt:
LOGLINE"Kampung Tapir is about alienation in this modern world, and our desire for connection."主旨「《四不像新村》探討的是現代社會裡的疏離，以及我們與人連結的渴望。」




SYNOPSIS 
High antennas on rooftops stretch into the sky, in an old village called Kampung Tapir in Johor Malaysia. Within one of the houses are ANNE and her husband BEN, on their regular visit back home to their little daughter TUNG, who’s raised by Ben’s parents. Anne, who just got promoted and granted a Permanent Residency, tries to suggest bringing Tung to Singapore for good, where the couple works and lives, but fails to do so in front of Ben’s family, who hopes for the opposite. On the bus back to Singapore, Anne finally confronts Ben right before the bus hits an endangered animal – a Malayan Tapir. Anne finds herself trapped in the middle of nowhere, not fitting in both places, drifting away from her loved ones. Just like a wandering Tapir.
故事簡介馬來西亞柔佛州一座名為四不像新村的村落裡，家家戶戶的屋頂上有著高聳的天線，以捕捉鄰國新加坡的電視訊號。其中一戶人家裡，安（31歲）和阿明（30歲）正在打包行李，結束這每週返鄉、探望居住在公婆家的女兒彤（5歲）的行程。安掙扎著要提出帶女兒到新加坡，與同在那裡工作的夫妻倆定居。但是，面對一心想回鄉團聚的丈夫與公婆，她怎麼也說不出口，自己已升遷、獲得新加坡永久居留證的消息。終於，在返途新加坡的巴士上，安向阿明開了口，但是還來不及有結論，巴士就撞到了一隻在馬來西亞野外瀕臨絕種、卻在新加坡動物園裡生存的動物──馬來饃，也俗稱四不像。安就像這隻倒地不起的動物一樣，迷失在新馬兩地的公路上，與故鄉、家人漸行漸遠，找不到自己的歸屬感。

ABOUT US  製作團隊



We are a group of friends who are crazy about films
and worked together since film school for years. We are also young Asian
filmmakers who are naïve, but resilient in telling stories of our generation,
our homeland through film.
我們是一群熱愛電影、合作多年的同學與好朋友，試圖說出我們這個世代裡的家國故事，有點天真、卻很堅持的亞洲青年電影創作者。



Writer/ Director 編劇、導演｜Aw See Wee 歐詩偉
──Son of Johor, Malaysia 馬來西亞柔佛之子


       

“When I was in film school in
Taiwan, our teachers would encourage us to film in our homeland, because it is
where we were born and bred, and a place we can portray with the purest
emotions. My fellow Johorians and I have been watching Singaporean TV since
childhood, and grown up discussing to work in Singapore. It’s as if we’ve been
staring at the island across the border all our lives, and that feeling is deep
rooted in us.
Soon, I will be filming Kampung Tapir in my homeland, and just
the idea of presenting the unique architectural landscape, the old bus stops,
and the crowd lining up in the borderline- everything screaming Johorian, is
making me emotional. Because this features my homeland carries, don’t exist
elsewhere, and cannot be duplicated.”


「我在臺灣就讀電影的大學時期裡，老師們經常鼓勵學生回到自己的家鄉拍攝。家鄉是我們生長了幾十年的地方，總有些情懷可以用最純真、直接的感受去表達。我周遭的柔佛子民，從小在家收看的是新加坡的電視節目，長大後朋友之間也討論著要去新加坡工作。站在亞洲南端看著對面的島嶼，心情五味雜陳。
透過《四不像新村》，而讓我可以回到家鄉拍攝，我心裡特別激動，想把柔佛人的情感和情懷，透過捕捉當地的獨特建築地貌、人來人往的陳舊巴士站、以及通過關卡的人群等影像聲音，呈現在這部片子裡。因為我家鄉的這些特質，其他地方找不到，也複製不了。」


WHY IS OUR FILM SPECIAL？影片獨特之處
What is a Malayan Tapir? 什麼是馬來饃？


                        





We
will skip the biology terms! A tapir has a synonym in Chinese, called
“Like-nothing-else”. It has the nose of an elephant, the skin color of a panda,
the weight of a cow, and eyes like human. It exists on its own, either in
biological category, or in real life. It lives alone, unable to fit in any
group, not even with its own species.

把真的馬來貘先介紹比較好。
艱澀的生物學我們就不談了！馬來饃擁有另一個名稱，叫作四不像。牠有著大象的鼻子，貓熊的膚色，牛的體重，人一樣的眼神，獨自存在在自己的生物類別裡、亦獨來獨往地生存著，無法融入任何群體，即使是同類。

Portrait of Current
Johorians 當代柔佛子民的描繪

In
our film, the tapir was hit over by a bus because of trying to cross the road
looking for food. It was starving in its original inhabitat, and to survive,
crossing the road was its only option.
Anne,
our main character, is just like the tapir herself, travelling across the
border, earning valuable Singaporean dollars for a better future, sacrificing
the chance to take care of their elders, not witnessing her child’s growth, and
alienating herself from her family and her homeland.
Our
director Aw See Wee is from Johor, Malaysia, and studied Filmmaking in Taiwan
for 6 years. When he came back home, he was shocked on how estranged he felt in
his own country, and how much he himself has changed. He also observed how his
fellow young Johorians, also migrant workers in Singapore, felt just like a
Tapir, a “Like-nothing-else”, and confused of their self-identity. That inspired
him to write down the story of Kampung Tapir.

《四不像新村》裡的馬來貘被撞傷了，因為牠想要過馬路至對面尋找食物。牠原本居住的地方糧食越來越少，越過危險的馬路是唯一的生存選擇。
片中的女主角──安，就像馬來饃一樣，為了更好的未來和孩子的前途，她必須和丈夫到新加坡工作賺取更值錢的新幣，卻因此照顧不了老人家、見證不了小孩的成長，和家人、故鄉之間的關系疏遠了。
全世界都在發生著為了更好的生活，而流動去異鄉工作的人。安，其實和許多人有關聯，或者說，其實我們可能都會是安，一個在別人的土地上工作、卻無法融入，在自己家園也漸漸無法適應的人。
來自馬來西亞柔佛州的導演歐詩偉，大學赴臺灣就讀了六年的電影，學成返鄉時，他強烈地感受到家鄉一股最熟悉的陌生，也或許是自己改變了。他也觀察到許多前往新加坡工作的同儕，同樣面臨著一種四不像的灰色困惑，是激發他寫下《四不像新村》故事的靈感。

Capture the
Disappearing Landscape 捕捉即將消逝的柔佛景象




High
antennas are everywhere on top of the houses in Northern Johor, Malaysia. They
are 15 feet, and indestructible, rain or shine. They are used to receive
signals from Singaporean TV channels, and thus most Johorians watch Singaporean
TV shows, and can even sing the Singapore national anthem.
Soon, in 2017, Singaporean
TV channels will all be digitalized, meaning the high antennas in Johor will no
longer exist. As a filmmakers, what we could do is to preserve this special
scenery on film and keep them alive for future generations.



在馬來西亞柔佛州北部一帶，高天線到處可見。15尺的高度，風吹雨打也立足不倒。高天線接收的是新加披電視臺的節目，因此多數柔佛人長期收看對岸星國的電視，甚至讓還會唱新加坡國歌。
2017年後，新加坡電視臺即將邁入數位化，意味著柔佛州高天線的建築地貌，將會成為歷史。身為電影工作者，我們可以做的是把現在特有的環境記錄下來，讓他們永存在影像裏，留給後人欣賞與討論。

How to film a tapir? 马来貘怎样拍？





This is something a
lot of you are curious, excited and worried about. After all, Tapirs are
endangered, existing only in the wild life of Malaysia, Indonesia, and
Thailand. On the premise of not hurting any of them, we wish to collaborate
with Pusat Konservasi Hidupan Liar Sg. Dusu, a reserve center in Malaysia for
Malayan Tapirs, and film them within the area for materials in post-production.
We will also build a fake Tapir model to shoot with for the bus scenes.
這是很多人好奇、興奮和擔憂的問題，畢竟馬來貘是稀有動物，只在馬來西亞，印尼和泰國地區出現。在不傷害馬來貘的前提下，我們希望可以跟Pusat Konservasi Hidupan Liar Sg. Dusun配合，也就是馬來貘保護中心，在保護區實際拍攝馬來饃的畫面作為素材。同時，我們亦會製作一個馬來饃模型，進行片中撞車橋段的拍攝。
FIRST LOOK 風貌搶先看！


Border Scene: Anne looking back at her homeland. 海關關口，安回望家鄉。


Dining Scene: Family dynamics. 用餐橋段裡，家人之間的關係與疏離。



Anne’s Scene: Her alone moments. 安獨自一人的片刻喘息。



Anne and Ben’s room design in Johor Grandparents House.柔佛公婆家裡，安和阿明的房間概念圖。



Living room design in Johor Grandparents House.柔佛公婆家裡，客廳概念圖。


MAIN CREW 主創團隊
Producer- OOI WEI SENG｜製片－黃偉誠



Wei Seng is a “village boy” grown up from Kedah, the northern state of Malaysia. He started interested to filmmaking while he was in secondary school.
Wei Seng went to China for his further studies, major in Film Directing at Communcation University of China. His student work “LALA” has won a prize from Student Video Festival in China. 
After the graduation, Wei Seng went back to Malaysia and started lecturing filmmaking classes in Han Xing College, also he produced a short film “JAMBOREE” at 2015. 
黃偉誠出生於吉打，亞羅士打，是一名土生土長的吉打牛。
在中學時期，就對制作電影這一行感興趣。之後到中國傳媒大學深造，主修為電影導演。大學作品“LALA" 在第二屆大學生影像節獲得最佳劇情獎。畢業後，回大馬的大同韓新傳播學院擔任導師，教導電影制作課程。在2015年，也制作了一部短片名為“JAMBOREE”。


Writer/ Director- AW SEE WEE｜編劇、導演－歐詩偉



Graduated from Motion Picture Department of NTUA, Aw See Wee is a Malaysian filmmaker who went to Taiwan to pursue film studies.
His short film “DINNER” has been selected by several film festival including KINOKI Film Festival (Mexico), KKIFF (Malaysia), etc. His final year project “LUNCH” was also well received by festivals such as CAMERIMAGE (Poland), L’lnconnu Festival (France) and Bangkok International Student Film Festival (Thailand).
In 2015, See Wee also participated in Sabah Film Academy and received the Mentors Award. His first short film shot in his homeland Malaysia “HIGHWAY” was the top ten finalist of BMW Shorties (2015) competition, and official selection of KKIFF(2016). See Wee is now based in Malaysia and plans to make more films.




歐詩偉，馬來西亞新生代電影工作者，畢業於臺灣藝術大學電影系。
他的大學作品《晚餐》入圍了不少電影節包括了KINOKI Film Festival(墨西哥), KKIFF (馬來西亞)。他的畢業作品《午餐》也參與了幾個國際電影節CAMERIMAGE (波蘭)，L’lnconnu Festival (法國) 和曼谷國際學生電影節（泰國）。
2015年，詩偉參與了亞庇電影學院得到了Mentors獎項。他第一部在家鄉馬來西亞拍攝的短片” Highway” 入圍了 BMW Shorties比賽十強 (2015) 以及KKIFF (2016) 。 歐詩偉會在馬來西亞發展，也打算在自己的家園制作更多的影視作品。



Cinematographer- LEE LING｜攝影－李麟


Lee Ling born in 1989, Penang Malaysia, he studies filmmaking in Motion Picture Department of NTUA(Taiwan). 
Lee Ling served as cinematography and gaffer during the study period. During this few years, he‘s been taking part in over 20 film production, mostly in camera and electrical department. 
“Jamboree” is his first directed short film shot in his hometown Penang. This is also his graduate film project. 
His cinematography debut, “He Has Never Come” which shot on Super 16mm has received numerous good review. The digital cinematography short film “Oh My Lisa” also has a good comment by the lecturer, “Highway” which is his first cinematography work in Malaysia, one of the top ten finalist of BMW Shorties (2015) competition.


李麟來自馬來西亞美麗的檳榔島，出生1989年的他，同樣也是臺灣藝術大學電影系的學生。
在求學期間，他大部分是擔任攝影以及燈光的崗位。同時之間，在技術組的崗位，也在業界參與了超過20部的影視作品。
“Jamboree” 是他第一部指導的短片作品，在他熟悉的家鄉檳城完成的畢業作品。
李麟的super 16mm攝影處女作 “He has Never Come”得到了不少好反應。另一部攝影作品 “Oh My Lisa” 也受到大學教授好評。“Highway”是他第一部在馬來西亞的攝影作品，入圍了 BMW Shorties 十強比賽(2015)。


Assistant Director- RINA B. TSOU｜副導－鄒隆娜

Taiwanese-Filipina filmmaker Rina B. TSOU studied filmmaking at Motion Picture Department of National Taiwan University of Arts. Being of two lands, she has an intimate understanding of the East and Southeast Asian situation and has applied her unique sensibilities to the issues raised in her films. This can be seen in her latest short film Arnie, about the situation of transient Filipino workers in Taiwan, competing at the 2016 edition of the Cannes Film Festival Critic’s Week. Based in Taipei, she is currently working on a short documentary Ching Mei’s Hands, slated to release later in the year and developing her first feature film project, titled, Raining Roses.台灣/菲律賓電影工作者，畢業於國立臺灣藝術大學電影系，入選培訓於2015年柏林影展新銳營、盧卡諾影展導演學院。多元文化背景為其創作畫布，促成跨國合拍契機。最新短片作品《阿尼》描繪高雄前鎮漁港裡，一群菲律賓籍漁工的生命切片，入圍2016年坎城影展國際影評人週單元短片競賽。後製中的紀錄短片《青梅的手》，聚焦於一位嫁來台灣的中國籍媽媽，因身份問題產生的謬遇。開發中的首部劇情長片計畫《緋雨的季節》，命題為跨越成長的陣痛與蛻變，並透過台灣大學畢業男孩與菲律賓風災倖存少女的相遇，譜出一段愛慾與自我探索的交錯旋律，入選法國南特影展X台北電影節「國際提案工作坊」、金馬創投會議、東京FilmEx影展Tokyo Talents工作坊、越南Autumn Meeting導演工作坊等國際平台。

Production Designer- YEE YUN PING｜美術－俞雲冰


Yee Yun Ping (Fisshy )was born and grew up in Kuala Lumpur City. Graduated from National Taiwan University of Arts. She directed short film “Bro” which has been expose in Viddsee. 
She is now working as graphic designer in MOVART Project, widely exploring herself in filming art. Painting is her way to express her thought. Believe in God and good things in humanity, as she believe in Devil and the evil in people`s mind.
Not really a workaholic or alcoholic. 

俞雲冰出生和長大的地方在吉隆坡，也是從臺灣藝術大學畢業。她的短片指導作品“Bro"可以在 Viddsee 觀賞。
她現在是 MOVART Project公司的平面設計師，還在廣泛探索電影美術。善於用筆的她，常常透過畫畫來解釋她的想法。社會教導相信上帝和好東西，但她也相信惡魔和人心中的惡念。
她不是個工作狂，也不是個酒鬼。

Editor- Erik Moh｜剪接－巫志隆


Erik has been hanging around with creating short film or others work which related to creativity since college. For example, during his studies, even though he’s major in advertising but he still joins broadcasting students and work with their assignment together. After 5 to 6 years working in film industries, Erik has experiences editing tv-programme, sitcom, short film, music videos, tele-movie and features film.巫誌隆一直遊任於短片創作和多方面藝術相關的工作。例如，在他還是學生時期，盡管他主修廣告傳播，但他還是參與了廣電科系學生們的畢業短片制作。經歷了在電影業的5至6年光景，巫誌隆擁有了多方位的經驗，如：電視節目剪輯，情景喜劇，短片，音樂短片，電視電影和電影的制作。
Soun Design- SEAN YAP SHAO CHI｜聲音設計－叶肇麒

Sean Yap is a studied filmmaking in Chapman University, even before being officiated into film school, the act of combining images together was always a fascinating and engrossing process to Sean, an act that he would eventually learn was called editing. He loves collaborating with other filmmakers to achieve their vision, slowly but surely crafting the film in the cold darkness of the cutting room.葉肇麒在一次不願幫忙的朋友情況下，跟音響設計結緣了。在他還來不及阻止遙遠散播，一傳十，十傳百，電影學院的學生，都以為他是專業的音響設計一般人的印象，對音響設計就好像好萊塢大制作電影會出現的爆破和刺激的聽覺享受。對肇麒來說，有更深層的小細節去挖掘，讓電影在音響設計的幫助下，營造電影的真實感: : 電腦的呼呼聲，吊扇的晃動聲，報紙褶皺的聲音從客廳傳到房間……試想想，如果這些聲音消失了，生活會是如何？
WHY WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT? 籌資動機
We now have initial financing from winning the Shortcuts workshop held by Malaysian TV station Astro Shaw and FINAS, but we are still 6,500USD short of budget. We need your support so we can start shooting by the end of July, 2016.
目前我们已经有初步資金，來自於马来西亚电视台Astro Shaw和FINAS舉辦的Shortcuts短片計畫競賽工作坊赢得的奖金，但还需要6,500USD来完善地籌拍片子。我們懇請您的支持，讓我們可以在7月尾順利進行拍摄。
Your  support will be used in these costs:
您的捐款可以让我们的拍摄资金用在：

Transportation and Accommodation 交通住宿费 
Props and Location Settings (ex. Fake Tapir model, bus rent, home setting) 美术（马来貘模型，巴士，家）
Talent Fees 演员费用 
Shooting Equipment 拍摄器材 
Location Expenses 场地费用
Wardrobe, Hair & make up 演員造型
VFX 電影特效 




OTHER WAYS TO HELP 大家來相挺！

Be one of our collaborators! Sponsoring for logistics, food, post-production, etc., please contact us for more detailed marketing plan at: kampungtapir@gmail.com
Share the link of this campaign on your social media outlets

在您的社群平台上分享此計畫的群眾募資專頁：

Tell your friends and family about us and send them the link to this campaign. 向您的親朋好友推薦、分享享此計畫的群眾募資專頁。
Follow us on Facebook 至我們的臉書專頁按讚，追蹤我們的消息：
  https://www.facebook.com/kampungtapir
Use #KampungTapir when talking about us.
在社群平台提及我們的計畫時填寫 #四不像新村 ＃KampungTapir。


WHERE WILL THIS FILM GO?  影展與發行規劃
Phase one第一階段：
Film Festivals 各大國際影展、電影節。
Phase two 第二階段：
Astro A-List and worldwide media platform.
馬來西亞最大電視台Astro的A-List藝術頻道與全球媒體平台。
Phase three第三階段：
Johor screenings, Non-profit and Educational Collaborations柔佛州放映活動，以及各式公益、教育推廣合作。

COLLABORATORS 合作夥伴
Click on the logos for more information about our collaborators.
想瞭解我們的合作夥伴，請點閱圖片連結。
             
  Shortcuts                                          Next New Wave


        

Astro Shaw                                   FINAS MALAYSIA

 
GENERAL INFORMATION短片資訊
Film Genre 電影類型｜Drama, Fantasy, Fiction Short（奇幻、劇情短片）
Film Length 電影長度｜15-20 minutes 分鐘
Format 電影規格｜DCP 2K Digital, Color 彩色、5.1 Surround 環繞音效、1:1.85 銀幕比例
Production Country 出品國｜Malaysia 馬來西亞
Supported by 出品方｜Astro Shaw, FINAS, Next New Wave
Completion Date 完成日期｜2016-09-11
Language 語言｜Mandarin 華語、English 英語
Contact聯絡窗口｜kampungtapir@gmail.com 
THANK YOU 由衷感謝您！
Making films is never easy, and short films are often not taken seriously as an independent art form of cinema. 
We have strived winning all three stages of the Shortcuts Workshop to fight for the chance to making this film, and will not stop our pursuit to make the best of Kampung Tapir.
We wish to start a new wave of fearless (maybe also shameless) attempts for Malaysian young filmmakers to engage the world in their short film creations, because for us: Cinema is always about making a connection.
想拍片從來不輕鬆，屬於短片獨有的電影美學與語言，更是經常不受重視。
我們奮力地全數過了Shortcuts短片計畫競賽設立的三關，斬了好多將，才贏得這次的拍攝機會。我們把《四不像新村》拍到最好的衝勁和努力，更是永無止盡。
我們希望透過這次的募資計畫，啓動一場馬來西亞年輕電影創作者無畏的（甚至無恥的）嘗試，嘗試將全世界納入我們短片創作的環節裡進行交流。因為對我們而言，電影永遠都是一場觸擊人心的互動。
Yours truly, 誠摯感謝
Kampung Tapir Team 《四不像新村》團隊成員
See Wee 詩偉、Wei Seng偉誠、Ling李麟、Rina 隆娜、Fisshy 雲冰、Erik志隆和 Sean肇麒  敬上

story:
DEZE INDIEGOGO IS AFGELOPEN.
Wil je ons nog steeds steunen? Dat kan!
Meer info op teleurdeugd.com/perks




Teleurdeugd, een filmproject gedragen door jong geweld. Een film over de waanzin van jonge mensen, de waanzin van depressie en simpelweg de waanzin van de wereld rondom ons.

We zijn het beu om psychische problemen altijd op dezelfde monotone manier op beeld te zien: huilen op een bed, huilen in de douche en er onverzorgd uitzien. Nochtans als we eerlijk zijn, krijgt iedereen zijn portie duisternis en momenten die enkel gevuld zijn met licht.

Wij proberen met Teleurdeugd je mee te nemen in de waanzin. Een verhaal sterk gebaseerd op onze eigen ervaringen en die van anderen. Wij geloven dat als je naar de kern wil gaan van depressie en de strijd vaak in ons eigen hoofd wil voeren, dat je afstand moet nemen van de realiteit. Wij kiezen bewust voor een surrealistisch tintje omdat, in onze zwaarste momenten, het leven ook niet meer reëel aanvoelt.

Dit is geen project van een 'fancy' productiehuis of oude ervaren rotten van het vak. Neen. Dit project wordt enkel en alleen ondersteund door jong geweld dat niet kan wachten om te tonen wat we kunnen. Dit is geen schoolproject of vrijetijdsbesteding. We willen relevant zijn in het maatschappelijk debat. We willen visueel meepraten over het onderbelicht onderwerp.

Het gegeven dat dit project recht uit de onderlaag komt, maakt het al boeiend experiment op zich. De technologie en sociale media maakt het mogelijk om met een goed plan en veel doorzetting een onafhankelijk werk te maken dat relevant is.

Ja, dat zijn wij van plan! We betrekken graag zoveel mogelijk mensen die ons willen steunen. Dat kan op allerhande manieren: steun ons financieel, contacteer ons voor figuratie of een rol in de film. Misschien heb je filmmateriaal dat we kunnen gebruiken? Of ken je toevallig een bedrijf dat ons graag sponsort? Kom gerust een dagje spaghetti maken voor onze acteurs en crew of praat er gewoon over met andere mensen tussen pot en pint! Alle raad en hulp is zeker welkom. Alleen kunnen en willen we het niet!

Wie maakt er nu in godsnaam een film met 1000 euro?
Welja...wij!

Je kan niet enkel met geld een film maken...
Bij teleurdeugd kiezen we bewust niet voor de grote bedragen, we geloven meer in vriendelijke mensen dan in briefjes geld!

Ons team bestaat uit jonge vrijwilligers die hun eerste stappen nemen in hun passies. Elke dag leren we bij van elkaar, van jullie en door de situaties waar we in belanden. We laten geld ons niet belemmeren en gaan net voor de creatieve oplossing die vaak het proces en resultaat net leuker maken.

De 1000 euro zouden we graag ophalen voor specifieke extra's:
voor huurmateriaal bij bepaalde grote scenes waar we moeten investeren. Zo zullen we extra camera's licht en geluid nodig hebben. We streven nog steeds naar een professioneel eindresultaat!

Voor promotie en screenings. Als iedereen zijn inspanningen heeft geleverd willen we ervoor zorgen dat de film zoveel mogelijk mensen bereikt, alleen al uit respect voor alle helpende handen.

Tenslotte het belangrijkste van allemaal! Met onze 1000 euro willen we onze vrijwilligers in de watten leggen met een hartverwarmende catering en een welverdiende dorstlesser!

Alles wat opgehaald wordt boven de 1000 euro zal geïnvesteerd worden in beter filmmateriaal, onze vrijwilligers en het verspreiden van ons eindresultaat!

Kortom je kan ons op veel verschillende manieren steunen! Steun ons op indiegogo en je ontvangt voor 10 euro al de film eenmaal hij klaar is. Kom eens koken voor ons! Misschien heb je opnamemateriaal dat we kunnen gebruiken? Of ken je toevallig een bedrijf dat ons graag sponsort? Laat het ons weten!


Je kan nog veel meer informatie over ons en het project vinden op onze website: www.teleurdeugd.com

story:
'Just over half the amputees we meet in The Gambia have limb-loss due to type 2 diabetes related problems. The elimination of high sugar diets and an education in nutritional awareness is imperative to the future of reducing limb-loss across The Gambia. ' -  Phil Tunstall, Legs4Africa 

I'm Megan and I am a freelance maker, and I run workshops in ceramics and film in Cornwall.

I've been making films with a charity called Legs4Africa on and off for a couple of years. Legs4Africa collect dis-used prosthetic limbs from the UK and distribute them across Africa.

In a months time I am heading out to The Gambia to start an important project. For this project I will need £1200. The project aims to start an important conversation in The Gambia, tackling the subject of limb-loss and hoping to improve the education of diabetes with which the loss of limbs in The Gambia is strongly linked. 

PROJECT PLAN

My aim is to create an informative and fun film on the subject of diabetes and how a healthy diet can help reduce the risk of limb-loss. This film will be made by local school children with my guidance and help. Once complete I will then take it on tour to start this imperative conversation.

The Plan in stages:

  1. Spend time with The Gambia's prosthetic doctor (there is only one!)
  2. Learn more about diabetes at the local hospital
  3. Share my research with the local school
  4. Create an educational film with school children on the benefits of a healthy lifestyle and the possible consequences of an unhealthy lifestyle.
  5. And finally take this film on tour to other schools in Gambia to start an important dialogue.

EDUCATION

Having run film workshops in schools I strongly believe in the benefits of a working environment which allows for; open conversation, creative making, ideas building and a physical and active learning experience.

This style of film making which is a process of both learning and passing learnt information on is a very empowering experience for the children involved.  Its a valuable technique which celebrates the use of knowledge and the understanding that children can teach as well as be taught! 

Film is also a great way for to communicate to a wider audience, as this visual an audible nature has the ability to cross language barriers and capture young imaginations whilst informing.

THE MONEY YOU DONATE...

The money that you give will enable me too:

  • Make the journey to Gambia with necessary medical supplies for the prosthetics centre.
  • Buy extra materials and equipment for prop/film making
  • Travel costs to get to schools, hospitals and visit local amputees
  • Desperately needed after care research on prosthetics fitted in The Gambia 
  • Research into the treatment and of amputees in The Gambia within their own communities.

HOW CAN I HELP IN ANOTHER WAY?

I understand that not everyone can donate and any support would be wonderful. Here are a few other ways you can help:

  • Share, like and post about this project
  • Volunteer for Legs4Africa
  • If you have a spare or disused laptop with Adobe Premier Pro on this would be greatly appreciated for editing the film whilst in The Gambia. 
THE IMPACT
Your wonderful support will help start an imperative conversation in The Gambia as well as help progress pre-existing projects and give children a wonderful, engaging and fun experience which they can pass on to others.
EXTRA MONEY
Any extra money raised will go towards extra equipment for either schools, hospitals or amputees.

story:
Seeking funding to finish making a documentary film about Peruvian “super foods” (you can visit the photo gallery to learn about a few of them!)

Hatun Phajcha, The Healing Land is a documentary from award-winning Peruvian filmmaker Delia Ackerman—a film that seeks to inform the public as well as influence policy. Help bring this movie to completion so that the world can learn about the remarkable properties of nutrient-rich foods that have been cultivated for centuries in Peru. By supporting this film and sharing its message, you will

  • Increase public awareness and access to better nutrition
  • Help support the work of farmers and scientists  who are preserving, propagating, promoting and studying ancient Peruvian crops that are in danger of being lost.
  • Remind policy makers of the importance of these native foods as a national resource to develop and safeguard.

Making healthier food options available to every kitchen and raising awareness among policy makers will help reverse some of the most serious global health problems.

MALNUTRITION

So much of Peru’s ancestral knowledge has been devalued and lost since the colonization of the country that, even in Peru, nutritious crops are often not valued and many children grow up seriously undernourished. In other parts of the world the situation is even worse. According to data from UNICEF, WHO (the World Health Organization) and FAO (the Food  and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations, HALF THE PEOPLE ON THE PLANET TODAY ARE MALNOURISHED.  Every year, an estimated 3.1 million children under five die, and 161 million are irreversibly stunted physically and mentally because of chronic malnutrition.  Yet even in the most marginalized populations, when good nutrition is supported by access to  water, sanitation,  education and financial security, entire communities are transformed.

LIMITED RESOURCES / UNDERUTILIZED RESOURCES

Our global food system is overburdened and many fear it will become even more so with the impact of climate change and rapid population growth.  It is time to take advantage of the potential to be found in lesser known foods that have high concentrations of nutrients. Often referred to as superfoods or power foods, these products can have an important impact once they become better known and more available.

YOUR SUPPORT WILL HELP SPREAD THE WORD

The Healing Land showcases the cultivation and uses of various traditional crops domesticated in pre-Columbian Perú, and also features the people who work with them. You will meet hardworking farmers, committed “guardians” of many species, dedicated scientists, creative chefs and nutritionists, and enthusiastic entrepreneurs.

We will take you with us through the culturally and biologically diverse regions of this amazing country as we highlight the remarkable health benefits and nutritional value of products that are often unknown or overlooked.

WE INVITE YOU TO JOIN US on our journey to discover more about foods like:

Aguaje     Aguaymanto      Ahipa

Aji      Algarrobo       Arracacha      Asai     Cacao

Camu Camu       Caigua        Cañihua      Kiwicha      Lúcuma

Maca        Mashua       Oca       Pajuro       Pallar

Papaya       Quinoa       Sacha Inchi

Sanky       Tarwi       Yacón

The Healing Land will show you why it is so important to preserve these crops and increase their use in the diets of people  everywhere. 


We need your help to finish this film:

$75,000  will complete the research and filming

$125,000 will also complete production and editing

$155,000  will enable the film’s completion as well as its distribution and promotion, ensuring that it reaches the necessary audiences 

Please share this campaign with anyone and everyone!!
To visit our website, go to
 Hatun Phajcha, THE HEALING LAND
story_txt:
Seeking funding to finish making a documentary film about Peruvian “super foods” (you can visit the photo gallery to learn about a few of them!)
Hatun Phajcha, The
Healing Land is a documentary from award-winning Peruvian filmmaker
Delia Ackerman—a film that seeks to inform the public as well as influence policy. Help bring
this movie to completion so that the world can learn about the remarkable
properties of nutrient-rich foods that have been cultivated for centuries in
Peru. By supporting this film and sharing its message, you will 



Increase public awareness and access to
better nutrition


Help support the work of farmers and
scientists  who are preserving,
propagating, promoting and studying ancient Peruvian crops that are in danger of being lost.


Remind policy makers of the importance of
these native foods as a national resource to develop and safeguard.



Making healthier
food options available to every kitchen and raising awareness among policy
makers will help reverse some of the most serious global
health problems. 
MALNUTRITION
So much of Peru’s
ancestral knowledge has been devalued and lost since the colonization of the country that, even in Peru,
nutritious crops are often not valued and many children grow up seriously
undernourished. In other parts of the world the situation is even worse.
According to data from UNICEF, WHO (the World Health Organization) and FAO (the
Food  and Agriculture Organization of the
United Nations, HALF THE PEOPLE ON THE PLANET TODAY ARE MALNOURISHED.  Every year, an estimated 3.1 million children
under five die, and 161 million are irreversibly stunted physically and mentally
because of chronic malnutrition.  Yet
even in the most marginalized populations, when good nutrition is supported by
access to  water, sanitation,  education and financial security, entire
communities are transformed.
LIMITED RESOURCES
/ UNDERUTILIZED RESOURCES
Our global food
system is overburdened and many fear it will become even more so with the
impact of climate change and rapid population growth.  It is time to take advantage of the potential
to be found in lesser known foods that have high concentrations of nutrients.
Often referred to as superfoods or power foods, these products can have an
important impact once they become better known and more available. 
YOUR SUPPORT WILL
HELP SPREAD THE WORD
The Healing Land showcases
the cultivation and uses of various traditional crops domesticated in pre-Columbian
Perú, and also features the people who work with them. You will meet
hardworking farmers, committed “guardians” of many species, dedicated
scientists, creative chefs and nutritionists, and enthusiastic entrepreneurs.
We will take you with us through the
culturally and biologically diverse regions of this amazing country as we
highlight the remarkable health benefits and nutritional value of products that
are often unknown or overlooked.

discover more about foods like: 

Aguaje     Aguaymanto      Ahipa



Aji      Algarrobo       Arracacha      Asai     Cacao

Camu Camu       Caigua        Cañihua      Kiwicha      Lúcuma
Maca        Mashua       Oca       Pajuro       Pallar
Papaya       Quinoa       Sacha
Inchi
Sanky       Tarwi       Yacón


The Healing Land will show you why it is
so important to preserve these crops and increase their use in the diets of
people  everywhere. 

We need your help to finish
this film:
$75,000  will complete the research and
filming
$125,000 will also complete
production and editing
$155,000  will enable the
film’s completion as well as its distribution and promotion, ensuring that it
reaches the necessary audiences  


Please share this campaign with anyone and everyone!!To visit our website, go to  Hatun Phajcha, THE HEALING LAND

story:
One of the best sub genres of horror out there, in my opinion, is the slasher film. You know, like Friday the 13th, Nightmare on Elm Street, Prom Night etc... This is the kind of movie I intend to make, but the genre has been a bit overplayed and it's hard to find a way to make an original slasher film nowadays. I think that I have an idea that will turn the genre on it's head and show people a fresh take. I want to make a film completely from the slasher's point of view.

In The Cameraman, the cameraman will be the killer. The movie will be about a horror movie fan that convinces his friends to make a film about killing them off in a cabin in the woods, but what the friends think are going to be fake death scenes turn into real death scenes.

Most of, if not all of the movie will be told from the first person perspective of the main character/ killer. The film will feel very realistic, as a lot of it will be real and improved.

The suspense will lie in whether the cameraman is actually going to kill his friends or if he is just going to make a movie about it. As the cameraman becomes more and more obsessed with making a good horror movie, it becomes more likely that he will kill his friends off.

So far I have a cast and camera and next to no budget. I would love to make this the best movie it can be, so I need some money for good equipment, a cabin to stay in, and to pay my cast and crew. I feel that with the appropriate funds I could make a movie that has the potential to change the slasher genre and give the world a horror movie it's never seen before! Original horror films are few and far between, but with a little bit of funding I think I can make one!

I did go to college for Media and Film, so I have some background to make this work. I promise that you're not just funding an idiot with a camera. I also have a very dedicated cast and crew ready to make this happen!

$10,000 is my goal for this campaign, I feel that amount will be enough to make this a great movie. The basics of the film don't require a huge budget, so any money will help, and if you can't contribute money, just get the word out!

story:
Short Summary

Joy Over Money Productions, just as it sounds, is a media company focused on bringing the JOY out of the creation process of each production! Armed with an unlimited imagination and skill to match, funding is usually the one obstacle in the way of bringing magical entertainment to you!

 

WHITE AS SNOW is the next project that is facing that obstacle! Yes, we get pretty creative in making things happen on whatever budget (or lack thereof) that is available. Some things however are necessary! We have actors driving 3+ hours to get to set everyday. We have special wardrobe needed to create a believable world for you to immerse yourself into. The point is funding will allow us the best tools available to paint a vivid picture for you to get lost in right until the credits hit the screen!

What We Need & What You Get

We need $2000:

  • A period piece such as this story based on the Snow White-verse needs some wardrobe to match the ideas. So a lot of the money is going to props, clothes, and FEEDING our talent! (Don't want them passing out on set after their 3hr drives!)
  • OUR RELEASE DATE is set for HALLOWEEN! This means we have a short time to get everything together, but you get INSTANT GRATIFICATION on your investment! The fruits of your labor are waiting RIGHT ROUND THE CORNER!
  • Even if we don't get the FULL amount, we are still going to allocate the funds as best as possible towards making this as BELIEVABLE as possible! The team is ready to complete the project and the funds are the last piece of the puzzle needed.

The Impact

We watch and complain regularly how Hollywood have a knack of underwhelming us on interpretations of our favorite stories. We rarely do anything about it, go out and make our own. We aim to be different. You can help us realize this!

  • HELP anyway you can! Contribute, SHARE it Forward, and watch the completed piece.
  • The release of "BEHIND HER SMILE" (another Joy Over Money Production) will mark the beginning of production for "White As Snow"! This means we have the creative ideas on the shelf ready to be brought to life! Expect a consistent flow of entertainment heading your way.

Risks & Challenges

WE have a couple weeks to get this funding to start on schedule and even then we have but a moment to shoot AND edit to release in time for Halloween! JOM Production works well under pressure. We truly have JOY for our craft and so we're able to capitalize on a intense work flow without stress quitting on projects!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this project. Then ask your friends to do the same. Support a creative team that is simply trying to provide some real entertainment (dropping deep messages here and there!)
  • You can contribute one time on indiegogo to help THIS SPECIFIC project come to light OR you can join our PATREON members...pick a number, ANY number, contribute monthly to keep us making beautiful content for you regularly! EITHER support method is welcome! OUR PATREON monthly supporters get access to exclusive content and EARLY releases amongst other perks!

And that's all there is to it! Let's GO!

story:
If you haven't already, folks, meet Steven Lockmoore. I need your help to get Steven Lockmoore to Texas.

Hi! I’m the producer of Busking Turf Wars, a zero-budget indie comedy documentary about a street musician called Steven from my hometown of Leeds, northern England. As you may have seen from the video above, we recently had some good news about our film: we have had our first acceptance to screen Busking Turf Wars at a film festival... and it's in the USA! And we DESPERATELY want Steven Lockmoore to be there in attendance with us!

(Not familiar with the film? Check out the trailer here before reading on!)

The Thin Line Film Festival is in Fort Worth, just outside of Dallas, Texas, meaning that our Official Premiere screening of Busking Turf Wars is going to be Stateside! Thin Line are even hosting their own version of a ‘Busking Turf War’, inviting musicians from across the city to ‘Busk Off’ in their city square! Check out the event, and here's Steven's introduction to the FIRST EVER Denton Busking Turf War!

Given that Thin Line Film Festival is going to be our Official Festival Premiere, AAAAND given that they are hosting an event in honour of our film, we thought that it’s only right that we send Steven Lockmoore out to there to join them and officiate over proceedings! I mean, who could know the rules of a Competitive Busk Off better than Steven, right?!

But we need your help.

When we set out to make this film, we had nothing. There was a crew of 6 of us with no more than the loose change in our pockets, but we managed to make it. Remarkably, through the generosity of family and friends, we were able to successfully raise the finances needed to submit to film festivals. And I cannot thank those of you enough who have already supported our cause. You have helped carry us forward to this next step.

For many of the team - including myself, the director Peter, and co-writer Christy - Busking Turf Wars is our first feature film, and the first time we have EVER had a film of ours screen at a festival. But not in our wildest dreams did we envisage it playing in theatres in the States! It’s a great opportunity to meet U.S. distributors in an attempt to sell our film. It’s our Official Premiere and will be supported by a live event in our honour. It’s a once in a lifetime opportunity for us, and one certainly not to be missed. And we know that Steven Lockmoore will be able to bring something to Texas that it has scarcely seen before: the Yorkshire charm of a Leeds busker!

Please help us bring him there!

Unfortunately, we don’t have a great deal to incentivise you with, since we had nothing to begin with! We are, for the most part, appealing to your kind heart and generosity, rather than your desire to gain something in return. But for those of you looking for a small keepsake from Busking Turf Wars, we do have a couple of rewards packages you might be interested in… Don't think of it as buying the item; think of it as a charitable donation with an added bonus! Here's a brief overview of what we have in store:

£5 - A digital pat on the back!

£10 - Busking Turf Wars Fan Page Special Thanks Shout Out!

£15 - A personalised couplet sang to you by Steven Lockmoore via WhatsApp

£20 - Busking Turf Wars Official Poster & 2 x Busking Turf Wars stickers, and Busking Turf Wars badge

£40 - Framed Poster signed by Director, Producer & Star of the film

£50 - Busking Turf Wars T-shirt, in addition to Busking Turf Wars Official Poster (unframed/unsigned) & 2 x Busking Turf Wars stickers, and Busking Turf Wars badge (limited available; please check size availability with us)

£75 - Framed/Signed Poster & T-Shirt Combo, in addition to 2 x Busking Turf Wars stickers, and Busking Turf Wars badge (limited available; please check size availability with us)

£150 - PERSONALISED SONG BY STEVEN LOCKMOORE + Framed/Signed Poster & T-Shirt Combo, in addition to 2 x Busking Turf Wars stickers, and Busking Turf Wars badge (limited available; please check size availability with us)

Please check the individual perks for more details.

TARGET: £1000

If you've stuck with this blurb for this long but haven't yet decided to click donate, how about this:

Steven Lockmoore represents the best of us - he is a man in search of his dreams, and driven by his passion. He strives on a daily basis to use his talents to bring joy and happiness into the world. We aim to do the same, and through your generosity here today, RIGHT NOW, you can support us doing that. You can help us live our dreams.

On behalf of Steven Lockmoore, and all the Busking Turf Wars team, THANK YOU for your generosity and I look forward to hearing from you soon!

Sincerely,

Mark Trifunovic

Producer, Busking Turf Wars

He strives on a daily basis to use his talents to bring joy and happiness into the world. We aim to do the same, and through your generosity here today, RIGHT NOW, you can support us doing that. story:
Short Summary

"From Ruins" is a short noir-inspired drama produced by a crew from The European Film College in Denmark. The shooting will take place in Esbejrg, Denmark where the producer is from. 

Staggering through life in a misty daze of suppressed grief, Nestor, a somber and subdued 50-year-old psychologist, struggles to come to terms with the recent death of his wife. 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to make this film we need 5000 dkk (750 USD). The money will go towards the following: 

  • Transportation for crew and cast. The cast is being brought in from all over Denmark and the entire crew lives in Ebeltoft, Denmark. 
  • Food for crew and cast. The shoot will be taking place over the span of three days and in this time the cast and crew will need to eat some food in order to be able to work. 
  • Printing books. A very prominently featured prop in the film is a book written by the main character. We will need to print some copies of this book and they will be available as a perk for donating to the project. 
  • Blankets. The crew is going to sleep on air-matresses all around Esbjerg. These air-matresses are being sponsored by Harald Nyborg A/S but we will need to buy blankets for the crew to sleep with. 

There is a list of perks that you will get if you decide to help fund our film. What you get depends on how much you help.

  • 5 USD - you get your name in the credits and a link to watch the film when it is finished. 
  • 20 USD - you get your name in the credits as an executive producer and a link to watch the film when it is finished. 
  • 25 USD - you get a copy of the book "From Ruins" signed by the crew. You also get your name in the credits as an executive producer and a link to watch the film when it is finished. 
  • 50 USD - you get a personalized thank-you video from the crew behind the film, your name in the credits as an executive producer and a link to watch the film when it is finished. 
  • 100 USD - FOR COMPANYS - get your company logo in the credits of the film, an executive producer credit in the film and a link to watch the film when it is finished.  
Feel free to share the campaign if you are not able to donate any money yourself.

story:
Versión en Español:
Sinopsis:

"Chatarra" es una historia original de suspenso que cuenta la historia de un niño secuestrado al nacer durante el robo de un auto. Contada desde su perspectiva doce años después, se buscará mediante un lenguaje cinematográfico comunicar la necesidad de libertad y los obstáculos que se oponen para alcanzarla.

El propósito de nuestra campaña es poder retomar nuestra filmación, hacer re-shoots ya que se pospuso por las condiciones climatológicas y términar la post producción.
  • Lograremos con tu ayuda cubrir gastos de producción, locación, equipo técnico, transportación, musicalización y gastos para la presentación  del proyecto en futuros festivales. 


 Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes:
  • El dinero se recaudado se dividira de la siguiente manera:
  1. Producción : $2,000
  2. Comida : $850.00
  3. Locación : $2,000
  4. Equipo técnico ( truck ) : $1,000
  5. Transportación  : $1,250
  6. Post producción : $1,000
  7. Afiche : $400.00 
  • Si no se llega al total de todas maneras el dinero ayudara continuar la producción en algunas facetas importantes como comida, transportación y equipo técnico.


¿Por que es importante para el colaborador y el mundo? 
  • El colaborador esta ayudando mediante una pieza artística a  generar cultura y concientización de la sociedad.
  • Coviertete parte de nuestro proyecto  visitandonos y ayudandonos en el set de filmación. Además se pueden unir durante el proceso de post producción e ir a a la presentación de la premiere del cortometraje.


Riesgos y desafios:
  • El único riesgo y desafío que enfrentamos en esta producción es el clima ya que la locación esta hubicada en una zona montañosa. Tenemos un equipo preparado y paciente para sobrepasar estos obstaculos.


Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar:

story:
Sé parte de este equipo de trabajo, conviértete
                                     en un colaborador o colaboradora.
    Anyone could be part of this team and  become a partner or collaborator. 


Sobre el documental

Este documental es una mirada a la vigencia del mito de la aparición de Santiago en Loíza. El título Santiago de las Mujeres alude a una de las tres efigies del mismo Santiago Apóstol y es  quizás un pasaje anual de renovación que nos recuerda el carácter, la vitalidad y la función  de la mujer loiceña como pilar de la comunidad.

(English Version)

About the documentary


This documentary takes a look at the prevailing myth of the apparition of St James in the town of Loíza. The title Santiago de las Mujeres (James of the Women) alludes to one of the effigies of James the Apostle, perhaps a passage of annual renewal that reminds us of the character, vitality and role Loíza women have as pillars of the community.

 

Hilda Juana Pizarro y la imágen de Santiago de las Mujeres. Foto tomada  por Cheery Viruet.
Hilda Juana Pizarro and  the image of St. James of the Women. Photo  by Cheery Viruet.

Comentario de la directora

Santiago de las Mujeres nace de la inquietud por explorar temas relacionados a  la religiosidad popular loiceña con un medio que pueda documentar los escenarios reales donde conviven los que mantienen viva la tradición a Santiago Apóstol en Loíza. Sus personajes son gente sencilla con la que he crecido y he aprendido a valorar la riqueza cultural de mi región, la vitalidad y el entusiasmo de nuestra raíz afrocaribeña.

Ha sido muy interesante la observación de dichas tradiciones desde una perspectiva menos antropológica y más estética, para lograr extraer los elementos que están en el corazón del pueblo y forman parte de su esencia. He vivido y he disfrutado de las celebraciones a Santiago por más de 35 años. El cine en su forma documental como cine observacional, me permitirá documentar la fisicidad de lo cotidiano y la interioridad de la espiritualidad humana.

La propuesta narrativa en Santiago de las Mujeres juega a representar los límites entre lo documental y la ficción, proponiendo un discurso con el espectador accidentado y casual. Esta factura de la imagen por medio del montaje requiere relacionar secuencias muy cortas que el espectador, necesitará armar y generar en su mente un proceso embrionario en la que cada escena se encadena por causa y por casualidad de  la anterior. El diálogo con la cámara es el vehículo  para armar la estructura del documental, tras el mundo proyectado de los personajes. De esta manera, con sus elementos espaciales y textuales, este documental quiere revelar algo de la fusión social y cultural de estos ritos. Traza paralelismos entre las historias de sus personajes, su devoción a Santiago Apóstol y de su imaginario en la vida actual loiceña. 


(English Version)

Director Commentary

Santiago de las Mujeres (James of the Women) was born out of the interest to explore themes related to the popular religious beliefs of Loíza’s people in a medium that could document the actual scenarios where those who keep the tradition in honor to Santiago of Loíza live. The characters in the documentary are humble people with whom I have lived and learned to value the cultural richness of my region, along with the vitality, and the enthusiasm of our Afro Caribbean roots.

It has been very interesting to observe said traditions from an aesthetical perspective rather than an anthropological one, in order to extract the elements grounded in the people and which make up their essence. I have lived and enjoyed the festivities in honor of Santiago for over 35 years. Filming in a documentary format as well as in an observational one will allow me to document the physicality of everyday life and the interior nature of human spirituality.

The narrative proposed in Santiago de las Mujeres attempts to represent the limits between fiction and documentary, and proposing a dialogue with the accidental, casual spectator. The making of these images by means of montage requires relating very short sequences that each spectator will have to put together and recreate in his/her mind—an embryonic process in which each scene will lead to the next by cause and effect and causality of the previous one.

The dialogue with the camera is the vehicle to put together the documentary’s structure, laying behind the projected world of the characters. Thus, with its spatial and textual elements, this documentary wants to reveal something about the social and cultural fusion of these rites. It also attempts to trace parallelisms between the characters’ stories, their devotion to James the Apostle, and its imaginary in the present life of the Loíza people.

Estructura frente a la carretera 187 en la comunidad "Los Pizarro", Loíza. Foto  por Idalise Delgado.

Structure nearly  Road 187 in the community "Los Pizarro" Loíza. Photo by Idalise Delgado.

Apoyo e Impacto

Un documental por su fuerza visual, forma parte de nuestra memoria e influye en como nosotros y las futuras generaciones entienden y valoran nuestra “realidad”.  Santiago de las Mujeres  permitirá reflexionar sobre la aportación de la mujer loiceña como pilar de la comunidad, su espiritualidad y su esencia en el contexto de las celebraciones a Santiago Apóstol en Loíza. Con tu apoyo, estas ayudando a educar y preservar nuestros valores culturales.

Este proyecto no recibe ayuda de ninguna entidad desde que comenzó en el 2013, y ha llegado a financiar de forma independiente, más de la mitad del presupuesto total del proyecto (60 %). Este dato representa una seguridad para sus colaboradores, quienes aún pueden  apoyar  y convertir el proyecto en un largometraje documental. Un proyecto de esta magnitud y en proceso requiere de apoyo económico para asegurar calidad cinematográfica.

El documental se pondrá a disposición de  la comunidad loiceña y entidades educativas a través de diversas actividades de divulgación y difusión. Una de las metas es también lograr alcance nacional e internacional, presentándolo en festivales de cine y en las salas de cine del país.

El dinero recaudado se utilizará específicamente para finalizar la etapa de post-producción. Dicha etapa se estima en $12,000.00 dólares, desglosados de la siguiente forma:

Etapa de post-producción

Edición, corrección de color y coloración  -  $ 4,000.00

Diseño de audio, mezclas y masterización -  $ 3,500.00

Música original, composición, arreglos, mezclas y masterización -  $4,500.00


Otras formas de colaboración:

 

1.  Visita nuestra página web: santiagodelasmujeres.com y envíanos un mensaje para incluirte en nuestra lista de contactos e informarte de nuestras actividades y etapas del documental.

2.  Dale like a nuestra página en Facebook o síguenos en Twiter e Instagram.

3.  Comparte nuestras publicaciones con amigos y familiares. Automáticamente estarás participando de un sorteo por tus compartidos.


Ana Silvia y Santiago de las Mujeres. Foto por Idalise Delgado.

Ana Silvia and St. James of the Women. Photo  by Idalise Delgado.


(English version)

Support and Impact

A documentary by its visual strength, is part of our memories and it influences us and future generations in the understanding and appreciation of our  "reality". Santiago de las Mujeres (James of the Women) allow us to reflect on the contribution of the women of Loíza as pillar of their community.  The documentary also shows its spirituality and its essence in the context of the celebrations of Santiago Apostle in Loíza. With your support, you are helping to educate and preserve our cultural values.

This project does not receive support from any entity since it began in 2013, and has been financed independently in more than half of the total project budget (60%). This figure represents a security for its employees, who can still support and turn the project into a feature length documentary. A project of this magnitude and ongoing production requires financial support to ensure quality.

The documentary will be made available to the loiceña community and various educational institutions through various outreach mechanisms and dissemination efforts. One of the goals is also to achieve national and international levels and to present it in international film festivals and in theaters around the Island and the USA.

The money raised will be used specifically to finish the post-production stage. This stage is estimated at $ 12,000.00, broken down as follows:

Stage post-production

Editing, color correction and color - $ 4,000.00

Design audio, mixing and mastering - $ 3,500.00

Original music, composition, arranging, mixing and mastering - $ 4,500.00

Other forms of cooperation:

  1. Visit our website: santiagodelasmujeres.com and send a message for inclusion in our mailing list and to send information about our activities and stages of documentary publications.
  2. Give a like on our page on Facebook or follow us on Twiter and Instagram.
  3. Share our publications with family and friends. Automatically you will be participating a sweepstakes for your shared.


También puedes odenar nuestra bolsa ecológica por sólo $3.75.  Envíanos un mensaje a través de nuestra página web: santiagodelasmujeres.com y haz tu donativo por ATH-Móvil.

You can also order our Eco-bags for only $ 3.75. Write  a message in our website: santiagodelasmujeres.com and use ATH- Mobile for the  donation.

Vamos apoyar el cine documental en Puerto Rico.

Their contribution will support the incipient documentary film industry in Puerto Rico. 

Traducción del Teaser-Trailer por Yaniré Díaz
Translation Teaser Trailer by Yaniré Díaz

story:
Joaninha is a strong, independent, career oriented young woman on the rise until she finds out she has breast cancer. Her strength & courage are put to the test as she goes through chemo therapy. She loses all hope until she's reacquainted with Lucinda, a childhood friend and love interest. Lucinda is unhappily married to a good man, living her mother's lie. Lucinda's mother (Mama) forbade her from seeing Joaninha, suspecting that their relationship was becoming more than just an innocent friendship. Mama force feeds Lucinda her religious views and traditional customs until she becomes nothing more than puppet. Joaninha and Lucinda find hope in each other as they rekindle their "Friendship". They attempt to overcome all obstacles in their path to being together.

 

All proceeds from this fundraising campaign will go towards the production of the film which includes: equipment, props, transportation, wardrobe & make up, location fees, etc...

story:
The Summary

It's What Dad Would Have Wanted. is a film about hitting rock bottom and finding a way to get back up again featuring award winning comic book artist, and my father,  the late Ric Estrada.
My dad's friends used to call him the Cuban Forest Gump- he's sort of been everywhere, met the most amazing people, and the had craziest experiences- but most of his friends don't even know the half of it! Ric's story is hard to believe, yet amazingly true.
And for me, personally, this film is much more than a simple collection of zany stories- I'm unravelling the mystery of who my dad really was and what possessed him to make some of the odd choices he did. 
I need your help to finish making this film.

The Need [What, Where, When]

  • We have a limited window to complete production in Cuba, as the US appears to be loosening the trade restrictions there- that means that the Cuba my dad knew as a child, will probably disappear forever. We feel it's important to shoot there and complete the film this year [2016]. 
  • We need $30k to go to Cuba and do one last major shoot, edit the film, add some animation, and enter it into festivals. 
  • Every dollar counts- check out the rewards to this side. The top tier is for an executive producer credit, and includes a spot on our team in Havana when we shoot.
  • We are going to continue production even if we don't hit the total funding goal: Again, we've got to shoot in Havana before American investors start making changes to it.
The Impact [Why]
  • Anyone who loves comic books will appreciate the humanity that Ric's story gives to the creators of our favorite characters and heroes. While he was alive, Ric inspired hundreds of young people to develop themselves artistically. Your support will help Ric to continue to inspire new artists to invest in themselves and take the right kinds of risks that will give us new heroes. 
  • Also, you could be listed as an associate or executive producer on IMDb. Read the fine print and check all the rewards over at IndieGoGo.
The Process [How]
  • American Splendor meets My Architect. 
  • Primarily live action, with some interviews, some locations, some animated elements/sequences, and plenty of discovery and snark.

The Qualifications [Who]

  • While working at Dreamworks Animation, I completed over a dozen internal video projects with high technical standards, and firm deadlines. I have shot, logged, and archived and kept the footage from this project for 10 years now.
  • Oscar-nominated director Christian Jensen is also on board. He is based in the San Francisco area but will rendezvous with me in Havana, Cuba. 
  • Cinnafilm, an award winning digital film engineering company, has offered to do some cool stuff for us so the film will be ready for the big screen- it is going to look great at film festivals!

We are committed to seeing the last leg of production through to the end: Whether or not a finished film is edited and submitted to film festivals is now up to you, our backers.

The Challenges

We have the right team, and the right schedule: Havana will be in the off-season for tourism, and also the non-hurricane season [PHEW!] so it will be easy to get there and get what we need, without interference from tourists and tropical storms.
No one is being reimbursed for the time they've already worked on this film. It's just water under the bridge. But we do need to pay a few key individuals moving forward: a producer in Havana, a producer for any remaining US shoots, an editor, and an animator. 
The biggest challenge is simply funding the film: we are actively applying for grants, and have already invested quite a bit of personal resources and time into producing the film up to this point. 

The Other Ways To Help

  1. Share this campaign on social media. 
  2. Send an email to as many of your friends, coworkers, and family as you think may have an interest!
story_txt:
The Summary 
 It's What Dad Would Have Wanted. is a film about hitting rock bottom and finding a way to get back up again featuring award winning comic book artist, and my father,  the late Ric Estrada.
My dad's friends used to call him the Cuban Forest Gump- he's sort of been everywhere, met the most amazing people, and the had craziest experiences- but most of his friends don't even know the half of it! Ric's story is hard to believe, yet amazingly true.And for me, personally, this film is much more than a simple collection of zany stories- I'm unravelling the mystery of who my dad really was and what possessed him to make some of the odd choices he did. 
I need your help to finish making this film.


The Need [What, Where, When]
 

We have a limited window to complete production in Cuba, as the US appears to be loosening the trade restrictions there- that means that the Cuba my dad knew as a child, will probably disappear forever. We feel it's important to shoot there and complete the film this year [2016]. 

We need $30k to go to Cuba and do one last major shoot, edit the film, add some animation, and enter it into festivals. 

Every dollar counts- check out the rewards to this side. The top tier is for an executive producer credit, and includes a spot on our team in Havana when we shoot.


We are going to continue production even if we don't hit the total funding goal: Again, we've got to shoot in Havana before American investors start making changes to it.


The Impact [Why]
 
Anyone who loves comic books will appreciate the humanity that Ric's story gives to the creators of our favorite characters and heroes. While he was alive, Ric inspired hundreds of young people to develop themselves artistically. Your support will help Ric to continue to inspire new artists to invest in themselves and take the right kinds of risks that will give us new heroes. 
Also, you could be listed as an associate or executive producer on IMDb. Read the fine print and check all the rewards over at IndieGoGo.

The Process [How]

American Splendor meets My Architect. 


Primarily live action, with some interviews, some locations, some animated elements/sequences, and plenty of discovery and snark.


The Qualifications [Who]

Oscar-nominated director Christian Jensen is also on board. He is based in the San Francisco area but will rendezvous with me in Havana, Cuba. 
Cinnafilm, an award winning digital film engineering company, has offered to do some cool stuff for us so the film will be ready for the big screen- it is going to look great at film festivals!

No one is being reimbursed for the time they've already worked on this film. It's just water under the bridge. But we do need to pay a few key individuals moving forward: a producer in Havana, a producer for any remaining US shoots, an editor, and an animator. 

The biggest challenge is simply funding the film: we are actively applying for grants, and have already invested quite a bit of personal resources and time into producing the film up to this point.    The Other Ways To Help 

Share this campaign on social media.

story:
• PAUL

Pour comprendre ce film et ce projet, il faut avant tout savoir qui est Paul.

A 12 ans, Paul est atteint d’une maladie de sang rare: l’aplasie médullaire sous une forme sévère.

La moelle osseuse, cette machine qui fabrique le sang est tombée en panne. Après des mois de traitements et de transfusions, la seule chance pour Paul et de tenter une greffe et pour cela trouver un donneur de moelle osseuse compatible.

En janvier 2014, en Allemagne un jeune homme de 26 ans qui était inscrit sur les registres de donneurs va faire ce don encore trop méconnu et ainsi sauver la vie de Paul.

  • LE FILM

Le scénario du film « Les Veilleurs »  a été pensé et écrit par Paul, il en sera également son réalisateur.

Ce projet a pour but de soutenir et d’encadrer Paul dans sa démarche, tout en réalisant un film de qualité. Il sera accompagné lors des diverses étapes de production (nowfuture & Di Rosa Films), ainsi que toute une équipe de professionnels de l’audiovisuel, tous très touchés par la cause:

Le réalisateur Luccio Di Rosa 

Le caméraman Lorenzo Donati qui travaille avec Luc Besson.

Le comédien  Eriq Ebouaney : Femme fatale (Brian de Palma), Kingdom of Heaven (Ridley Scott), Transporteur 3.

Le Comédien David Mora: scène de ménage (M6)

«Les Veilleurs» sera également un support pédagogique destiné aux écoles, aux associations qui œuvre pour le don de sang et de moelle, favorisant ainsi le débat sur le sujet auprès de tous les publics.

Ce film de sensibilisation plein de vie et d’humanité, a pour vocation d’apporter l’espoir et de protéger la vie, et de faire du don de moelle, l’affaire de tous.


  • LE SYNOPSIS

La porte d'une chambre s'ouvre. A l'intérieur de cette chambre, on découvre un jardin ensoleillé. Des gens y dansent joyeusement. Au milieu d'eux, un jeune homme d'une trentaine d'années  qui souffle l'unique bougie d'un gâteau d'anniversaire. Il a reçu une greffe de moelle osseuse il y a tout juste un an...
