story:
New Perk! 

Get a custom portrait of yourself (or a friend) as a PMAS astronaut on Mars - only $10!

 

We are an international team of passionate students and young professionals in space-related fields. We come from different backgrounds, cultures, and nations.

Mars is at the top of humanity's list of destinations to explore. We want to take part in the wonderful journey to Mars! We believe Earth can be a proving ground for future Mars missions, and that is why we are organizing PMAS 2017. By researching issues relevant to deep-space travel - including the challenges of time-delayed communication, the psychological effects of isolation, and the logistics of living and working on Mars - we will contribute to the long-term goal of sending human beings to Mars. Even if we won't be able to get to go to Mars in our lifetimes, we will help pave the way for future generations of space explorers!

Have you ever dreamt of being an astronaut - or even being the first human to step onto the surface of another planet? Becoming an astronaut is hard, but getting involved in human space exploration is easy - you can start by supporting this mission!

By supporting PMAS, you are supporting humanity's long-term goal of exploring and settling on the Moon and Mars. 

Space Exploration allows us to explore something bigger than ourselves. It's an extension to human curiosity; our last frontier. When we first went to space, we did that to test the limits of the human spirit. It's the ultimate challenge that all humans are collaborating, not competing, to overcome. The huge technological advancement in space led to a paradigm shift... Humans are not going to space just to explore anymore, they are going to settle on other planets. That's the goal we all yearn to achieve.

The first step to do this is to train and test long-term mission operations and scientific exploration under realistic conditions within an analogue mission on Earth! And that's what PMAS is all about. 

This mission will be a serious scientific enterprise whose results will feed directly into the planning and design of future missions to Mars. Who doesn’t want to support that?

Plus, we are offering tons of great perks if you donate $5 or more!

What makes PMAS 2017 different:

  • The Modular Analogue Research Station (M.A.R.S.), which will house PMAS Analogue astronauts is built by Spacegarden Company, a prestigious research organisation in Poland. 
  • The Poland Mars Analogue Simulation (PMAS) is a two weeks isolation mission, whereof the first 3 days will be a lunar simulation and the remaining 11 days will be a Martian one. Main difference therein is the time delay in the communications of around 15 minutes. 
  • The PMAS team  is an international, multicultural and interdisciplinary team of students and young professionals.
  • Mission Support Centre will be located at the offices of ABM Space, a distinguished space company, in Torun, which - as the birthplace of the famous astronomer Nicolaus Copernicus - has a long and proud tradition in astronomy.  
  • PMAS research will address some of the crucial aspects of deep-space expeditions.
  • The Mission is organized by the Space Exploration Project Group (SEPG), a sub-group of the Space Generation Advisory Council (SGAC) in support of the United Nations Programme on Space Applications. 
  • PMAS will conduct a realistic simulation with all aspects of a real Moon/Mars mission, including complete isolation and time-delayed communications. 
  • PMAS will involve and engage the public in space exploration through space outreach activities across the world. Outreach activities include educating younger generations about Space using various media, organizing workshops/events, hosting student competitions, and filming a documentary.

 

Your contributions will help us to:

  • Increase interest in space exploration among a broad range of people across the world.
  • Research strategies to send people back to the Moon, and put people on the red planet and allow them to work and live safely, efficiently, and sustainably.
  • Share our results and discoveries with the scientific community and the public.
  • Support international, multicultural, and interdisciplinary collaboration in space exploration.
  • Engage younger generations with space exploration and related disciplines.
  • Showcase ESA’s plans to establish a Moon base.
  • Explain why Mars is the most suitable destination to search for life in the Solar System to a broad range of audiences around the world.

 

PMAS 2017, organized by the Space Exploration Project Group of the Space Generation Advisory Council, will be a realistic human space exploration simulation mission. During the 2-week mission, our crew of 6 analogue astronauts will conduct scientific research and record their experiences while living in the M.A.R.S. Laboratory in southern Poland. They will be fully isolated from the outside world, apart from communications with the Mission Support Team, located in the offices of ABM Space in Torun, Poland. All communications between the Mission Support Center and astronauts will be via time-delayed channels to simulate the long distance between the Earth and Mars. The experience & knowledge gained from this mission will help lay the groundwork for the first human expedition to Mars.

(Visualization of the landing site and the M.A.R.S. Laboratory in which PMAS 2017 astronauts will stay during the mission. Credit: M.A.R.S. Project/Space Is More/Jan Popowski)

M.A.R.S. is a modular combined laboratory and living space for up to 6 astronauts. It will contain a biological laboratory, where plant growth on Lunar and Martian soil simulants under the adequate lighting can be studied. An algae reactor will recycle organic material into fresh bio mass, which can be used as food supplement. A chemical laboratory will allow to analyse rock and soil samples taking on the astronauts' EVAs (Extra Vehicular Activity). A workshop will allow us to test, maintain, and adapt hardware equipment, which can be rovers or other robotic support units. In the future, it is foreseen to make this laboratory hermetical isolated and entirely self-sufficient as a real station on Moon or Mars would have to be.

Video footage from the mission will be used to produce a comprehensive and engaging documentary about human space exploration.

(Analog astronauts doing a night EVA during the first mission at the M.A.R.S. Laboratory. Credit:  Mariusz Słonina)

In addition, in accordance with ESA's plans to go to the Moon first and then to Mars, we will have a 3-day Lunar Simulation prior to PMAS 2017 in partnership with ESA. During the Lunar Simulation, communication will be real-time or near real-time, the analogue astronaut schedule will be in "Lunar Mode," and EVAs will mostly take place at night.

Our PMAS 2017 team consists of some of the brightest young minds in space-related disciplines from around the world. Our Astronaut Crew and our Flight Support Team will attend multiple workshops in partnership with ESA at ESTEC prior to the mission. This will ensure that we thoroughly understand all relevant aspects of space exploration mission planning and operations.

There have been many analog missions conducted so far, but PMAS 2017 will be remarkable in many ways: in its internationalism, its strong emphasis on outreach, and in the wide range of scientific research that it will include. Help us make this mission a reality!

PMAS research areas include the evaluation of the performance of astronauts conducting geologic fieldwork under harsh conditions limited by bulky space suits, applications of technologies to support human activities on a planetary surface, controlled investigations and experiments in psychology and human factors, studies of plant growth on Martian soil simulants, and astronomical studies.

The PMAS 2017 team is a passionate and incredibly international group of volunteers. We are students and young professionals from 6 continents and more than 30 countries, united by the dream of space exploration.

Check out this map of all the countries we come from (in orange)!

Meet the PMAS 2017 Team

     

     

    The Daily Cosmos

    Spaceflight Insider

     

     

     

    You might not be able to contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help! Here are other ways you can help us:

    • Get the word out and make some noise about the PMAS 2017 Indiegogo campaign!
    • Share this with your friends and with your friends of friends!

    • Participate in our Referral Contest!

    And that's all there is to it.

    PMAS 2017… Advancing Space Science!

    #PMAS17

    Ad Astra!

story:
Visit the Official "Running With Violet" WEBSITE!

Meet the Creators/Stars Rebecca Davey and Marie-Claire Marcotte

 

Women in Film Interviews: First Assistant Director Emma Malm

Comedian Michelle Shaughnessy and Running With Violet First Assistant Director Emma Malm discuss why we need unique perspectives in film, what drew her to the Running With Violet script and what it means to be the "mean mom" on set.

Women in Film Interviews: Composer and Sound Supervisor Michelle Irving
 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s6bnBf0cZ_0&feature=youtu.be
 

Running With Violet Composer and Sound Supervisor Michelle Irving and Comedian Michelle Shaughnessy discuss Greek folk music, High School radio shows, music producing vs. songwriting and the real purpose of a great film score.


Women in Film Interviews: Director Lindsay MacKay

Running With Violet  and Wet Bum  Director Lindsay MacKay and Comedian Michelle Shaughnessy discuss Super 8mm film, film school fear, and those pesky English teachers that end up changing your life for the better.

Partying For Violet Video

Join us on Saturday, November 5 at Propeller Coffee at 8 pm to booze and schmooze with filmmakers and friends from Toronto and beyond. Buy your ticket at the door for $15 or donate to our campaign for a complimentary pass into the party.

FB Event: https://www.facebook.com/events/895926520551843/


 

RUNNING WITH VIOLET is a 10 episode action packed Digital Series about two women, a teenager and a toddler who try to ditch their small town for an open road of adventure but soon get entangled in a meth ring. We like to call this show Thelma and Louise meets Fargo. Intrigued?

(below: sample page from our 'BE THE ZEN MASTER' adult colouring book perk) 


RUNNING WITH VIOLET tells the story of Jolene, a single mother longing for adventure and independence away from her constraining small town and family life, and her best friend Miranda, a closeted and repressed housewife yearning to express who she is beyond her imposing husband. Hoping to escape their little town, Jolene and Miranda take their deepest fantasies on the road on an unforgettable girls weekend -- turned bloody, treacherous drug deal.  Did we mention that Jolene brought her toddler Violet with her?


Along the way, Jolene, Miranda, and little Violet pick up Frankie, a larger-than-life teen who never fails to speak her mind, and run into countless unpredictable characters. Real cops, fake cops, undercover cops, bad guys, good guys, good guys posing as bad guys, longing ex-husbands, creepy current husbands, pushy Norwegian environmentalists, meth dealing grandmas, biker chicks who bake killer pies,  curious nuns, and more sweep Jolene, Miranda, Frankie and Violet on a "girls weekend" beyond their wildest imaginations. Ultimately, our women must decide if they're going to give up who they thought they were - defined by the small town repression, the familial responsibilities, the patriarchal expectations - for who they were meant to be: Women who decide their own fate.

RUNNING WITH VIOLET is a story that is at times violent, always adventurous, and very often romantic. Expect to be holding your breath at the end of every episode.


WHO ARE WE?

We are Rebecca Davey and Marie-Claire Marcotte, the leads of the show and founders of the production company SHE SAID FILMS. We have been creating together for ten years. We have big dreams for our company, each other, young girls who follow our lead...and the world!  She Said Films creates content for TV, Film and the Digital Space with strong women in our stories and behind the camera. We like how they say it over at Tello Films:  “we advocate for women (mostly) who are allies, mothers, daughters, bosses, explorers, dreamers, doers, go-getters, go-get-hers, lesbian, bi, undecided, complex and fluid.”

 

THEMES!

One of the important themes of the show is women breaking free— can a woman/person break free, what happens when they try—not to mention when there’s a kid in the mix. Breaking free with a toddler is its own thing entirely.

 

IMPACT!

We want to bring the complex female experience to the screen. We have lots of aspects to us as women!! We are not just a device to complete the male story, right?! We are full and complete human beings with stories to tell all on our own. And times are changing and gender equality is on the agenda, but it takes time for real change to happen. Most of the content in today's media is still about men and being made by men. If you make a donation to Running With Violet you're supporting the proliferation of female content around the web. Phew!

 

WHY DO WE NEED YOUR MONEY?

We are 75% funded after winning a Canada wide competition. We need your support now to get to the finish line. Our remaining 25% will fund the really fun stuff!

******ACTION PACKED SPECIAL EFFECTS ******                                    

Typically women get asked to make ‘relationship’ movies and men get the superhero action packed adventures. We want to do both of those things in our series. The relationships are important but so is the action! But to bring you action we need a bigger budget. Our array of stunts will include:

  • car chase
  • combat
  • use of firearms
  • cop cars
  • gun wounds
  • special effects
  • blood

 

With this last 25% we could achieve the shots we dream of (example: get the cop car to make the wide shot realistic), hire a bigger production design team, invest a little bit more money in wardrobe, be able to hire all the background talent we need to sell the story--all the little things that add up to the quality of show we think you deserve!

 

OUR TEAM!

Rebecca Davey is a lead in the series as well as one of the creators. For the past two years she has taken films to the Cannes Film Festival along with Marie-Claire. In her spare time she works on her Masters of Creative Writing and takes care of her two daughters, one of whom will be appearing in Running With Violet. Rebecca is an avid eavesdropper – watch out!

 

Marie-Claire Marcotte is a lead in the series as well as one of the show creators. Her first web series ON THE HEATED FLOOR was an official selection at ITVfest and at the Raindance WebFest. She is also producing and acting in the feature film Pippa and the Bees written by Rebecca. She is originally from Saskatchewan and fluffy croissants make her really happy.

 

Lindsay MacKay is directing the series. She is a graduate of the prestigious American Film Institute. Her film Wet Bum premiered at the Toronto International Film Festival in 2014. She splits her time between LA and Toronto. She’s had two perms in her life. 

 

Jessii Vee has made a name for herself on her wildly successful YouTube channel which boasts over 650K subscribers. She is making her acting debut in Running With Violet! Did you know Jessii does her own graphics?

 

Violet is...well Violet. She is Rebecca’s daughter and super excited to be acting alongside Mama. She is full of smiles and lots of zany turns of phrase. We can't get enough of this 3-year-old!

 

Guy Godfree is the Director of Photography for the series. He is a member of the Canadian Society of Cinematographers. His most recent film Maudie premiered at Telluride and the Toronto International Film Festival and starred Sally Hawkins and Ethan Hawke. He’s originally from Nova Scotia and will charm any woman or man with his accent.

 

The multi-talented Michelle Irving is composing all the music for the series. She specializes in audio post-production including music composition, music editing, sound design & editing, foley, and mixing. She also DJs under the name dashussy. Michelle’s patterned ‘party pants’ make the whole “Running With Violet” team very happy.

SO HOW CAN YOU GET INVOLVED IN OUR CAMPAIGN?

  1. Donate a small amount.
  2. Donate a large amount.
  3. If donating is out of the question, then mentor a young girl instead as a nod to the underlying feminist themes in our show. Actively reach out and be a positive role model by showing a young girl how you take risks, sometimes fail, but always try again. This is what we try to model to Rebecca’s daughters and any young people we have encountered in our years of teaching theatre workshops.
  4. Subscribe to our YouTube Channel.
  5. Watch our show and spread the word!

 

CELEBRATE WOMEN IN FILM WITH US!

 

SOMETHING REALLY FUN!

Everyone who donates (and at any level!) is entered into a draw to WIN A ROUND TRIP FLIGHT to St. Petersburg, Florida. YOU could spend the day on set with us or spend all day at the beach!

 

 

 

 

OUR COLOURING BOOK 'BE THE ZEN MASTER' PERK!

Here are the four "Running With Violet" inspired original drawings that you can colour!

OUR JESSII VEE POSTER PERK! (PICK THE ONE YOU LIKE BEST!)

 

WHERE WILL YOU BE ABLE TO WATCH OUR SHOW? 

1. When we launch in February 2017, you can watch Running With Violet on our YouTube channel!
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCNfjNCJTNrOnIED3VZ5-PJQ

2. Revry (www.watch.revry.tv): the world’s FIRST LGBTQ Streaming Platform for Apple TV and Google Chromecast! On Revry, you can enjoy the Best QUEERATED Movies, TV, Digital Series, Music, Videos, Podcasts, and Music.

 

3. OML (onemorelesbian) YouTube Channel https://www.youtube.com/user/onemorelesbian
They curate the world’s lesbian film, television, and video content on one site. 

Thanks for reading and considering our campaign!
story_txt:
Visit the Official "Running With Violet" WEBSITE!
Meet the Creators/Stars Rebecca Davey and Marie-Claire Marcotte


 
Women in Film Interviews: First Assistant Director Emma Malm


Comedian Michelle Shaughnessy and Running With Violet First Assistant Director Emma Malm discuss why we need unique perspectives in film, what drew her to the Running With Violet script and what it means to be the "mean mom" on set.
Women in Film Interviews: Composer and Sound Supervisor Michelle Irving 


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s6bnBf0cZ_0&feature=youtu.be
 

Running With Violet Composer and Sound Supervisor Michelle Irving and Comedian Michelle Shaughnessy discuss Greek folk music, High School radio shows, music producing vs. songwriting and the real purpose of a great film score.
Women in Film Interviews: Director Lindsay MacKay

Running With Violet  and Wet Bum  Director Lindsay MacKay and Comedian Michelle Shaughnessy discuss Super 8mm film, film school fear, and those pesky English teachers that end up changing your life for the better.Partying For Violet Video
Join us on Saturday, November 5 at Propeller Coffee at 8 pm to booze and schmooze with filmmakers and friends from Toronto and beyond. Buy your ticket at the door for $15 or donate to our campaign for a complimentary pass into the party.FB Event: https://www.facebook.com/events/895926520551843/

 
RUNNING WITH VIOLET is a 10 episode action packed Digital Series about two women, a teenager and a toddler who try to ditch their small town for an open road of adventure but soon get entangled in a meth ring. We like to call this show Thelma and Louise meets Fargo. Intrigued?(below: sample page from our 'BE THE ZEN MASTER' adult colouring book perk) RUNNING WITH VIOLET tells the story of Jolene, a single mother longing for adventure and independence away from her constraining small town and family life, and her best friend Miranda, a closeted and repressed housewife yearning to express who she is beyond her imposing husband. Hoping to escape their little town, Jolene and Miranda take their deepest fantasies on the road on an unforgettable girls weekend -- turned bloody, treacherous drug deal.  Did we mention that Jolene brought her toddler Violet with her?Along the way, Jolene, Miranda, and little Violet pick up Frankie, a larger-than-life teen who never fails to speak her mind, and run into countless unpredictable characters. Real cops, fake cops, undercover cops, bad guys, good guys, good guys posing as bad guys, longing ex-husbands, creepy current husbands, pushy Norwegian environmentalists, meth dealing grandmas, biker chicks who bake killer pies,  curious nuns, and more sweep Jolene, Miranda, Frankie and Violet on a "girls weekend" beyond their wildest imaginations. Ultimately, our women must decide if they're going to give up who they thought they were - defined by the small town repression, the familial responsibilities, the patriarchal expectations - for who they were meant to be: Women who decide their own fate.RUNNING WITH VIOLET is a story that is at times violent, always adventurous, and very often romantic. Expect to be holding your breath at the end of every episode.WHO ARE WE?We are Rebecca Davey and Marie-Claire Marcotte, the leads of the show and founders of the production company SHE SAID FILMS. We have been creating together for ten years. We have big dreams for our company, each other, young girls who follow our lead...and the world!  She Said Films creates content for TV, Film and the Digital Space with strong women in our stories and behind the camera. We like how they say it over at Tello Films:  “we advocate for women (mostly) who are allies, mothers, daughters, bosses, explorers, dreamers, doers, go-getters, go-get-hers, lesbian, bi, undecided, complex and fluid.” THEMES!One of the important themes of the show is women breaking free— can a woman/person break free, what happens when they try—not to mention when there’s a kid in the mix. Breaking free with a toddler is its own thing entirely. IMPACT!We want to bring the complex female experience to the screen. We have lots of aspects to us as women!! We are not just a device to complete the male story, right?! We are full and complete human beings with stories to tell all on our own. And times are changing and gender equality is on the agenda, but it takes time for real change to happen. Most of the content in today's media is still about men and being made by men. If you make a donation to Running With Violet you're supporting the proliferation of female content around the web. Phew! WHY DO WE NEED YOUR MONEY?We are 75% funded after winning a Canada wide competition. We need your support now to get to the finish line. Our remaining 25% will fund the really fun stuff!******ACTION PACKED SPECIAL EFFECTS ******                                    Typically women get asked to make ‘relationship’ movies and men get the superhero action packed adventures. We want to do both of those things in our series. The relationships are important but so is the action! But to bring you action we need a bigger budget. Our array of stunts will include:
car chase
combat
use of firearms
cop cars
gun wounds
special effects
blood
 With this last 25% we could achieve the shots we dream of (example: get the cop car to make the wide shot realistic), hire a bigger production design team, invest a little bit more money in wardrobe, be able to hire all the background talent we need to sell the story--all the little things that add up to the quality of show we think you deserve! OUR TEAM!Rebecca Davey is a lead in the series as well as one of the creators. For the past two years she has taken films to the Cannes Film Festival along with Marie-Claire. In her spare time she works on her Masters of Creative Writing and takes care of her two daughters, one of whom will be appearing in Running With Violet. Rebecca is an avid eavesdropper – watch out! Marie-Claire Marcotte is a lead in the series as well as one of the show creators. Her first web series ON THE HEATED FLOOR was an official selection at ITVfest and at the Raindance WebFest. She is also producing and acting in the feature film Pippa and the Bees written by Rebecca. She is originally from Saskatchewan and fluffy croissants make her really happy. Lindsay MacKay is directing the series. She is a graduate of the prestigious American Film Institute. Her film Wet Bum premiered at the Toronto International Film Festival in 2014. She splits her time between LA and Toronto. She’s had two perms in her life.  Jessii Vee has made a name for herself on her wildly successful YouTube channel which boasts over 650K subscribers. She is making her acting debut in Running With Violet! Did you know Jessii does her own graphics? Violet is...well Violet. She is Rebecca’s daughter and super excited to be acting alongside Mama. She is full of smiles and lots of zany turns of phrase. We can't get enough of this 3-year-old! Guy Godfree is the Director of Photography for the series. He is a member of the Canadian Society of Cinematographers. His most recent film Maudie premiered at Telluride and the Toronto International Film Festival and starred Sally Hawkins and Ethan Hawke. He’s originally from Nova Scotia and will charm any woman or man with his accent. The multi-talented Michelle Irving is composing all the music for the series. She specializes in audio post-production including music composition, music editing, sound design & editing, foley, and mixing. She also DJs under the name dashussy. Michelle’s patterned ‘party pants’ make the whole “Running With Violet” team very happy.SO HOW CAN YOU GET INVOLVED IN OUR CAMPAIGN?

Donate a large amount.

Actively reach out and be a positive role model by showing a young girl how you take risks, sometimes fail, but always try again. This is what we try to model to Rebecca’s daughters and any young people we have encountered in our years of teaching theatre workshops.
Subscribe to our YouTube Channel.
Watch our show and spread the word!

YOU could spend the day on set with us or spend all day at the beach!    OUR COLOURING BOOK 'BE THE ZEN MASTER' PERK!Here are the four "Running With Violet" inspired original drawings that you can colour!OUR JESSII VEE POSTER PERK! On Revry, you can enjoy the Best QUEERATED Movies, TV, Digital Series, Music, Videos, Podcasts, and Music. 3. OML (onemorelesbian) YouTube Channel https://www.youtube.com/user/onemorelesbianThey curate the world’s lesbian film, television, and video content on one site. Thanks for reading and considering our campaign!

story:
Short Summary

  • I am D.M. Galloway, a young filmmaker from Brooklyn, New York.  In 2017 I will be receiving a Bachelor's in Fine Arts from the School of Visual Arts as long as this film is made.
  •  "A Bird In The Shadow," is a Twilight Zone inspired short film that follows actor Eric Wu during his final days on the set of his new movie.  Eric's father Jim Wu was a legendary actor who died under mysterious circumstances when Eric was young.  Since then, Eric has had premonitions of his own death as he continues his father's legacy.  Can Eric escape death and finish his latest film?
  • The money raised will go towards paying the eight actors, purchase the costumes and props, acquire the necessary film locations, and pay for transportation.  Contributors will be credited for their contributions at the end of the film. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • I need $4,000 to complete my film. Half of the money will be used for equipment, renting locations, lighting and transportation.  The rest of the money will be used to pay the actors and provide their costumes.   
  • You can donate any amount.   I am offering a DVD copy of the film to anyone who donates $20 or more to the film they will help to create.  Names of the donors will also be credited at the end of the film. 
  • I want you to know how much I appreciate you taking the time to read this presentation. 

The Impact

  • This film is going to break new grounds in independent filmmaking.  My plan is to get this film  played at film festivals so that it can get seen by more people and receive more recognition. 
  • Many of my films have been successful on and off the internet.  I've already worked with many companies and professionals to create some amazing films.  I was once recognized by Nickelodeon for a Ninja Turtles Fan Film in 2011.  Please go to LinkedIn for my resume.  https://goo.gl/KbGYo

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, please share this link to my campaign with your friends and family.  The more you share it the more it might help me graduate and become a full time filmmaker.

The money raised will go towards paying the eight actors, purchase the costumes and props, acquire the necessary film locations, and pay for transportation.  Contributors will be credited for their contributions at the end of the film.

You can donate any amount.   I am offering a DVD copy of the film to anyone who donates $20 or more to the film they will help to create.  Names of the donors will also be credited at the end of the film. 
I want you to know how much I appreciate you taking the time to read this presentation.

Many of my films have been successful on and off the internet.  I've already worked with many companies and professionals to create some amazing films.  I was once recognized by Nickelodeon for a Ninja Turtles Fan Film in 2011.  Please go to LinkedIn for my resume.  https://goo.gl/KbGYo

If you can't contribute, please share this link to my campaign with your friends and family.  The more you share it the more it might help me graduate and become a full time filmmaker.

story:
From the Ground Up

Joe Carbonell didn't start in golf in the usual manner. He wasn't given his first putter on his third birthday. He didn't practice all night through high school so that he might get a scholarship to Stanford. Joe, like many of us, started late,

After a lifetime of meandering, Joe was introduced to the sport that has vexed so many of us in our waking moments and in our dreams. But, unlike most of us, Joe is a quick study, and quickly became a master in his craft. 

In a few short years, Joe went from GNC Manager to scratch golf instructor to head of the Myrtle Beach Junior Golf Acadamy

More so than his dedication to golf, his devotion to his family is what drives him and inspires him.

 

When asked to give to his community by teaching and nurturing young minds, he couldn't help but answer his call to service. His passion, more than golf, is in seeing his students achieve all that they never knew possible.

Time to Give Back

 

Joe has given so much, I believe its time for his community to give back.

Please donate any amount you can: one dollar, five dollars, ten dollars.

What I can give in return is my unending gratitude. 

When Joe finds out about this, he'll be embarrassed, he'll try to say no, and, eventually, he will say thank you and win the Brooklyn Open.

Brooklyn deserves Joe as much as Joe deserves this. Marine Park was Joe's stomping grounds before he moved to Myrtle Beach to make a life for his family.

He's beaten me there, many times, and he'll beat anyone else on his home course.

For each donation, I say thank you. For each donor that enters an email address, I will send a picture of Joe Carbonell, downloadable via email, of him hoisting the cup over his head, with his loving family smothering him in adulation.

Please Remember:

You can give without loving, but cannot love without giving.

Give my boy some love!

Thank you.

-Michael

story:
Short Summary

The Queen and the Dead follows the life of a young drag songstress, Viola Corona also known as Florentino. Viola moves from San Francisco, California to Mexico City to follow her dream of becoming the next international female pop star only to discover the zombie apocalypse has just begun. Through the support of amazing friends, Viola discovers that her voice has the power to hypnotize zombies. This film chronicles Viola’s hilarious butt kicking adventures to stardom.

 

The Queen and the Dead is a homage to all superheroes who inspire us to be better human beings. Viola reminds us to be true to ourselves no matter our ethnicity, sexual orientation or gender identity. The film is a tribute to victims of hate crimes and dedicated to two close friends of Hector who were killed for dressing in drag and being openly gay. In 2005, after a night out in drag, our friend Amancio was tortured and murdered in Yuma, Arizona. His body was found five days later. In 2006, another friend Paul was stabbed multiple times in his home while he slept.

Viola’s story gives us hope and strength through the darkness. The Queen and the Dead encourages us to follow our dreams and overcome obstacles that get in our way including the flesh eating undead.

Who we are

We are a devoted and hard working team of artists who have a passion for dance, theater, drag queens and zombies. Together we have over 25 years of experience in performing and making art. Antonio Ortiz (director/screenwriter) has a BA in Comparative Literature from the University of California Berkeley. Antonio worked for KPFA/Pacifica Radio and Berkeley Public Access TV for 15 years. He’s a man of many hats. He can do everything from radio and TV production and post-production to technical support. Antonio is also an accomplished dancer.  Hector Zavala (producer) has 19 years of experience in theater and film production in the United States and Mexico. 

Back in 2014, our project made a successful theatrical debut as a play in the Home Theatre Festival in Oakland, California. The Queen and the Dead short teaser was screened in San Francisco on February 21st, in San Diego on February 24th and in Mexicali, Mexico on February 27th to excited audiences who loved the film and most importantly wanted to see more.

What We Need and What You Get

We need $250,000 to complete the feature film. Funds will cover production and post-production expenses like film equipment and crew, sound engineers, location permits, make-up artists, costumes, special FX artists, and contributor perks. Our film will feature up to a hundred talented actors, dancers and star-studded cameos. The incomparable Mexican actress, Aida Pierce, known for her work in telenovelas and sitcoms and the one and only Heklina (formerly known as Trannyshack) drag queen and entrepreneur from San Francisco are on board! We are also thrilled to have renowned composer Lawrence Rush produce two original songs for the film score. Scene Runner app is sponsoring our rehearsals by creating a special link for our actors to rehearse and run lines.

We assure you that each and every dollar contributed will be put to good use. Here is a graph breakdown showing how the money will be spent: 


Please take a look at the short film, The Queen and the Dead. We produced this 21 minute short with a week of preproduction, 3 days of filming on an iPhone 5s, producing 1 cover song, plus 2 zombies for a budget of $ 5000 USD. Don't you want to see what happens next?! Imagine all the zombies, special FX and original songs we can create your with support. 


In order to reach our goal, we offer special gifts as a thank you for your contribution. Our protagonist Viola Corona is a well-rounded artist, photographer, body painter, singer and songwriter. We've partnered with visual artists and designers to create a series of unique items and promote their work under Viola Corona's brand. We have two t-shirt designs that blend pop culture and iconic Mexican influences.  We have a wide array of awesome limited edition Dick Pic and Clit Pic calendars featuring original paintings by Viola Corona. We also have songs, mugs, stickers and more.

          

Impact

It’s a cult classic in the making. Your contribution will bring the first drag superhero zombie slayer to life in a feature-length motion picture. We are relying on you to help Viola save the day one stiletto heel stab to a zombie head at a time. In a cold world that is antagonistic toward gender nonconforming people, we cannot envision a better hero than a drag queen.

Drag queens, which include artists of all sexualities and not just gay men, delve into the art of drag as "a creative outlet, a means of self exploration, and a way to make cultural statements." (Wikipedia) Drag queens, along with others in the LGBT activist communities played a major role in protesting police brutality during the Stonewall Riots in New York. They refused to be arrested for fully expressing themselves and not conforming to oppressive gender norms. (Wikipedia) Move over Superman and Wonder Woman. It's time for a new hero- Viola Corona the Queen of the Dead!

Risks and Challenges

The main challenge is producing an international film with our ultra low budget. The Queen and the Dead film budget is a fraction of a typical Hollywood film. Our production schedule includes filming in California and Mexico over the span of 28 days in September 2016 and four months of post-production. The film will be completed by December 2016.

Our biggest and most exciting challenge is creating a Bollywood inspired scene with 100 backup zombie dancers in Mexico City, Mexicali and San Francisco, flash mob style. “Be a Zombie” contributors are invited to act in the scene. “Director for a Day” contributors will help us direct our gang of zombie dancers. We look forward to having you make this scene a success. Check out our list of additional contributor perks.

Other Ways You Can Help

1. Please support The Queen and the Dead by telling your friends and asking them to spread the word as well.  We need our film to reach as many people as possible and any promotion you can do is greatly appreciated. 

2. You can be a hero too! Get involved with your local LGBTQI community organizations, the National It Gets Better Campaign, and the Trevor Project.

3.Please watch and share the short film of Viola’s epic story (below).

Cast and Crew

budget is a fraction of a typical Hollywood film. Our production schedule
includes filming in California and Mexico over the span of 28 days in September
2016 and four months of post-production. The film will be completed by December
2016. 
Our
biggest and most exciting challenge is creating a Bollywood inspired scene with
100 backup zombie dancers in Mexico City, Mexicali and San Francisco, flash mob
style. “Be a Zombie” contributors are invited to act in the scene. “Director
for a Day” contributors will help us direct our gang of zombie dancers. We
look forward to having you make this scene a success. Check out our list
of additional contributor perks.
Other Ways You Can Help

1. Please support
The Queen and the Dead by telling your friends and asking them to spread the
word as well.  We need our film to reach as many people as possible and
any promotion you can do is greatly appreciated. 2. You can be a hero too! Get involved with your local LGBTQI community organizations, the National It Gets Better Campaign, and the Trevor Project.3.Please watch and share
the short film of Viola’s epic story (below).
Cast and Crew

story:
Our Film

Within the world of The Chameleon, the allure of Hollywood has worn off, long ago replaced by the vapid nature that lurks beneath the parties, auditions, and lies being spun to "make it big." In this forlorn landscape, our titular hero — a failed actor — finds himself on the verge of breaking free of Los Angeles and moving on from the industry altogether. Yet, as he takes the first steps to do so, the city both literally and metaphorically attempts to block his escape while all the while, his grasp on reality slowly erodes.

Blending dark comedy with atmospheric drama, The Chameleon seeks to challenge as often as it entertains, begging the central question: once people learn who they truly are, is it possible to change? Eerie and inspiring all at once, the film sketches an idealistic version of the Hollywood limelight over the revealing backdrop of the industry's darker tendencies to great effect, both visually and narratively. In the process, The Chameleon pits naivety against guilt, intention against inaction and ultimately, "the self" against the self one wishes they could be. 

Our Team

To create this vivid world on screen, a talented team of artists came together to lend their passion, skill and vision.

Stephanie Phoutrides (Director/Producer): Stephanie fell in love with filmmaking after a series of memorable productions with her siblings, including such favorites as A Crime Best Forgotten, Cluedo, and Save the Globe.  After her first serious endeavor producing a documentary on competitive Greek folk-dancing, Stephanie went on to study film in college.  Upon graduating, she moved to Los Angeles to pursue filmmaking and currently works at a studio in development.

Alex Hanno (Writer/Producer): After trying his hand at writing in elementary school, Alex fell in love with the craft and made it his life goal to share stories with the world from then on. Upon entering the English program at Tufts University, he found himself drawn toward a focus in film studies and screenwriting and after joining the school's daily newspaper, The Tufts Daily, worked his way up to the role of editor for both the Film and Television beats. After graduating, Alex moved to Los Angeles to pursue screenwriting and film production full time. He has since written and produced a number of short films, including Australia's Tropfest submission, The Tramp, and has received wide recognition for his feature comedy script, Fairly Certain, including the credit of Semi Finalist in both the Creative World Awards and Screencraft's Comedy Awards. In addition, Alex works as a script reader for select production companies in Los Angeles.

Gianluca Malacrino (Lead Actor): Born in Cardiff, Wales, Gianluca began training as a performer at 19 years old under the instruction of Rebecca Hardy at the Actors Workshop in his hometown. After securing nominations for his lead roles in short films Managed and Couple Confine at the Cardiff Mini Film Festival and Camarthen Bay Film Festival, Gianluca made the move to Hollywood to pursue his passion full time and has since graduated from AMDA College & Conservatory for the Performing Arts. His latest work includes a lead role in the Robey Theatre Company's professional production of the Pulitzer Prize winning play, No Place to Be Somebody and a part in an upcoming project directed by Francis Ford Coppola, titled Distant Vision. 

Website:  www.gianluca-malacrino.com
IMDB: www.imdb.com/name/nm7282594

Michael Greenwood (Cinematographer): Michael Greenwood is a Los Angeles based cinematographer with a deep passion for narrative filmmaking and a keen eye for visual storytelling. At a young age, Michael began working with the camera, crafting home videos and short films for school projects. From there his passion grew, eventually leading him through training to become a full time director of photographer today. His credits include cinematography for dozens of short films, music videos and commercials as well as the feature film, Life. In addition to his own film projects, Michael also works on larger film sets in both camera and G&E departments. 

Website: www.michaeldeangreenwood.com
IMDB: www.imdb.com/name/nm5910701/?ref_=tt_ov_dr

Our Goal

Thus far, the team behind the The Chameleon has ushered this amazing project through pre-production, casting, and all principle photography, but to get our short to the finish line, we're going to need your help. As you can see from the clips and stills in our video above, The Chameleon is finally starting to come together, but there are still a slew of post-production elements that need to be completed, such as constructing the visual effects, cutting together the footage, mixing the sound, and composing a stellar music score. What's more, after the film is complete, we're planning to take it around the festival circuit, submitting to competitions domestically and internationally. Of course, in order to get The Chameleon to that point cinematically and then cover submission fees and other outstanding costs, we're asking for your support in raising a total of $5,500 (or more!).

After seeing the passion that has gone into our short film thus far, it means the world to all of us here that The Chameleon gets completed the way it deserves. As with any piece of art, it's vital to us that The Chameleon is shared with the world, for it boasts a simple, albeit thought-provoking theme (i.e. identity or the lack thereof) that pushes viewers to really look within for an answer. With your help, we know we'll be able to share our story with the broadest audience possible and for that, we sincerely cannot thank you enough.

~ The Chameleon cast and crew

story:
What's the Story?

Justine and Daniel are your ordinary, chill, college couple trying to enjoy a party. For them, this means beer and intellectual discussions about Spongebob, sexuality, and furries. Things are going great for Justine and Daniel-- that is until Nose-Ring Nina, the girl notorious for only talking about her nose ring, shows up and prevents the couple from escaping her self-centered conversations. As the night goes on, we witness Justine and Daniel’s humanity, as well as their sanity, slowly degrade as they try to be polite to the socially oblivious girl. Blood, Chex-mix, tears, and frozen yogurt--The Girl With the Nose-Ring is a revolutionary short comedy that may end up changing your perception of life, love, and social norms… But probably not.

So, What's the Point? 

The Girl With the Nose Ring is a celebration and case study on all of the obnoxious, oblivious and socially awkward people you’ve ever encountered:  The guy who has 20 tattoos and explains their origins to you even though you’ve just met him, the girl who shows you pictures of her Airdale Terrier even though you stopped caring after the 2nd shot, the person who sells you knives. These people are as inevitable as death and taxes.  In our film, they take the form of Nina, or “Nose-Ring Nina” who loves her piercing more than anything and makes sure we never forget it.

Jason Gong and his team of filmmakers are seeking to craft a quick-paced and witty comedy inspired by their favorite films, directors, and awkward situations. Every dollar you donate will go toward making The Girl With the Nose Ring the best film it can be and ensure that our cast and crew won’t die of starvation.

Who are these People?

Jason Gong – Director         

Jason just graduated with a degree in Information Systems from Drexel University, but his secret passion has always been making movies and hanging out with the weird (but cooler) art kids.  From writing various short films, to covering TriBeCa red carpets, to puppeteering on multiple projects, Jason has done everything he can to immerse himself in the world of filmmaking.  Now, he’s excited to direct his first film, and grateful for Victoria for allowing him to adapt her terrific script and to Kevin and Tanya for helping him through creative decisions and being his collective rock.

Kevin Quinn – Producer

Kevin has been making movies since he was in elementary school. From recreating the JFK assassination on his hometown street in Glen Head, New York, to filming in the High Desert and the isolated woodlands of Central Maine, Kevin’s passion for filmmaking has led him to write, direct, produce, and assistant direct several short films while also pursuing a Film and Video Production degree from Drexel University. Kevin is indebted to Jason Gong for giving him the opportunity to work on this project and he hopes that you will see through to contributing to this worthy production. 

Tanya Gandevia – Producer

Tanya has been passionate about creating art since she can remember. From painting Indian culture, to photographing the hectic life of Hong Kong, to working as a Key PA on Death House (2016) in Philadelphia, PA. Her adventures in the creative world have given her great experience on how to produce and assistant direct. Tanya is excited to help make Jason Gong's first film come to life.

Victoria Abbott – Writer

Victoria grew up in small town Missouri where most of her time was spent watching t.v., reading, and making up her own adventures. She now embraces her lame sounding childhood as something that has helped mold her as a writer of short stories, screenplays, dope tweets, and a published collaborative novel. Through the wonders of the internet, a creative partnership was spawned through her screenplay being found worthwhile to produce by Jason Gong. Both he and Victoria strongly hope you also find this project worthwhile.

Where is My Money Going?

The largest obstacles we face as a production are obtaining the funds necessary to sustain our cast and crew while also being able to transport our gear through the do-or-die streets of Philadelphia.  Much like our main characters, our team mostly consists of smart, talented, and broke college students. Every contribution is wholly valued and it is your donation that will help make this film become a reality. 

Other Ways I Can Help?

We understand that not everyone can donate. That's fine. What you can do is spread the word. Exposure is key to a successful campaign and if you want to see us reach our goal, please tell your friends, family and co-workers to check out our page. We appreciate any and all support.

story:
Synopsis

Set in the early 90's, Pillow Talk is a live action short film about the friendship between childhood best friends Cara and Lucy, growing up and growing apart. 

It takes place during a sleepover at Cara's house. Over the course of the night Lucy instigates an increasingly not so subtle trap to get the truth out of Cara. She suspects that Cara has feelings for girls rather than boys and she is determined to get the truth out of her, even at the risk of damaging their friendship. As the night draws on cracks start to appear in their friendship that was once so tight. And the night has surprising consequences for both of them.

pillowtalkfilm.com

facebook.com/PillowTalkShortFilm

#PillowTalkFilm

Storyboards by Ellie Penner-Bright

The Cast

Ashleigh Cordery will play Cara

Ashleigh is originally from Worksop, South Yorkshire but has lived and worked in London for the past year. She is very excited to be working on 'Pillow Talk' as she loves strong female lead pieces and enjoys making truthful and honest art that reflects real people. She hopes to bring a sense of strength and humor to Cara.

Miranda Horn will play Lucy

Miranda is a London based actress and has recently graduated from Fourth Monkey Theatre Company. Since then she has worked with The Almeida Theatre's Young Company playing the lead role in their production of Little Eyolf. She has recently finished filming the lead role in both an independent film (Us Five) and a Pilot ( Where We Stand). Miranda is really excited to play Lucy in Pillow Talk as she is a 90's girl herself! 

The Team

Writer & Director | Louise Marie Cooke 

Louise has a passion for stories featuring strong but complicated female characters that feature at the centre of the narrative, something she feels is lacking in mainstream cinema. Her films have screened across the world at International Film Festivals such as Frameline, Mix Festival Brasil and Brooklyn Girl Film Festival. Her last two shorts, SIREN and FIRST BITE have been shown at the highly regarded London Short Film Festival and Underwire Festival which champions female cast and crew. louisemariecooke.com

Producer | Natalie Sutton

Starting her journey in the film industry in 2014, Natalie is currently finishing her degree in Film and TV Production at the Westminster Film School. She has been specialising in Producing since this time and has produced a range of shorts concentrating on complex relationships. Her last short “Shuffle”, which she produced played at film festivals both here in the UK and oversees.  Throughout this time she has also been a 1st AD, Production Manager, Script Supervisor and a Locations Manager. She enjoys taking productions from script to screen she whilst working with new like-minded passionate creatives. Having worked on both shorts and feature films she knows the importance of dedicated crew to bring a story to life.

Director of Photography | Dagmar Scheibenreif

Having started her journey in Stills Photography in 1995, Dagmar is an extremely versatile and unique image creator with a true eye for detail. She is an HSE underwater camera operator and a Divemaster focusing on Narrative, Beauty & Fashion, as well as Music Promos. Born in Vienna, Austria, Dagmar has worked worldwide, combining her love for travelling and meeting new people with her work. Dagmar’s open approach to her craft, her constant striving for perfection, as well as her ability to capture the essence and highlight the beauty of an image or scene, is what makes her stand out as a visual director and cinematographer. dagmarscheibenreif.com

Editor | Neil Fergusson

Neil's credits include films which have screened at numerous international festivals and factual television programming. In the last two years, he has worked in the world of 3D, delving into the past with Brian May’s Brief History of 3Dand soaring high with the prime time SKY series Britain & Ireland from the Sky. He recently I finished editing Kulajo: My Heart Is Darkened; a feature documentary made with Emmy award winning filmmaker Gwynne Roberts. Set in Iraq, it is an emotional journey, detailing the human tragedy of the 1988 Anfal. neilfergussoneditor.com

Composer | Victoria Wijeratne 

In 2011 Victoria was the Film Music Composer for short film First Bite which was directed by Louise Marie Cooke, this film also won her Best Composer at the Underwire Film Festival in 2011. The Best Composer award at Underwire lead her to be Film Music Composer on British thriller feature film The Liability(directed by Craig Viveiros), starring Tim Roth, Jack O’Connell and Peter Mullan. Victoria composed the score for Siren, also directed by Louise Marie Cooke, whom she recorded with the Bergersen Quartet and other talented musicians. She has recently finished doing music for Colours of The Alphabet a documentary directed by Alastair Cole based in Zambia and was invited to Berlinale Talents (as part of Berlinale International Film Festival) as a 2015 sound studio participant. vwijimusic.com 

More crew at: imdb.com/title/tt5964452

What We Need & What You Get

Although Pillow Talk has already been shot (10 Sep) we absolutely need to reach our goal to cover our production costs and more importantly post-production costs. We need to raise enough money so that we can finish the film and truly do the story and the hard work of the shoot crew justice. 

We have a whole array of perks on the right including of course a preview link to see the film before anybody else! Postcards, stickers and credits and lets not forget that warm fuzzy feeling inside of knowing you are supporting UK indie filmmaking!

Risks & Challenges

We are doing things a little unusual in that we plan to film Pillow Talk just before our crowdfunding campaign ends, despite needing the money raised here on Indiegogo to pay for the equipment, props/costumes and of course post-production.

  • We are taking on the risk of doing things a little unorthodox because we believe so much in the film. The main risk is the post-production will be significantly delayed should we not reach our goal and what really want to do is share the film with audiences like you!
  • Please help support this project and help us raise the money needed. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand not everyone is able to offer monetary contributions but there are many ways you or your company can offer 'in kind' support.

What we're looking for:

  • Share our campaign on social media @deadflowerfilms #PillowTalkFilm
  • Are you a post-production house that could offer us a free grade? 
  • Do you have a website or big social media presense and would you like to write a blog, feature or interview about Pillow Talk to help raise awareness of our Indiegogo campaign?
You can contact us at pillowtalk@deadflowerproductions.com

* Associate and Executive Producer perks do not grant creative control over the film. The film will remain the copyright of Dead Flower Productions in its entirety.

More crew at: imdb.com/title/tt5964452


What We Need & What You Get
Although Pillow Talk has already been shot (10 Sep) we absolutely need to reach our goal to cover our production costs and more importantly post-production costs. We need to raise enough money so that we can finish the film and truly do the story and the hard work of the shoot crew justice. 
We have a whole array of perks on the right including of course a preview link to see the film before anybody else! Postcards, stickers and credits and lets not forget that warm fuzzy feeling inside of knowing you are supporting UK indie filmmaking!


    Risks & Challenges  We are doing things a little unusual in that we plan to film Pillow Talk just before our crowdfunding campaign ends, despite needing the money raised here on Indiegogo to pay for the equipment, props/costumes and of course post-production.  We are taking on the risk of doing things a little unorthodox because we believe so much in the film. The main risk is the post-production will be significantly delayed should we not reach our goal and what really want to do is share the film with audiences like you! Please help support this project and help us raise the money needed.     
Other Ways You Can Help
 I understand not everyone is able to offer monetary contributions but there are many ways you or your company can offer 'in kind' support.
What we're looking for:  Share our campaign on social media @deadflowerfilms #PillowTalkFilm

Are you a post-production house that could offer us a free grade? 

Do you have a website or big social media presense and would you like to write a blog, feature or interview about Pillow Talk to help raise awareness of our Indiegogo campaign?

You can contact us at pillowtalk@deadflowerproductions.com

* Associate and Executive Producer perks do not grant creative control over the film. The film will remain the copyright of Dead Flower Productions in its entirety.

story:
"Spider-Man: Wrath Of The Goblin!"

We are going to be making a full on fan-film based upon Spider-Man and his journey after being bitten as well as Harry Osborn's journey into darkness as the psychotic villain, Green Goblin. We get to see Peter Parker as he gains the confidence to ask out the girl of his dreams, goes through trauma, loses his best friend and motivations, loses his way, and and tries finding hope. This web of a story introduces not only the Green Goblin but also Wilson Fisk also known as the Kingpin. This film hints at bigger plot points with subtle Easter-eggs and name drops to countless comic book stories. In this (approximately) 60 minute long fan-film we get to see the relationship between Peter and Harry, Gwen, and of course his aunt and uncle. The cast for this is what is called a "rolling cast" where besides the official cast of the main characters, we will fill roles as the project rolls along. At the time of making this the script is finished, and a readthrough with the main cast has happened. We are all very eager to start production. We hope that you are as excited as we are!

What We Need & What You Get

How much are we asking for and why?!

We are asking for $3,000. Our goal is to only take the minimum amount of equipment to make a feature length Spider-Man story. Here is what we need for this film:
-Costumes
-Props
-Set Dressing
-Location Permits (not always but sometimes)
-Makeup
-Food for Cast/Crew
-Box Lights
-Clamp Lights
-Diffusers
-Bouncers
-Shotgun Microphone
-Boom Pole
-Stabalizer
-Shoulder Rig
-Work Lights
-Audio Recorders
-Camera Operator Pads
-Crash Mats
-Blue Screens
-Green Screens
-Green Screen Stands
-Blue Screen Stands
-Jib/Crane
-Camera Light
-Audio Cables
-Headphones
-Lenses
-Batteries
-Memory Cards

Perks!

  • $1 - High five, if we ever see you!
  • $25 Get a T-Shirt!
  • $50 - Thank you video from our Spider-Man actor in his suit! 
  • $75 - "Wrath Of The Goblin" T Shirt!
  • $100 - Signed Green Goblin concept art

Why "Spider-Man?"
Message from the writer/director:

As a huge fan of BOTH Marvel and DC comics, the wall crawler has always been part of my life. I have dreamt of making fan-film type projects my entire life, I even used to pretend to do interviews about directing a super hero movie when I was little. Why Spider-Man? I remember my brothers watching the animated series from the 90's, and that is when I first became interested in the character. I picked it up and fell in love with Peter Benjamin Parker and all of his triumphs and struggles. He was the every-man superhero, and I loved that! The older I got, the more I looked toward him and his stories, and being in high school, I found myself often relating to him. The chance to bring any of that to life, even if it's just a fanmade film, would bring great joy to myself as well as everyone else working on this project.

Meet The Leads

Takoda Sorvillo/"Peter Parker"

 

Paul Thelen/"Harry Osborn"

 

Emma Moore/"Gwen Stacy"

 

Lucas Hall/"Wilson Fisk"

 

Joy Williams/"May Parker"

Risks & Challenges

Whenever working on any sort of film or series there are bound to be many obstacles. Most of which will be spontaneous and expense related. For instance we could have a costume malfunction that needs to be fixed, a prop or set piece breaks, the need for another piece of film equipment, or even just re-shoots can be a monetary hassle. We have some money set aside in the budget just for these sorts of things, and luckily with my theatre background I have many connections in the theatre world to help fix a problem that can't be fixed with something I have in my "utility belt" of options.
If you notice we are also using flexible funding, however if we don't get a certain amount for mics, cameras, green screens, rigs, etc then we will not take out any money. We will not take money unless we are able to create what we set out to do. If needbe, we can cut certain small moments in the story that have less of an effect, or even just cut equipment and find alternatives. But we will never take your money if we can't give you the product we intended.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Just because you may not be able to help out monetarily doesn't mean you can't support this project!

    • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
    • Make sure to use the share tools built into the site here!
    • Tell you're friends about us!
    • Even subscribing to our channel "NerdTalk Productions" will help support what we are doing: Click me to head to the channel!

    Thank you so much for your support!

     

    *"Spider-Man: Wrath of The Goblin" and it's creators are in no way affiliated with Sony, Marvel, or Disney*

Other Ways You Can Help
Just because you may not be able to help out monetarily doesn't mean you can't support this project!

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
Make sure to use the share tools built into the site here!
Tell you're friends about us!
Even subscribing to our channel "NerdTalk Productions" will help support what we are doing: Click me to head to the channel!

story:
Synopsis

Twenty-three year old Miranda is a quirky, aspiring artist living in St. Kilda, Victoria. After discovering a pamphlet for a local art competition, she has three days to create a masterpiece in order to make her dreams come true. To have her own art exhibition. 
With a lack of originality, Miranda struggles to create her own painting. With the help of a dog named Russell, Miranda is positioned to think outside the box in order to create her first original painting.

Funding Purposes 

The Art of Friendship crew are in need of funds to create the film's detailed and carefully planned look. The funds raised from this campaign will be used to create the look of the film through production design and to finance the sound design and composition. The production and sound design are crucial to creating Miranda's world and bringing the cheery, family aspect to life. 

Additionally, the money will go toward allowing us to have a dog on set to play the part of Russell. It will enable us to shoot the film within regulations and to spend more time perfecting each shot. 

The Impact

The impact the funding would have on our production is enormous. It would allow the crew to create a film without the restrictions we've had in the past, allowing us to spread our wings and create something truly worthwhile.  

The Art of Challenges

The film is not without it's challenges! We are working with a dog for the majority of the set, something we are yet to experience. However, we are filming tests and rehearsing as much as possible. 

Support Us! 

We understand not everyone can support the project financially! Give the Facebook page a like to keep updated on the film. 
Facebook - The Art of Friendship. 

.
